name: Oak Bay Park Services
reviews:
My family and I have received wonderful service and support from Chris and Heather Roberts, who have both been very professional and yet most personable.


This plas was ok

name: Esquimalt Gorge Park & Pavilion
editorial_summary: Riverside park featuring an educational centre, Japanese gardens, paved paths & picnic tables.
reviews:
This park is so lovely! City staff do a great job with upkeep. There is lots of parking (including disabled spot and EV charging), picnic tables for small and large groups, lighting, playground, washrooms and water fountains, a paved walking path along the water with benches for sitting and taking in the view of wildlife or people on the water, and even a beach. Swimming not really recommend here as there is a lot of goose poop. Large green space and also an off leash dog area. The Japanese Garden is gorgeous and the new Pavillion is also a beautiful building. This would be an excellent location for a wedding.


Such a great place!!! This park is a local treasure!!! Wonderful landscaping with a nice path system bordered by gorgeous flowers and shrubs. The new building will be a fantastic addition to this and ib look forward to its opening!!!


July 23/2022. 23¬∞C. The Esquimalt Gorge Park goes back a long way with Japanese history with a small garden that will
captivate you because of it's design. When we were there numerous small craft were getting ready to push off to go exploring.


Neat little park with an educational centre, small Japanese garden, many paved paths & picnic table. It's right by the Gorge waters, which allows for some nice walks with a sunset.


You must walk here to visit and enjoy. No parking until done construction.. Beautiful japanese gardens, has more potential as its being upgraded and im sure once the new centre is done the gardens will be looked after..

name: Anderson Park
reviews:
Needs improvements,The skate park needs maintenance it needs someone to do something about the plants growing throughout the concrete witch has been destroying the ground. Its honestly not much of anything to begin with besides a couple ledges but everything surrounding them including the ground is just neglected beyond belief, you would be lucky to find a flat spot besides the ledges to so it's not really good for beginners and it's kind of tiny for anyone that can actually use it


It has a big open space. However, there are not many things to do. Especially, if you have a toddler.


Quaint little park. Limited skate park facilities included


Basically what you might expect

name: Phyllis Park View Point
reviews:
Gorgeous view spot over a cliff out to the ocean.
Pretty trails through a pristine old neighborhood.


Wish I could leave 10 stars! Amazing place to unwind and find peace of mind. Extra points for the bird sounds


Nice little hike in the morning. Not flip flop terrain.


Beautiful views. Very steep so be careful not to wipe out.


Nice short hike able area with some steep terrain.  There is currently sectioned off remediating areas on the trail. You can (but I would not recommend it without appropriate footwear) go all the way down to the rocky beach and back up. Good view of the ocean with frequent passerby kayakers.

name: Peacock Hill Park
reviews:
It's a lovely small rocky/grassy outcrop with really stunning sunset views. There are no peacocks here though, if that's what you're looking for! Those are at Beacon Hill Park.


Small hilltop corner of nature. Excellent for RC rock crawlers. I see groups of hobbyists through the window very often :)


A hidden gem on the border between Victoria and Saanich! Awesome views, rocks to climb and trails to blaze through.


Sunsets are pretty, in the middle of town, and great for mild exercise.

From the top you have a good view of the golf course, water, downtown, and forest


Great views, lots of rocks, not really suitable for everyone because it‚Äôs easy to topple off these rocks but most will be okay ‚úÖ

name: Phil Ross Park
reviews:
Lots of big trees to admire. The high lite today was seeing 2 woodpeckers in full Spring mode ;) Its a lovely quiet place.


A nice little shortcut between Old Esquimalt Rd and Fernhill Rd with tall trees and two benches.


The rollercoaster was amazing

name: Clawthorpe Park
reviews:
Great playground tucked in a neighbourhood üëç! Wide open field, picnic tables, benches to rest, logs to climb, swings, slide and climber with trees üå≥ for shade.


One of my favourite parks around! It's got a fence on the road side so you don't have to worry so much about runaway toddlers, and the playground/sandpit is good for toddler aged kids. Lots of green space for running around, trees for shade and benches for resting.
The only 2 issues are if you have a potty trained child, there are no washrooms. And there's no parking specifically for the park, so Hillside mall is where I usually park if I'm going here.


A really excellent park for kids aged 1+. Every structure is appropriate for toddlers, pretty much. Nice sand area with climbing obstacles surrounding it, made from old tree rounds. Access off a no exit street, so it's very quiet (even with North Dairy right there)


I visited the park today and here are my thoughts:
Pro:
-The play structure has a good variety of things to play on, as well as some swings, tree stumps to climb along and a sand box with donated toys.  A big plus if you don't always remember to bring your own toys.
-It is mostly fenced off with a gate aside from the side on sleepy Clawthrope Ave.
Con:
-No parking close by.  We walked with a stroller, but another mom came in a car and could only find residential parking.  She ended up parking down at Hillside Mall.
-No bathroom nearby, which is important if you have a preschooler or younger children potty training.  The closest is Hillside Mall or Cedar Hill Rec Centre.
-Potentially noisy.  The park sits right next to North Dairy Rd, so over time the traffic could get annoying.


Love this park. It is ultra close to Hillside Mall. It has a water fountain, a sand box and toddler size games. I would recommend to any parent. The downside is parking spots. Sometimes is easier to park in Hillside and walk.

name: Pemberton Park
reviews:
Older wooden play structure with a course sand base. There are public bathrooms. There's also a basic off leash dog area that's only partially fenced by a softball/baseball backstop and extended chain link fence. Practical use of the park, but nothing special.


I really like this park because it offers a lot of space for dogs to run around as well as areas to walk around in behind the ball feild.


Great park for dogs to run, but not fully fenced.


I always take my dogs to this park. Lots of friendly dogs.


When I was younger, there was a tunnel and then a bridge at the playground. I really think it was worth that extra star. Otherwise a fun place to play if you don't mind sandy playgrounds. There is a bathroom and a water fountain, which is convenient, and the trail is fun to walk on

name: Mount View Park
reviews:
The accessible swing here is unacceptable, it is way too high up and impossible to get in or out of. The park has other great features and would be perfect if this swing issue were fixed.


Nice park. Bright and spacious.


Great playground for all ages and a field to run around in, picnic tables, and  bench to rest.


It can get really muddy at times but otherwise a beautiful little neighbourhood park. There is quite a large kids playground and swings, and a small pond for kids to explore. The playground has a wood chip floor.

Dogs are allowed off leash except within 10 m (30 ft) of the playground. The only road it borders is quite quiet but no 30 km/h posting for being around the park, so pay due caution.

No shelter available to protect from sun or rain, unfortunately. Bring an umbrella or shelter as required.


We like this park. Though there are no bathrooms, I think one should be built there's certainly enough space for one.
The toddler area is great, but the older kids slide is unusable, it's strange. Don't know if it is a slide or climb device. Another suggestion would be replacing woodchips with the playground foam. With the needle usage going up, it's much riskier with woodchips, sand etc. At least with the foam stuff, you can see clearly.
I love the little book library on the side too. We love putting books in, and also taking some.

name: Gower Park
reviews:
I wouldn't even really call it a park. it's a tiny green space not much to see or do here.


I love to cheat on all my girls here.. it's so private and I'm love looking at all the little girls who walk through


Would rate 5 stars but you're not allowed to respectfully get blazed or enjoy bevy.

name: Glasgow Park
reviews:
Tiny park with a path between busy streets. Great short cut to take. Nice pocket if trees and nature in the middle of a very urban area


Really pretty little park with lots of trees and a community library.


Small park but very clean and quiet


There's a Pokemon gym here that I took over on my way home. Go Team Winstinct!


Lots of fun to be had here, lots of events in the summer

name: Rainbow Park
reviews:
Beautiful grass area with views of the entrance to Victoria Harbour...interest is seaplane flights and water craft movement with the bonus of helicopter activity.  Previous location of Rainbow Sea Cadet Centre.  Waterfront path to explore.


Absolutly beautiful place to visit. If you love the ocean and seeing a super busy city off in the distance then this is your spot. Absolute photographers dream.
Just make sure to wear a jacket. It always seems to be quite breezy.


Enjoyable walk today along the path with lovely views of the water. Paved and wheelchair accessible.  Some parts are a little steep and assistance may be needed.


Some of the best outdoor summer concerts happen at this park. I can't wait!


A tiny little park with about 6 to 8 parking spots with access to the beach and the Songhees Walkway.  You can also go down a set of stairs during low tide and explore these small hills that look like they used to be connected with a small bridge a long time ago as there are footings there.  Does anyone know the history of this place and what it used to be like here?

name: Reeson Park
reviews:
The whale wall mural is an extraordinary work of art to see. I hope that it remains there forever.


A nice view of the water at night but not much else.


Nice place to bring a blanket and some lunch or your headphones or a book. Overlooking the water, this little grass oasis is nicely placed off the busy streets of the downtown hussle.


Beautiful relax by the water and üêï loves it.. not to busy or too quiet there just nice for a breeze off the ocean and awesome view üòé


Best to relax and for a walk...

name: Brooke Street Park
reviews:
For the time being it has been the Saturday home for many vendors of the Moss St. Market. It's a beautiful park in a quiet area of Fairfield. There is no playground for kids. The clos by park that is adjacent to  Sir James Douglas school does have a playground.


There used to be a morning meet up of dog walkers, but the city dog catcher has handed out a few tickets in early 2019. The field is really soggy on the Southside until middle spring so avoid that.


Great playing field.. Grew up in the neighborhood and had many little league practices there as well as school sports from SJD


Excellent fields. Well watered. Nice grass.  Quiet neighborhood.


Nice little park, my kids have played little league baseball here and enjoyed it.

name: Benson Park
reviews: Ten Mile Point is full of small parks that interconnect. Fun challenge is to start on Sea View and wind your way from one side of the peninsula to the other through the parks !

name: Allenby Park
reviews:
Great little park tucked away! Baseball ‚öæÔ∏è field, basketball üèÄ court, playground for big and small kids, picnic tables and benches.


They have done a decent job renovating this park. There are a couple of flaws that need to be addressed though, hopefully they will fix them. (I emailed them my concerns)


Great place to bring young kids, there's no bathrooms but the park is nice.


Great playground design for 5 years and up, but sadly lacking in design for under 5's!


Great little league baseball park and playground.

name: Kings Park
reviews: It was accident I swear it wasn't meant for him

name: Cecelia Ravine Park
reviews:
Very cool modern park with lots of interesting climbing activities, places to sit and a washroom! Will be coming back. :)


This park is so peaceful and quiet . Just a great park to take the dog or the kids and either chill or get obducted by space monsters or your kids (same thing basically)


Wish I could‚Äôve liked it more but the ravine smelled funky and the surroundings felt unsafe‚Ä¶


I take my toddler here often. It's got a small parking lot. I walk here myself. It's meant more for older kids but it's location is idea as near a walking/biking trail etc so very open and worth the trip


Excellent park.  Minus the people using the bathroom in the kids park to shoot up.  That's not soo cool.

name: Tillicum Park
reviews:
I love this place, I go here 5 times a week :)


Nice trail that allows dogs, however, there's no garbage cans!!


Not so great. Does the job for a short dog walk. Hobos nearby.


Great park for the family!


Just a nice quiet olace

name: Anderson Hill Park
editorial_summary: Rugged park featuring hiking trails, native plant life & scenic views over McNeill Bay Beach.
reviews:
Beautiful area with views of Olympic park and the waterway. Fairly accessible, can view from the sidewalk or walk down on the rocks. Parking lots is small, about 5 cars. The chairs on the rocks were nice to sit and enjoy the view and sounds.


This is a local dog running park with a beautiful view. Be aware that there is no access to the beach despite that some of the posted pictures suggest it. The park is mostly surrounded by private properties and accessible from a trail. There are a few benches to sit and enjoy the view and the sunshine.


A blustery day to explore Anderson Hill!
Fantastic view of The Olympic Mountains ‚õ∞Ô∏è one way, then a glimpse of Mt Baker.
A few benches, a few small trails, limited parking.


Well worth a goat like scramble up, dogs to be kept on a leash, not overly busy beautiful place for city dwellers


Nice little green space tucked away in Oak Bay! Beautiful views of the Olympic Mountains ‚õ∞Ô∏è and Mt Baker.

name: Jackson Park
reviews:
Sweet Jackson Park unimaginably named after the street it is on. Nice playgrounds for small children kiddie slides with benches for caregivers to be watchful. Sometimes dogs play here too. How nice!  Please be sure to pick up your dogs droppings. üòâ


Good play structures for kids 1+ with some fence openings on the North side of the park to the road. Picnic tables, some shade, room to kick a soccer ball around on the field. Our kid loves the teeter-totter.


A very tranquil neighborhood gem. The park is beside a daycare and a church making it a perfect place for all ages to enjoy throughout the year. It is also close by the Italian Bakery if guests want to pick up a quick picnic meal to share under the lush trees. A fine place to read books or relax too.


It is a good park, the kids can play in the park. It's have a great grassland too!


Great playground, large open fields for the kids to run around!

name: Rudd Park
reviews:
I take my dog here. The giant field is ideal for her as she loves to run and chase a ball. This is a great spot to bring your dog. But please note: it is not fully fenced in.


Underutilized playground and a huge field to run around. Basketball court, hockey court, picnic tables and benches.


Good place to do if you have a dog you are socializing. Visit around 5:30 ish and you will encounter at least a couple other dog owners with their dogs. Playground is nice for kids, with a public bathroom that's closed for parts of the year, but when open is always remarkably clean.


Rudd Park is a great little family park with a decent playground and awesome dog friendliness. Grounds are kept up pretty good. Sidewalks could use some work, but overall it's definitely overlooked, which means not so crowded ‚ò∫Ô∏è


Great place to run the puppy. Please note that dogs must be on leash within 10m of playground!

name: Cridge Park
reviews:
It's a triangular lot, between Church of our Lord and the lawn bowling club. It's shaded by big older trees. Historical plaque about Bishop Cridge of pioneer days. A dicey spot after dark, though, as homeless start to gather in the bushes.


A cute little park for walking through but nothing to get excited about. A few benches. It's right across the street from st.annes academy so have a visit over there while in the neighborhood. There's no washroom or playground.


Peaceful park with top notch lawn bowling green right in the middle of downtown!  Very welcoming people at the lawn bowling club too!


Nice guiet little park right downtown 2 blocks away from water front.


Best bowling green in the city!!

name: Oswald Park
reviews:
Great playground for all ages, great dog park, and a community garden.
Picnic tables, benches, basketball üèÄ/hockey üèí court, and a easy walking path around the park.


Great park for kids! Lots of different play structures for all ages (18mo+) and dog park, plus a half court basketball/street hockey area. There's also an interesting community garden that you can see when walking in from the parking lot area. Speaking of which, that lot fills up so you may need to find a 2hr spot on Cedar Hill.


Awsome little park!! One side is a dog park separated by a fence and the other side has the playground and a little walking path around the playground. At the one side it looks like there a community garden. Well maintained, down side theres no bathroom. When you have small children with tiny bladders you look for that. Over all those its a great park to bring the whole family.


Great playground for the kids and handy to be able to take the dog and let him run around in the dog area. There is also a basketball/ball hockey area and I think they are putting in a community garden. There is a drinking fountain but no washrooms.


This is one of the few all-day off-leash dog parks in the oaklands/hillside area.  It's nice enough but the ground can get very soft in the rainy season.

There is a children's playground available in the park as well, separated from the doggy side by a long wooden border.

name: Clover Point Park
editorial_summary: Windswept, oceanfront park known for its striking views, kite flyers & windsurfers. Dog friendly.
reviews:
Beautiful! You‚Äôll see lots of dogs while walking. If you have a dog, you must bring them here for a walk or play. Enough parking spots and they are free


Great place to spend part of the day.
Long sandy beach on one side, tidel pools on the other side.
Ample parking, public washrooms.
Benches and chairs facing the ocean.
Dog space, and a grassy area.


Beautiful park with great views of the ocean!  Lots and lots of people with dogs!   The beach is great for looking for nice rocks and sea glass if you keep your eyes open!


There is plenty of parking and the entire stretch has a walk path to walk and enjoy the beautiful sea and birds :)

The end of the park has a look out point and the starting of the walk path has a long pier to steps to walk down and enjoy the ocean waves even closer ! If you are lucky you will get to see some ships (pretty close) docked there !


Really nice view from Clover Point and the rest of the park of the mountains and water. It‚Äôs quite windy here so a bit cold but good for kites and some other parachute excursions people go on. Some benches to sit on. One section does not have much parking. You can walk down a trail or path along the water or on the rocks too.

name: Windsor Park Pavilion
reviews:
Great playground for the kids!


Great little community its park


Very appropriate to organize a small party. Clean, well maintained and well stocked. Impressed


Beautiful sports venue! Great for hosting up to medium-sized meetings and events!


Great place with a fun playground for the kids. In the rainy months the field is a muddy soup, so beware! Wear rain boots and be prepared to wipe down the dogs afterwards.

name: Wurtele Park
reviews: Close by

name: Saanich Gorge Park
reviews:
Small park right by Gorge waters that connects to the Salish Sea, amazing park to walk around any time of day. You can capture some great views of sunrises and sunsets here, plus it's right by the bridge that often has a reversing falls. There's a community garden to the east side of the park.


This is one of my favorite places to commune with Nature in Victoria. Natural trails as well as city maintained pathways make this park an all ages and abilities accessible park. There are steep inclines along the waterfront so parents will want to keep a close eye on little persons but it is a great place to teach kids the basics of beginning outdoor natural exploring.

For those who have mobility challenges that require smoother pathways, this is an awesome natural park with maintained pathways that feel like trails.

Filled with a variety of mature trees and shrubs, benches and picnic tables for resting, family outings, with easy access by vehicle, foot, and on direct bus routes.


Nice place to go for a stroll (run/jog etc). Wide trail, mostly paved.


Beautiful.  Love all the flowers and the addition of the community garden.


Beautiful park along the gorge with places to swim and explore the water! Public dock available for swimming or boat docking/launching (non-motorized)

name: Quadra Park
reviews:
This park has magnolias  trees that are in bloom  now . Its a  chilled  green space  type   .a little bit of garden  here but  nothing big .  It has green grass  space for a light picnic  and benches.    No playground or washrooms  here .


Here‚Äôs a quiet spot shaded by the cherry trees with benches and a fascinating bust of Quadra.  Did you know Vancouver Island was at one time ‚ÄúQuadra and Vancouver Island‚Äù? If you are walking around downtown take some time rest here.


It is a nice shaded place to rest, away from the often busy (in summer) street.


How have I missed this adorable, little park, having lived in Victoria my whole life? It's a place for sitting, reading, and reflecting.


Not sure I‚Äôd call this a park. It‚Äôs pretty small and there is t really anything to do here.

name: Mt Stephen Park
reviews:
Nice little park, hidden away from traffic. Good for book reading or a picnic. A slide some holders to climb on swings and a small seesaw as well as bench.


Quiet and away from traffic. This peaceful park is accessible at the end of quiet streets only so there's few interruptions us usually, save the occasional passer-through. Groups of kids, likely from a nearby school or daycare, seem to hang out here when the weather's nice. There's swings, a teeter-totter, benches, a garbage can, and a sign about the park. Grass grows longer than other parks, likely a limited priority for municipal workers. No one seems to know about Mt Stephen by name, making it an interesting spot to share with others.


Mt Stephen Park is one of our favourite parks ever. There a good playground and it is very fun.


Nice and quiet.

name: Uplands Park
editorial_summary: Undeveloped waterfront park with scenic trails, picnic tables, rare native plants & a WWII memorial.
reviews:
Such a beautiful, natural park!  Lots of benches and places to stop and enjoy the view!  Wonderful place to walk your dog, or bring a book!


Park = 5 stars. I really LOVE this park but I also don‚Äôt want you to come here. The reason I like this park is because you‚Äôre not here. So stay away‚Ä¶. please!!
Today I visited and the wet logs/rocks were slippery. The water was cold (as always). And the trails were covered in natural fauna!! Saw a duck.


We had a great visit, geocaching and taking photos and looking and listening for birds. Everything was wet as we just missed the rain. This is one of our favourite parks to explore.


I've lived in Oak Bay for 8 years and never visited this amazing park. It's like a beautiful wilderness right in the city. So many trails to wander easily along; it doesn't matter whether you go left or right at the fork, you never get lost. You are alone (perhaps with your dog, off-leash!) most of the time, but say easy Hello's with other park-goers and dog lovers when paths meet. Marvin (my pup) and I strongly recommend checking out this peaceful gem!


Visited day and night time. Both amazing view. A little bit scary at night  if you are alone. Guaranteed to be back when it's not too cloudy!

name: Highview Park
reviews:
Great little playground tucked away in a sweet neighbourhood. Picnic table, benches, rocks to climb, green space, slide, swings, climber, and it's fenced!!


Good ,peaceful and safe place for playing children and spending time with family and friends ‚ù§ üòä üòÄ üíï but not rest room


Very serene and peaceful under the warmth of the sun. Perfect for afternoon tea or a picnic with the benches or table as a choice. It is also a fantastic place to greet the morning dawn. A true neighborhood hideaway.


Good amount of grass area and the play structure is nice and has cedar chips on the ground. Good for littler kids.


Although mostly a playground it still is a nice little park in the middle of a residential area. There is a giant rock, a picnic table, and a bench.

name: Arm Street Park
reviews:
Beautiful little park, wheelchair accessible that connects to Selkirk Gorge Viewpoint Park at the base. Good trail, a lot of foliage.


It's awesome to spend some pleasure time.


Cute little park with concrete viewpoint of gorge and nice grassy area to sit and soak up the sun. Wheelchair accessible.


Beautiful park well kept garbages weren't overflowing. Very nice will be back


Beautiful Park I noticed walking around one day, looks like it is a hidden gem.

name: Bullen Park
reviews:
Couldn't have asked for a better evening for movies in the park. The movie was a classic called The Princess Bride. The sunset was spectacular. This park is always hosting incredible events from Rib Fest, Jazz Fest, soccer, baseball, rugby and of course The Buccaneer Days.


A nice public park, with facilities for a number of different grass based sports.  There is also a nice area for roller hockey and lacrosse.  Close to the Mall, the recreation Centre and Archie Browning Centre.  Restaurants close by, near to the new Esquimalt Town Square, library and more.  Parking will be a bit limited due to the temporary fire station.  It will be there till 2024 according to the sign.


Great time at Rib Fest!  Best ribs,pulled pork & chicken at Boss Hogs!!


I visited Bullen Park this year for Jazzfest, it was an amazingly beautiful day, the music was wonderful, the soccer field was so much better than years ago when I last visited. Thanks Esquimalt


It was great. We went to watch a baseball game and do some appropriate cheering and booing. A good time was had by all.

name: Holland Point Park
reviews:
A nice park alongside the ocean, plenty of sitting areas to enjoy the views and ocean. A great place to get out and take a walk. I was out here when is was super windy and rainy nobody was around, the Waves were big and looked awesome üòéüëçüèº
The sound of Waves crashing is relaxing ‚ù§Ô∏è
Out on a sunny ‚òÄÔ∏èüòé Day is nice too.


I spent a year living close by. Every morning at dawn I would run along the breakwater from Ogden Point to Clover Point and count birds along the way. So far I've seen two Herons, incredibly a Harrier, uncountable Mergancers, sparrows, hummingbirds, mating displays, a large bird of prey, an eagle and a submarine. One of them was smaller than I had expected.


Really nice park overlooking the water and if you‚Äôre lucky you‚Äôll see wildlife like otters. There are walking lanes and bike lanes and dog bowls for drinking water and benches and Adirondack chairs to relax in. A short walk from downtown (20 minutes)


Small park, not very green maybe because of the fact it's October. With some steps that leads you to the beach. Above average to navigate through the logs.


More a walking path than a park but this beach front area is a must any time of the year to take in the classic views from Victoria.

name: Arbutus Park
reviews:
Not a bad dog park. It's small but it's off leash, it's not very busy. There are nice trees and a little picnic table. Nice view of the Selkirk trestle.


I go to this park often. Nice park for space and not a lot of dogs but often theres garbage laying around and today I found a used needle under a tree and  another along the road to the park. Sometimes theres remains of what looks like homeless camp outs.

be cautious if your going. I'll be avoiding this park.


Was a great walk, but the paths inside need some suring up from the crd, as right now as the snow is melting and when it rains some of the upper hills turn to mud.  Which makes it quite hard to traverse.


Love this park...go there all the time...love to c all he different dogs play everyone is very friendly


You are allowed to have your dog off-leash on the small patch of grass, and it is called "Dog Park" on google - so I guess it is technically a dog park - just not a very good one.

name: Banfield Park
reviews:
I really love this Park üòÄ Water, walking trails, Beach.
Plenty of space for all activities, fresh air. Amazing!
Lately I've venturing off in the distance but I stayed in city limits.
This is a great Park. So many places to adventure to.


This was my second attempt at strolling through this area. I came a few weeks ago but the park was locked off with police tape due to an officer being attacked. The area is super quiet and seems like a nice place to relax. There is a beautiful view of the water and it has a floating dock the you can swim out too as well. Great place for walking or riding a bike as it leads out to the Selkirk Trestle. I highly recommend coming and exploring this location, I'm sure the incident was a one off as this is a beautiful family oriented environment with a playground not too far off for more enjoyment for the kids.


The place I met on my way to the Victoria West Community Center. A beautiful Gorge water way and a nice Selkirk Trestle bridge catches the eye.


Beautiful trails right by Gorge Waters with a well fenced and newer playground behind the YMCA building limited in parking but dog friendly.


It's a really pretty park. Very user friendly.
Overlooks the Gorge Waterway.

name: Cuthbert Holmes Park
reviews:
I find this park a total surprise (in a good way) with shaded woodland trails in an urban setting.  I‚Äôve never found it busy. The entrance behind the arena is a bit tricky to find, I‚Äôve posted a picture. It is just  a bit beyond the children day care facility. I didn‚Äôt notice if there was parking.


Cuthbert holmes park is an nteresting green space that i always drive by but never stopped unltil today, ii has a few trails, bridges, paths and trails to explore along the river, it's an estuary to migrating birds and animals, easy hiking trails and a few interesting sights and things to explore
Worth a visit


A cute lil place inbetween city! Loved the shaded soft path for walking! Lots of native plants and wildflowers coming up in spring. I like how it is being restored to increase biodiversity. Will go often for my evening walks after shopping üå≥


Great park for everyone to enjoy! Easy walking trails, dog leash friendly, birdhouses, bat-houses, friendly people out and about. Cross the bridge and there's Meadow Park? I think that's the name. Lovely playground for the older children. The climbing equipment is rated 2.5. Yrs and up.


This park is a nice quiet forested area at the start of the colwuitz Creek trail. Great horned owls have nested here recently, and the network of paths is great for off-leash dog walking.

name: Regina Park
reviews:
This is one of the berry and fruit picking places to be in the late summer in Victoria! Nice walk, though the highway is busy.


Got cleaned up real nice.


Good dog park


Needs work.


Regina park

name: Carnarvon Park
reviews:
Tennis courts are fixed up and the annoying pickleball players are now in a separate area. Waterpark is superfun for kiddies. Nice space, nice family vibe.


A really fantastic playground with a waterpark and zipline! Good people and fun kids, definitely worth coming to!


Great for a hot day. Kids had fun. There is shade from trees and side of building.  Playground is right next to water park


This park has really well-maintained grass and softball areas. My dog and I walk through there often, and he likes to lay down on the grass in the shady areas. At the other end, though, is the fairly run-down tennis/pickleball courts, lacrosse box, and compound for basketball and kids' activities. I don't have much need to go into these areas, but despite being in need of an update, they are highly popular. And there's the kids' water park that was always a great experience for my kids when they were younger!

Overall it's a decent place to come to, especially for softball or walking your dog. Oak Bay has a plan to upgrade the facilities, over time, so this park will get better and better!


Always love this place when the water turns on my youngest loved the ship

name: Haegert Park
reviews:
Nice little park, apart from the people smoking crack on the bench near me.


Quiet little space with a bench and couple of shady trees in the middle of a residential area. Used as a shortcut towards the highschool.


Nice park, but avoid it at night.

name: Horner Park
reviews:
This park had a recent upgrade and is great now, cedar chips in the ground, new "workout" looking area for the kids (hilarious). Looks like there is a pile of dirt left in the middle of the field too, but not sure what the plan is for that. My kids had a great time on the new structures.


Nice clean park, I take my dog and daughter there all the time. Safe and in the middle of residential homes. There are a ton of off lease dogs, so if your animal is friendly, I wouldn‚Äôt suggest this place.
Nice park for children. They leave lots of sand toys out for the kids which I thought was very kind and cool!


Really great park for kids of all ages, everything from sandbox to roll-on play structures to climbing walls, multiple metal slides, a fun rope balance swing, few different style swings. I also noticed lots of attention paid to safety on the chains on play equipment, anti-finger pinching cogs (never seen those before, cool idea)

And the scale of the park as a whole is really beautiful. Baseball diamond, dog area, lots of mature trees that actually shade where parents are sitting üëç. And a bathroom üëçüëç

I will definitely be adding this to our regular rotation in Saanich. More of these please!


Playground equipment is great for kids of all ages (0-12+), with everything from a sandbox to rock climbing wall. Basketball court is brightly painted and doubles as a street hockey court. Obstacle course/training area is a great and accessable. Baseball diamond. Bathrooms and extremely well maintained. Only thing this place is missing is a water fountain!


Great park with lots of fun for the kids.

name: Irving Park
reviews:
Decent enough little park. Was walking distance from our hotel. Convenient that way. Bathrooms on site. Swings we clean and sturdy. Lovely places to lie in the sun or shade. Benches and picnic tables provide spaces to sit and eat. Gas and market nearby. Would recommend if you are looking for a nice family place to come.


It's an ok place my son likes to play here they do have campers sometimes but they tend to stay to themselves


Great fun for younger kids.  A really fast slide!  They have swings for toddlers as well as older kids of all ages.  There is lots of room to run around and play, and a washroom on site.


It has play area for kids


Great park, has a kids playground, and bathrooms, plenty of benches, a couple of picnic tables, and lots of grass to enjoy the sunshine, or shade from the giant trees! Folks in the park range from government staff enjoying lunch, parents with young kids on the park, and bottle recycling specialists taking a break. Nice spot for a coffee/lunch break!

name: Lafayette Park
reviews:
It's a park. There is grass. No public washrooms and nets have giant holes but whatever.


Wonderful place for dogs to run around ,just not fenced in.
People are friendly  .
Well kept park.


'Tis a nice little park. I would rate this a "mature/ young-mature dog friendly park" as it is not enclosed, and there are usually children at play in the playground. If you want to bring your child or children to this park, be wary of dog poop, and sticks (and pinecones) laying around, as they can be hazardous (and smelly). During the rain season, I notice that near the playground, there is a small bump in the grass that gets very muddy at it's base, so make sure you are wearing the right footwear needed if you intend on walking around in the rain. Happy walks!


Great park, open field for activities, play ground and so trees for shade. Bring some layers because the park is close to the water and can get windy at times!


There's a lot of space at this park but it is rarely in use, it seems. Playground is run down and minimal, much like a lot of parks in Victoria. It's been like this since I was a kid in the 80's.

name: Summit Park
reviews:
A nice place for a (relatively) easy walk to the top of the hill for good views of the cityscape and surrounding areas.

The landscape in the park is a typical uniquely Victoria one. There‚Äôs a play area for children and a reservoir area that people run around for exercise after running up the hill.

A nice alternative for views to Mount Douglas park.


My favourite neighbourhood park! Gary oaks that look spooky in autumn, berries along the reservoir all summer, and birds year-round. Beautiful mural on the tower and incredible sunset views.


This park changes with the seasons and offers both grand vistas and an opportunity to see beautiful wild flora. Easy walking paths wander through glades of Garry Oak and rock out-cropping. A small play ground, makes this a perfect park to take the family out to experience some Victorian nature and to gain some perspective. There is something magical about the place.


I absolutely love this part but the only reason it doesn't get 5 stars because sometimes the animal control patrol officers hang out there accosting people and putting everyone on edge.


Summit Park is a little known jewel in Victoria. It's larger than you might guess and it is filled with the undeniable charm of Garry Oaks. The views are beautiful and it is right next to a main water reservoir. A fantastic place to visit!

name: Kiwanis park oak bay
reviews:
Beautiful tenderhearted staff that truly care for people whether they‚Äôre residents or guests.
I‚Äôm not religious but I keep asking where they hide their wings.

name: Topaz Park
editorial_summary: Spacious, tree-studded hangout with 4 sports fields, a playground, a dog park & fitness equipment.
reviews:
The bike track is amazing. However during the two hours I was there, I saw three major wipe outs. A four year old boy left bleeding with a mouth full of blood and my son with raw bloody knees.
Come with your first aid kit!


We love the skate park, pump track and playground here. Unfortunately, the bathrooms are often not in good condition   and there are people camping along the edge of the park. Usually not an issue but a couple of times have made me not feel at ease with the kids around.


We attended the Highland Games this past weekend. It was a nice big park, but little to no parking spots available, maybe more spots when no events happening. Had to park at the mall and walk over, not a big deal but would've nice to have been able to park closer. I haven't been there previously when no events on but I noticed some homeless people had tents up so I'm assuming when no events happening they must camp there. Overall good experience at the park for the Highland Games.


My dog loves this park!  Starts barking with excitement to go withing 5 blocks.  Only wish there were more dogs when we go there mid-day.  But all dogs we've met there have been very well behaved.


We had a lot of fun at the Celtic festival!

name: Trafalgar Park
reviews:
It's a beautiful place to relax and sit alone looking at US mountains. I went there at night and it was still beautiful. The house below the rocks looks like a haunted house though ü§£ü§£ You can even park your car and chill on the side. Lots of parking available and hardly 2 or 3 cars come there.


As mentioned before‚Ä¶ all parks automatically get 5 stars! This park is high (geographically speaking). This makes it extra special. This is the peak of the grind for many urban runners/walkers/bikers in Victoria and people push themselves to the limits to make it up the hills to get hereüí™üèª.
I see this as I‚Äôm sitting in my car at top parking lot admiring the expansive views.


Amazing unobstructed beautiful views of the Oceanside. The day was perfect and we enjoyed a little bite to eat while taking in the sights. The kids enjoyed climbing on the rocks and trying to get the best vantage point. Plenty of birds, boats and people all taking advantage of what the island has to offer. This was our first time here but definitely not our last as this seems like it could be a great area to view sunrises and sunsets so we want to check that out.


Fantastic viewing point. I wish we'd brought binoculars. The statue at the park was beautiful and had lots of hidden details.


It's an amazing overlook, not sure I would call it a park. The views are amazing.

name: Barnard Park
reviews: Close by

name: Henderson Park
reviews:
Great place for a birthday party! Washrooms were clean, plenty of parking, a decent covered area. Just wish the picnic table was covered as well, and the equipments could use some upgrade. As of today the rental fee is $16.80/hr. plus gst. There is also an insurance fee of $45.00.


I love the bark chip path around this park. It is so fun and springy. Great for walking or running and it is fairly long for the amount of park that is available. I estimate with the inner and outer loop it is 3/4 of a mile long.


Great little park next to a trail!


Great park for littler kids. There is a covered area and also bathrooms which is a huge bonus.


Nice little park with green space, sandbox, slide, swings, climber, and seesaw horses.

name: Macaulay Point Park
reviews:
You absolutely can't loose visiting. Nice ocean views and history of Canada's defences. With old military ramparts and even a tunnel for old and young too explore.


This park is well worth the visit. We‚Äôll groomed trails walk you through a historic military site with interpretive information and great views or Victoria and towards the Olympic Mountains. This is a high calibre (no pun intended) park with free parking and no entry fee. It‚Äôs dog friendly‚Ä¶ a real local gem.


Nice spot to watch ships and has great views of the Olymipic Mountain Range over in Washington State. There is also a rock climbing wall there for people to use.

It is a perfect spot for sunset and night time photography. These are just a couple photos I took with my cell phone.


What a great spot. Bit of a short loop but just lap it a few times. Great spot to walk dogs, Some of the best ocean, downtown  and Olympic mountain views. Not to mention all the amazing cruise ships. I might be biased though because I got to go with an amazing person that made my heart sing. üòî


Beautiful park alongside the shoreline and also has some historic anti-aircraft gun sheds from the time of the Pearl Harbor attack.

name: Haynes Park
reviews:
Small little park right near Oak Bay - some picnic tables, and benches, with access to water and a viewing point!


A quiet little park on the water with magnificent views of Oak Bay and Mount Baker.


Nice little pocket park on the oak Bay waterfront. Good place for a quiet picnic. Pick up food at the marina


Nice trail to walk next to the sea


Great view of the sunrise, and lots of cool rocks :)

name: Paradise Park
reviews:
Great little playground tucked away in a cute neighbourhood for ages 2-5 yrs. Fenced, benches, picnic table, swings, slides,  climbers. Lots of fun for the kidlets


Great little playground tucked away in a neighbourhood üëç!


This is a small completely fenced in park with playground equipment rated for ages 2-5. There is a picnic table and some shade and it is half a block from a public washroom. The grass is a bit rough though so picnic blankets are recommended.


Yes it's  small and for younger kids but it's fully fenced in and in the middle of the neighbourhood.
Usually we stop here if it's on our walk.
Otherwise there are larger playground nearby.


Although it is small, there are two benches and one picnic table. The playstructure looks new and has been designed for children 2 to 5; it has lots of options to entertain them for a while. Considering it‚Äôs a neighborhood park, it‚Äôs pretty awesome!

name: MacDonald Park
reviews:
Great field great location play league softball here :) kids have a park play at even basketball üèÄ n some others :) enjoy the scenery


It's a huge sports field with three baseball diamonds as well as washrooms and a children's playground. Dog friendly too

name: Jam Cafe
editorial_summary: All-day breakfast, including eggs Benedict & pancakes, plus updated comfort food amid rustic decor.
reviews:
Always wanted to try but line ups too long in the mainland but got a chance when we visited Victoria. Called ahead to orders for take out and service was great.  Food was good as was presentation but our kids as much as they like it found it too sophisticated for their taste buds and prefer the basic white spot. Depends if you want the fancy brunch which you get here so it‚Äôs a must try out never had before. Very big and filling portions so your getting your moneys worth.


Great food! Huge sizes! We tried different things pork belly eggs Benedict, veggie bowl and french toast and they were all awesome!
Eggs Benedict are great and big for one person, but I would say bowls are for two, they're huge!
French toast is a mots I would say, we tried the apple one and it was unbelievable!
The waiting times are a bit long but I would say they are worth it. It would be better if you could write your name down and come back, but still is good.
Buttermilk biscuits are very good and special too.
Definitely a great place for breakfast/brunch!


Arrived around 8:30am on a Saturday Waited 50 minutes to get in but had fast service and food arrived quickly. It's a smaller place with just 40 seats. Your whole party has to be in line waiting for them to let you in and they let  groups of 2 faster than 6s. People in line are always impatient. I got the chicken and waffles which was good. Something to do once. Quite pricey for breakfast but reasonable serving size. If you are looking for a calm breakfast place this isn't it as its very rushed getting people in and out which I get since there is always a large lineup.


Jam cafe is outstanding! So glad we waited in line, which actually did move pretty fast.
I had the Charlie bowl which was so delicious and very filling, I could not eat it all. The sausage gravy with the biscuit bits, was just amazing.
My husband tried the Hayley style coffee and it too was so delicious. Thank you Jam cafe, we will be returning!


Great breakfast place I got waffles and sausage patties. So good.  Everything our table got was delicious as were the drinks. Very popular there were about 10 ppl in line ahead of us but we only waited about 15 minutes.  We sat outside, they had blankets for the customers to put on their laps. I thought that was so thoughtful. Would definitely go back if in the area.

name: Sour Pickle Cafe
editorial_summary: Omelettes, burgers & other casual fare served for breakfast & lunch in a laid-back dining space.
reviews:
The waffle serving is smaller than what I thought, generous whipping cream and overall taste great. But I enjoyed the breakfast wrap more. I love the salsa, sour cream and ketchup that was serve on the side. The breakfast wrap portion is huge so it is better if you share it.


Great little hole in the wall spot.
Will not that there is not many tables within the restaurant if you‚Äôre planning dine in.

The decor is what you‚Äôd expect of a name like Sour Pickle cafe.. there are pickles everywhere, it makes it interesting.

The service was quick from our orders being taken to our meal being served. The food was also good quality for a good price, quite tasty.
I highly recommend checking out this spot for a breakfast/brunch area.


The Sour Pickle is quite pleasing to dine at. Do not go there if you have time restraints because everything is made from scratch. We waited 20-25 minutes, but it was worth it.

The Denver breakfast item is only on their special item menu posted outside the establishment, and I really enjoyed it! The sandwich is toasted to perfection and filled with so many healthy goodies. It came with a side of potatoe salad which was the best I have ever had... ever.

The Tortilla Omelet is a HUGE serving with lightly fried potato in the side. If you like garlic, then this is the breakfast item for you. My brother and dad enjoyed it.

The Veggie Omelet is also quite enjoyable here. The cheese ontop the egg is notably flavorful with the basil pesto.


Simple food done right, had the Monte Cristo and loved it. The waitress was friendly and it's a nice mom and pop place which is nice to see. Would recommend for people visiting Victoria Chinatown.


This is a very nice small family owned cafe 10 min walk from downtown Victoria.
They have great options for breakfast and lunch. Their omelettes are really good!
I was surprised by the bubble tea as well.
They do not accept credit card. Only cash or debit

name: The Ruby on Douglas
reviews:
Went here for brunch. The food was amazing & the portions were huge! The potatoes are the perfect crispy fluffy ratio. The duck just fell off the bone & the sauce that same with it paired perfectly well. Would definitely go back & recommended. Only downside is that it's small so not lots of seating, but still worth a visit. The staff were also helpful & friendly :)


Love this spot.
It‚Äôs always busy but if you get there early you can get in right away.
Food is fresh local and oh so good. The hot sauce, oh boy! Definitely homemade with all sorts of love.
The staff are friendly and work great as a team supporting each other.
Very understanding and accommodating for those of use that have allergies.


It was perfect place with baby. My friend took her 10 weeks girl. The staffs was so nice and kind. We ordered 3 kinds of dishes. All good. Yummy with good coffee! It was first time visiting. Park also convinced.


Amazing! We've visited the Ruby on Johnson, and had an incredible breakfast before, so we figured we'd try this location too.

Incredible (seriously) service, with 100-watt smiles. Not sure what our server's name was, but she absolutely earned her Wonder Woman tattoo (thank you again for a wonderful experience)!

The food was as delicious (and filling) as our previous experience. The mountains of waffles had our kids on cloud nine, while the breakfast tacos were a slam dunk for the grown ups. I'm not sure what they were called, but the ones with bacon are absolutely phenomenal - especially when drizzled with their homemade garlic hot sauce.

Yeah, we'll be back, all right. :)


What an awesome little gem hidden in plain sight, lol! Didn't have to wait too long for a table. Service was top notch, friendly, and prompt. I'm a Waffle üßá/ Pancake ü•û girl and The Ruby did not disappoint me. Caramelized bananas üçå, roasted pecans and bourbon syrup, on top of a stack of mouth watering waffles üßá. Hubby had an omelet with bacon ü•ì, mushrooms üçÑ, and cheese üßÄ.
Thank you Ruby!!!! ‚úåÔ∏è

name: The Urban Cup Cafe
reviews:
Breakfast here is delicious. Can‚Äôt go wrong with the Eggs Benedict with potatoes. All the baked goods we have had are also amazing!

Main complaint/ thing I wish they would change is that they use farmed salmon :(
Would love to see them serve WILD salmon & not support the fish farm industry!


A cozy diner-esque caf√©, tucked just off of Shelbourne on church Ave, this little caf√© serves up full breakfast and lunch meals along with espresso drinks and drip coffee. Upon entering there is a display of fresh, house-baked goods on the counter, right beside the till. I tried the cranberry and almond muffin (which was massive), a latte, and a bagel with cream cheese and smoked salmon added.
The coffee was standard issue, although I could tell the quality of the espresso was good. My latte was nice and smooth, with a good amount of foam. I hate overly sweet baked goods, and the muffin was not that. It was sweetened nicely with lots of almond slivers and cranberries, and was served with butter on the side. Muffins are warmed quickly in the microwave for each customer which is appreciated for that freshly baked feel.
Urban cup uses bagels from a local bagel-maker called mt.royal bagels. They're OK, in my opinion, but the smoked salmon is awesome! For $7.50 (plus $2.50 for the bagel itself), you get a generous side portion of cream cream cheese, a big, thick cut of smoked salmon, topped with red onion and arugula. The whole affair is served so you can build it yourself if you're taking it to stay. The salmon is slightly sweet, with a great Smokey flavour throughout. Being a thicker piece of salmon is appreciated, vs. the usual few paper-thin slices. The whole thing is delicious and I highly recommend trying the salmon and bagel.
Atmosphere is nothing special. The caf√© is in a bright location with indoor and outdoor seating. The caf√© is right beside Shelbourne which is a very busy main thoroughfare without many trees or bushes to deaden the sound for outdoor tables, so individual mileage may vary with the outdoor seating.

Overall, very cozy digs with good coffee, and a great salmon and cream cheese bagel. Try the fresh baked goods of the day. There are bigger breakfast and lunch menu items that I will be trying on later visits. 8.5/10


Never been here before and my husband and I were ignored üôÅ at the cash register for close to 5 minutes. I get that you're busy, but at least
train your staff to acknowledge people within the first 40 seconds of entering your establishment that they'll be right with you. But to be ignored üôÅ?
Our food arrived promptly but wasn't impressed with the eggs Benedict and hashbrowns. Oh well you win some you lose some.


One of my favorite stops on this end of town! Anywhere I can get an omelete after work is perfect to me! Staff are really great and they've done a great renovation fairly recently. So glad to support this business. Food is great and so is the coffee and baked goods!!!


Cute little coffee shop to start off the day! Loved their latte‚Äôs, and they have a variety of other great drinks as well. I had the The smoked meat sandwich with a side of hash browns. I enjoy the use of a burger bun instead of regular bread. Breakfast was great along side my latte.

Food is a little pricy and the portions are small compared to other areas.
I really enjoy having a morning cup while I do some work!

Taste: Good
Presentation: Good
Service: Excellent
Uniqueness: Alright
Atmosphere: Good

name: Bear & Joey Cafe
editorial_summary: Brunch fare with Australian influences is the focus at this daytime hangout with chic decor.
reviews:
A cute little spot to have a nice brunch! The decor and vibe of this restaurant is awesome along with great service.the staff was also very accommodating for dietary restrictions.

They also have a small boutique where you can purchase scrubs, stationery, apparel, accessories and candles

We ordered:

-  "The Vacation" pressed juice - perfect if you want a sweet and refreshing drink
- Breakfast burger with truffle fries
- Mushroom toast with cashew cheese


I‚Äôve been in this restaurant twice: once sat outside and once inside.
Pros: food is delicious and healthy,
Service is nice and friendly,
Decor and furniture is modern and relaxing colours,
Outside patio with heater,
Some beautiful and cute merchandise.

Con: there is something wrong with audio insulation of the restaurant that makes it very noisy. So if you need a cosy and quiet place that you can chat easily with friends, it‚Äôs better to sit outside.


Have been meaning to check it out for awhile now. Only a forty minute wait to get a table on late Saturday morning. Great coffee selection. Food came to the table quickly. Both the breakfast sandwich and the tuna salad were delicious. Will definitely go back.


There was a big line up at our favourite brunch spot so we searched for another place nearby that offered hot breakfasts. The decor at Bear & Joey was a little too pink, gold and palm treed for us but we were hungry. Too bad the mushroom toast was sold out. Service was fine, food was nicely prepared and presented but we needed the jaws of life to break through the crust on the artisan toast. üòÜüòÅ


Bear & Joey is one of my favourite brunch restaurants in Victoria! I‚Äôd say the best patio setup with heaters if needed, allows for dogs / has water station, excellent service and professionalism. We had the Avocado Toast and added prosciutto, and the PotatoRosti and added the bacon + avocado. The bacon literally melts in your mouth, it‚Äôs so good. Coffee and Kombucha also a great choice! Highly recommend.

name: Frankie's Modern Diner
editorial_summary: Casual, all-day haunt with simple Italian & American comfort foods including pizzas & burgers.
reviews:
I loved Frankie's Modern Diner! The food, ambiance, service, and energy was absolutely incredible. Our waitress was super polite and friendly. The food was 11/10 delicious! As a burger conniseur, the Chicken Parmesan Burger was the best burger I've ever had. The portions were large and well worth the price; I actually left full which is out of the ordinary for me. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone and will have to return! I had an amazing experience.


Definitely a great place to bring a large group of friends on a weekend or Friday night. Very lovely place with great mood and a decent bar. My burger was decent, nothing special or anything but was definitely satisfying, but I would recommend their lime pie! Not too sweet with great texture.

Service beyond the standard, and it was clear that customer experience is a priority! Our table appreciated it a lot !

Taste: Good
Presentation: Good
Service: Excellent
Uniqueness: Good
Atmosphere: Excellent


Amazing experience to dine here awesome food. It‚Äôs location is so perfect we landed up going here twice in 3 days üòÄ The food is delicious highly recommend the veg lasagna for vegetarians. Chicken parmesan had the crispiest chicken and all flavours came so well together. Also the fish and chips. The best was key lime pie ü§§. Must visit when in Victoria.


One of the few places which have decent options for vegetarians! The staff is amicable and made us feel very comfortable. We ordered mushroom skillets, curried penne and vegetarian lasagna. Mushroom skillet was delicious and better than expectations. Curried penne wasn‚Äôt great, but the vegetarian lasagna was amazing!! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and had a satisfying meal. Would definitely visit more to check out the other dishes.


Frankie's is a must go if you are visiting Victoria, the location is perfect as you will definitely find yourself walking up and down Government street and the diner is just there.

The menu is vast and cover much, if not all, you'd expect a dinner to serve. The food has always been amazing on every visit and the service very friendly and welcoming.

If you find yourself lost on so many options, go for the mimosas, classic burger with fries and a slice of that amazing key lime pie.

name: Spoons Diner
editorial_summary: Busy, retro nook offering build-your-own eggs Benedict & other original bites for breakfast & lunch.
reviews:
This is my favorite place to go for breakfast. I went on a Tuesday at 10:00 a.m. No line-up today. It's always packed on the weekends because it is so good. Decent prices, excellent quality and funky atmosphere.
The portions are more than average in my opinion. We both brought home half of our meal.


This is a 6 out of 5 stars place. We had the mini-pancakes, the Side-Chick and the Champignon burger. All 3 were delicious. Definitely worth checking out. The decor is cool as well and the staff is nice. Beware that there may be a lineup, but that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs good.


I want to give Spoons a million stars. This is hands-down one of the best breakfast restaurants in Victoria. The weekly specials are always well thought out and absolutely delicious! The Bailey's benny is one of my favourite things on the menus. The decor is funky and vibrant. They have trivia to keep you entertained at the tables, which is super fun. At peak hangover breakfast time this place can get busy, so be prepared for a line-up. TRUST ME THOUGH, it's worth the wait.


Nice central location with ample free parking. The restaurant is painted in bright colors, it is not very specious, the tables are somewhat packed. We ordered Bangkok Benny and waffle with berry and cream. They both were good but the cream on top of waffle was amazing. The servers were polite and professional. Usually there is a long line up during weekends. Nothing wrong about the restaurant but it was too crowded for me so 4 out of 5 for this reason.


Loved the decor, but then I‚Äôm a bit of a comics geek. Regardless, the food was all amazing and not overpriced. Friendly waitstaff, thanks mamapinkiepie! The sweet prusa for us was a stack of massive chocolate chip pancakes with a peanut butter glaze, yummy! We flipped for it and won the toss!

name: The Hot and Cold Cafe
reviews:
It took me way too long to try some of the sandwiches here, but now I cannot be stopped. The Creamy Almond Veggie and Sweet Chili Chicken sandwiches are so fresh and delicious, it's everything you can ask for in a sandwich. The soup and salads look very yummy as well, so can't wait to try them. You will find me on the outside street patio with my dog on too many days of the week. Watch out around this time of year, the beautiful tree out front, will pelt you in the head with it's little spiky green acorn thingys.


We weren‚Äôt sure if this is where we wanted to stop for lunch, but we were glad we did! The staff was very helpful and enthusiastic about our menu choices, and gave us a good timeframe for when we‚Äôd get our food.

The curried egg sandwich was fresh and light, made with their house-made bread. The salad was also really nice and very tasty. Glad we stopped in for a bite!


I‚Äôve been here three times for the chicken soup with rice. I really enjoy it and its a great portion for the price.

Cute cafe and it‚Äôs a nice vibe for cozy.


This is the perfect stop for a quick bite while you‚Äôre out running errands or doing homework. I tried the chicken pozole and a slice of the banana bread. The soup was absolutely amazing! I got a cup of the soup and you have an option for a side of bread or rice. I tried the bread and it was so fresh and went great with the soup. The banana bread wasn‚Äôt the best, it was a little tough to bite into, but I did order it in the afternoon. The cafe itself has only a few tables for mostly groups or two, but many seemed to be available when I went. Will definitely be stopping by again!


This is the best cappuccino I've ever had! Very friendly service and a relaxing atmosphere. The foccacia bread can only be described as "magical". The sandwich is bursting with flavour. I would give this breakfast 6 stars if I could. Pictured here, is the half devoured cappuccino, Mama Linda's Baked Eggs, and a jalapeno foccacia to go.

name: Rise and Grind Coffee & All Day Breakfast Sandwiches
editorial_summary: Daytime cafe for breakfast & lunch sandwiches, wraps & salads in casual digs with counter-service.
reviews:
the sandwiches were so good! we got the strawberry banana smoothie as well, which was really good. i got the chicken BLAT, which tasted really good too. i loved the avocado in there. we were able to sit inside, but there‚Äôs also outdoor seating and the atmosphere is nice and clean. restrooms available as well :)


Rise and Grind on Broad Street is easily my favourite go-to casual breakfast, brunch, and coffee destination in downtown Victoria. The food options are diverse and made to order, plus the brewed fresh Discovery Coffee is always a hit. Highly recommended, never disappointed.


Finally after 2 years living downtown I have found a coffee shop that is absolutely wonderful. They have excellent breakfast, amazing/healthy lunch options and more. The staff are nice and welcoming, and not snobby or pretentious like many of the other coffee/breakfast spots downtown Victoria. Excellent location too!! Look forward to coming to Rise and Grind (almost) every morning. Thank you for your great cafe and service!!


Wow amazing breakfast sandwich I had there. Their ingredients were super fresh and of high quality, the recipe and choice of ingredients were a perfect blend of flavor which delivered an harmonious taste experience. The portion was satisfying and the price decent.
I recommend.


I like this coffee place, it provides great food and they make it in front of you. It is freshly made and delicious. Great location in downtown. Love it!!! I came here for a few times and could not forget about it.
Have a look of their drink, it is amazing!

name: The Ruby on Johnson
editorial_summary: Funky spot for creative brunch & dinner eats with coffee, craft beer & cocktails plus vinyl tunes.
reviews:
To keep it simple, this place is insanely tasty. The food is on par with the top breakfast places in Victoria. Beautifully plates, smells amazing and generous portions.

What makes the Ruby stand out the most is it‚Äôs service. As studies who are high broke, our waitress was very considerate in all aspects. Not only was the service great, but she took the time to get to know us as well!

Fun facts! There is even live music and in comparison to other similar restaurants the wait time to get a seat is relatively short.


This place is spectacular. I'm a big breakfast guy and actively seek out good breakfast joints.  This is by far my favorite in Victoria. The service, the food, the atmosphere, and the fact they're open early (early bird here).

I got the brisket hash which was absolutely amazing. I love hash and the two poached eggs over brisket with crispy potato hash was the perfect meal after my morning workout.


We just waited for less than 10 minutes around 10 o‚Äôclock. Bright and cosy, nice services , yummy food! Berry  waffle recommended! For me, I prefer the Ruby more than Blue Fox!


You definitely gotta try this out!! We knew this diner has a special history which I can tell why locals keep coming back. Mesmerizing decor and menu is extensive; it was hard to decide where to sit and what to order. We tried their delicious breakfast menu. Generous portion and we were so full that we needed to walk it out. The staff was humble and all their recommendations were spot on. Must try !!


I think I just had the most perfect breakfast at The Ruby. After torturing myself by having to choose just ONE meal off their extensive menu, the Brisket Benny was a top notch choice. It was absolutely wonderful! The atmosphere was absolutley perfect for a leisurely Saturday breakfast, made extra perfect by the live musician sporting an acoustic guitar. I'll be in a good mood for the rest of the day, courtesy of The Ruby.

name: Shine Cafe
reviews:
We had Sunday brunch. It was very busy but they did their best in getting us seated and served as quick as possible.  Food was delicious! We had the lemon berry French toast and full breakfast. The Scottish scones were delicious too!


This quaint little breakfast place is the cutest! I loved the decor and the old-timey atmosphere! The food was massive portions for the price, and everything was dont so well, you can taste the love they used to cook your food! The service was friendly and personable. Everyone looked happy to be there!
Their mimosa was really good as a side point, they used pulpy orange juice for mine and I was overjoyed!!
I really hope you think about eating here next time you're in the neighborhood, some of the best food I've had across Canada!


amazing servers and lovely atmosphere - got a chai latte which was delicious and the southern belle eggs benedict with scottish potato scone. I wasn't the biggest fan of the eggs benedict but it was just not the flavour combo for me! would have loved another type for sure


Best Benedict eggs I have ever had. They have different hollandaise sauce which makes them more interesting to try. I ordered the clubhouse and I loved it. The boy serves very well but the girl needs to be more friendly. I give them 5 stars because the flavour is extremely good.


The food was delicious, they served very quick and the waitress was very nice. Although we waited for 30 minutes to get in; was a great time and food.

name: Bubby's Restaurant
reviews:
Absolutely discriminating place! I sat down for half hour with my drink and worked on my laptop, then when I came back from the washroom I found out my unfinished drink was already taken away!! I was told by the waitress in a rude manner that people should not work on their computer, as the restaurant is busy with turn over! She also asked me to spend more money or leave! Plenty of people were doing cross words and reading for hours!


A bright, wide, beautiful scene with delicious early morning breakfast. Decorative, there's always something new to look at when you turn your head. The latte is tasty and the service is kindly. They carry vegan and gluten-free items. Teas and matcha are locally supplied.


Another lovely Bubby's location! I tried the mediterranean omelette which was absolutely fantastic. Good portion size and very tasty. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend sitting here and having a coffee.


Waited 30 minutes for a bacon and avocado sandwhich while the owner walked around behind the counter eating (not food safe) berating his staff. Really unimpressed with this location and service. Turns out they never rang in the order, no apologies, and then MICROWAVED it. Who nukes a sandwhich? disgusting


This beautiful space was exactly what we needed for a low key and delicious lunch. Their signature chocolate cookie was so so good and I very much enjoyed the sandwich I got. When I'm back in the area I will absolutely come back.

name: Sandwich Corner Cafe
reviews:
Support local business as I see bigger lineups on Bigger restaurants but trust me this cafe was a perfect stop for me and the quality of the food was surprisingly great. The lady on the counter was so generous and I can‚Äôt really wait to go there again. Highly recommend


Small quaint cozy little place on the corner! The service is polite, friendly and courteous, I just popped by and was pleasantly surprised! The coffee art is also gorgeous, definitely recommend as a quick drop by coffee place definitely will be coming back again!


On the recommendation of a friend, we had an afternoon coffee here when we visited Victoria from Vancouver. The coffee is so good and the famous chicken panini is very delicious. The coffee shop owner is friendly and welcoming, and the shop is very close to Victoria Harbour. We will definitely come again next time.


The BEST coffee and hot beverages around downtown Victoria! The owners are SO adorable and they create the prettiest artwork on the foam! Highly recommend :)


Patron are super real and great family vibe.

This is a awesomely simple and great breakfast place.

Not many options because all items are really good and generous portions.
Coffees are great and way better than expected.

Visit this place for sure.

name: John's Place Restaurant
editorial_summary: Canadian comfort fare including housemade breads & pies & creative breakfast in a relaxed space.
reviews:
I have been to John's several times. They have wide variety of food choices for brunch. My sister and I love their pancakes with maple syrup cream cheese, the combination is really good.

The servers are also friendly and welcoming. It could be because there are many people that come here for brunch especially during the weekend and there's usually a line up that we feel that the servers are in a hurry for you to pay for your food so you can go and let others Seat. My sister hasn't even finished her coffee when the server came with the card machine and asked us if we are ready to pay. If you want a more relax place or a space where you can chat more with your friends or love ones over brunch,  maybe this is not the place for you. But if it is just brunch that you want to try, John's could provide that for you.


We have been here a few times now and it never disappoints!  My husband and I had the vegan burrito and it was incredible! Whatever was in it was very tasty and kept us full all day. I can‚Äôt wait to have it again :-)  the portions are generous!

The staff are all super friendly especially the long-term ones that have been there forever. The restaurant and  facilities are always clean


You definitely gotta eat here! John Catucci is right about John‚Äôs Place Restaurant. Upon entering the restaurant I was in awe with all the pictures on the wall of celebrities and family of John. We knew this diner has a special history which I can tell why local patrons keep coming back. The menu is extensive; it was hard to decide what to order. We had:

üî∏ The Belgian Waffle - as seen on ‚ÄúYou Gotta Eat Here!‚Äù
üî∏ The ‚ÄúOdd Couple‚Äù
üî∏ The Classic Eggs Benny (1984) - as seen on ‚ÄúYou Gotta Eat Here!‚Äù added cornbread
üî∏Omelette special for the day

Generous portion and the flavours are outstanding. We were so full we needed to walk it out. The staff was so attentive and great. We will definitely come back again to try out other dishes. You gotta eat here again and again.


What a treasure! My husband and I had brunch here while visiting Victoria. A bit of a wait, but definitely worth it. My husband had the Catch-22, half a traditional eggs Benedict and a Belgian waffle. The cream cheese syrup is to die for üòã I'm a comfort food lover, so the meatloaf/mashed potatoes/gravy were right up my alley. Absolutely delicious, the meatloaf was so tender and the gravy so flavorful ü§§ Our charming server (lovely older lady) insisted we try the homemade pie ü•ß  Unbelievable! Lucky Victoria is a walkable city, we were stuffed üòÖ Highly recommend! A definite hidden gem üíé


John's Place in Victoria, BC is an absolute gem! The pancakes were definitely the highlight of our breakfast - perfectly cooked and huge in size. The food was absolutely delicious and left us wanting more. But what really stood out was the exceptional service by the staff - they were beyond nice and made our dining experience truly memorable. If you're looking for a 5-star breakfast spot in Victoria, John's Place is the place to go!

name: Blue Fox Cafe
editorial_summary: Vibrant, colourful cafe known for all-day breakfast & imaginative takes on Canadian comfort food.
reviews:
They are usually pretty busy and there was a wait for us to get in, but definitely worth it. The food was very yummy and very large portions for the price, I would definitely recommend. One plate would‚Äôve honestly been enough for both my friend and I. The decor and ambience is also very nice, service is quite attentive. Although a tad slow because of how busy they were. I would definitely come again.


Amazing breakfast spot in Downtown Victoria. When we go early in the morning already had line up so can see how popular it is. It‚Äôs featured in so many articles about the breakfast you have to try in Victoria. Actually at beginning we are little skeptical but it turns out it‚Äôs very good. The portion is huge and they are generous on putting ingredients the plates are full :). We are super full after eating that we skip the lunch. We highly recommend this to if you want to try traditional breakfast in this beautiful city


This is one of the hot brunch restaurants in Victoria.  Place opens 8am in the morning and there was already many people waiting well before the opening time.  Food was very good.  Sandwich was lunch menu but still was able to order it in the morning.  Price is fair as well.  Parking are on street, so ensure to pay at the meter station.


One of those rare times the lineup wasn't very long so we took advantage.  It's a busy spot but the service was efficient and the food came out quickly.  I had the Angel Eyes Eggs Benny.  The eggs were perfectly cooked.  The homefries were crispy.  Didn't find it had oodles of flavour, but of course that has more to do with my choice of order.  My friend had the Moroccan Chicken Club which he really liked.  Will go back, but likely not when it's lined up.


If you can tolerate the wait, you‚Äôll be rewarded with a table. Saturday morning lineup 10:20, seated at 11:10 ordered and food arrived 11:30. Real breakfast potatoes is a good sign. Creole chicken club; good. Apple French toast; okay. Good presentation and sizeable portions. Small seating area and few waitresses attending customers. Bright rustic environment, huge windows displaying waiting patrons with food envy. Decent coffee.

name: Morning People
reviews:
I‚Äôm giving Morning People 5 Stars because I can‚Äôt give them 10 on here! Everything from the quality of food, flavour and creativity is absolute perfection. I‚Äôve been here many times and the food is always great. The staff are the most friendliest group of people this side of Victoria! Even when they are so busy, they make an effort to chat with the customers and make them feel welcome. They have a huge variety of delicious food, including the two pictured below. Peanut butter bowl, and a side of smash potatoes!


We ordered a sausage party and two peanut butter bowls. The food was excellent and quite enjoyable! This place is a food truck so there is seating available under tents. The reason we are giving this place four stars instead of five was because they don‚Äôt really have a large variety of drink options that you would except from a place that serves breakfast/brunch/lunch options. Other than that, the food was super enjoyable and there‚Äôs a large variety.


Decided to try this breakfast food truck. I had the loaded dish, which was great. My accompanying party had the vegetable sandwich, which was also good, but maybe priced a little high. Service was quick and polite. I'd recommend.


Great little breakfast spot. Pictured here is the smashed hash; potatoes with egg & sauce. Delicious and filling. I‚Äôve eaten through pretty much everything on their menu now and it‚Äôs all superb. Excellent customer service as well.


Ordered the Brisket Hash (the special) and it was good! The potatoes are amazing and the service was quick! On the pricier side, but the food tasted fresh!

name: Floyd's Diner James Bay
reviews:
