We had a nice warm welcoming dining experience at this restaurant. Servers were very friendly and attentive. They made our kids happy with their cheerful conversations. Food was good and plenty. We ate and ate, and barely managed to finish everything, even though we wanted to eat more and more.
There‚Äôs always a queue to enter but it goes fast, so it‚Äôs alright to wait a bit. Also, food is good and generous portioning, so it‚Äôs all worth it.
One can order drinks while waiting in the queue and be served outside while waiting to be seated in. So that‚Äôs nice. Overall, a good dining experience.


Always worth the wait to get in! Went for a brunch date, had absolutely fantastic service, delicious coffee, very generous half order of pancakes with toppings, and I added a side of crispy bacon. Was offered a small sample of the optional lemon curd and strawberry coulis üçãüçìüíñ that was a taste sensation. It tasted obviously made from scratch with love. Like a flavour bomb going off! Unreal. More please!


What a wonderful time and experience in Victoria. We were in the area to try and see if we could go to blue Fox Caf√© originally, but there was such a long lineup that we decided to check into our hotel and look around the neighborhood. Our eyes could not avert the beautiful hot pink colour that was this little diner. Floyd's has a great menu with breakfast brunch and lunch items and the staff are so kind. We ordered the chicken and waffles Benny and the BC hash and the portions are very generous and reasonable. Each dish still comes in around 18-20$ but we felt it was worth it. Highly recommend if you're in the area. As an additional note, the washrooms are tiny and I would say accessibility wise it is a little tight. They also have seating outdoors which is quite nice.


Casual local diner in a lovely little neighborhood. The restaurant itself is very eclectic, with a friendly and nostalgic atmosphere ‚Äî magenta exterior, mismatched artwork on the walls, no frills decor and aesthetic. Super friendly service, servers had lots of suggestions for things to do in the city. Good prices and honestly really great breakfast ‚Äî serving up that thicc bacon, they don‚Äôt mess around. Darn good eggs, and what I believe to be house made or locally made sour dough (honestly some of the best sourdough ever). Can‚Äôt wait to go back next time I visit the island


I tried the vegetarian hash... it tasted good. The salsa was really yummy. The potatoes were crispy. The rest of the food : poutine and the lumberjack was tasty too. The food was fresh and the portion was good for 2. They also have bottomless coffee for 4.25..
The staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this diner. They serve all day breakfast and lunch. The wait time for a table was 10 minutes. Street parking available.

name: Cora Breakfast and Lunch
reviews:
Quite busy but the staff made sure we got everything we needed despite being short staffed. Food was great but quite a large menu so I would suggest looking at it before coming here. Fruit was nice and fresh. My partners ham was a little overcooked and the coffee was a little watered down but I enjoyed the experience.


Best breakfast in Victoria- you can get anything you want from omelettes to pancakes and French toast, sandwiches, and so much more. The ingredients are so fresh and the fruit they serve is making - melons, berries - even gooseberries- kiwi, banana and more . This is just the side fruit that comes with the meal.  Simple decor , friendly staff - definitely a destination for an amazing breakfast


This restaurant/ server gave us such a weird vibe. The server did all the regular work, but he was grumpy. He wanted us to order quick, eat extremely quick and leave even the restaurant is not busy (weekday 12 to 1pm).

To Owner: thank you for your reply and kind offer. Just hope this is just individual situation.


Large menu with kids menu as well. Food is OK and prices are OK although sides and coffee are a bit pricy. We had 2 coffees ($7) 2 adult meals, 1 kids meal, and 2 sides - total was $58 before tip. Decent place for breakfast if you're craving that.


Love the fluffy blueberry pancake! The chorizo and goat cheese crepomelette has a mix of salty and sour taste. It was the first time for us to try crepomelette (omelette stuffed jn a crepe). Quite special. The portion of food is large and definitely gives you a satisfactory morning!

name: Picnic Too
editorial_summary: An array of Canadian & internationally-inspired dishes in a cozy setting with happy hour specials.
reviews:
Amazing food for an amazing price. I cannot tell you how delicious food is here. It wasn't even busy. I just fear that over time this place will gain popularity and there will be a wait for brunch going forward.

Just.so.good.


My family and I decided to stop in for brunch and we were all surprised at how delicious the food and coffee was. The staff were very friendly, the atmosphere was nice and they had good music playing too!


Food is good, the burrito was very flavourful and wrapped well. Giving it 4 stars only because they automatically charge you 15% for tips. The only service we got was the staff bringing out our food to the table. Not sure if that warrants a 15% mandatory tip.


Funky decor, good menu. Both the Owen and the Weekender were really tasty, though the 'smashed potatoes' were just cooked potatoes without any smash in sight? Didn't love the single-use packaging when we ate on site - hopefully just a COVID thing.


My dad and I were visiting Victoria on our way to shop RVs for my parents across the island. Dad ate the Vegan Hash, which he said was so delicious, large portion and very filling, while I shopped a few stores nearby. As I finished, I returned for a Chai Tea Latte with oat milk and it was also well done; flavorful, smooth and creamy. Would visit again next trip!

name: The Windsor Cafe
reviews:
I arrived at Windsor Park a bit too early for the Oak Bay Tea Party parade (my children are performing in the Spectrum marching band) and this place opened up early for this occasion. I was greeted by a gentleman (presuming Jay) who kindly explained the early opening so decided to come in to shelter myself from the wind & drizzling rain.

The food was good; came fast so technically one can quickly eat and go if they're on a time pinch. That is usually me but today I decide to take it slow to absorb the jazz music and the ambiance. Listening to Unforgettable & Just the Two of Us kinda made me think this would've been a good place to bring my former boyfriend (the person with me in my reviews all these years until recently) but his loss.

Anyway the sun mysterious shone momentarily as I am ready to get ready to watch the parade. I appreciate this place getting me the glass of water and allowing me to have an entire room to relax and enjoy my meal. I'll make sure to bring my performing daughters here on my next visit. My only suggestion to the cafe is update the social media more as it has outdated information and perhaps use some furniture felt to balance some of the table feet that has cardboard and folded paper underneath them. üòÇ

Also to the one person who left the awful review saying Cheese Whiz was used for the ingredient, you need to get your olfactory bulb and eyes checked. It is beyond obvious cheddar cheese üßÄ the ingredient used in the menu. Just look at my wrap; it's obvious standard, medium sharpness flavor.

(For those who need nitty-gritty details, food is 4.5, hospitality/service 5, ambiance 5, decor 4.5; overall score is rounded to 5 stars)


What a cute little spot to drop in for a coffee. Or wine. Or a snack. Delightful sitting out front. But even better seating out back in a garden like atmosphere. Service was great..

I just loved how old the building and how well kept up it was.


Imagine living every day like you‚Äôre on a quaint British seaside holiday‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs Windsor Cafe.

The building exterior has Tudor-style design & the atmosphere is perfect for reading a good book or sitting down with friends‚Ä¶ jazzy music, a fireplace, an interesting menu with a hearty soup that changes daily, large windows. Perfect if you‚Äôre visiting Willows Beach. If I lived in Victoria I would absolutely come back regularly.


The third photo in Google maps looked like pork belly on mashed potatoes. Silly me ‚Äì going there thinking that I could get the same dish. Nope. They had to scale down the cooking and serve more simple food after the pandemic. So, we ordered Chicken Club Sandwiches, our third one in one week! Well, they win hands down, this was the most delicious Chicken Club Sandwich I've tasted in a long while. Moist, tasty chicken, enough fresh greens and mayo. Can't say the same for the latte or cappuccino, the espresso was not pressed down enough, and foaming was very weak. As for seating, at one point, it seemed like my sandwich was going to be stolen by a visiting dog. That's casual outside seating. Five stars for the Chicken Club, minus one star for the terrible coffee drinks.


Coffee was good, bagels were fine, but there seems to be missing a character. Staff needs to be more like Shirley Delicious. Next to Windsor Park is a huge bonus.

name: Farmhouse Victoria
reviews:
Had a 16oz cappuccino (which is the largest I've seen anywhere) and it was good but mild tasting. Could have been a bit stronger. The burgers were nice and very filling. The food is very well-priced, tasty, and fresh. Servers were friendly, and the ambiance was nice


I had the Farmhouse Classic and an iced hazelnut latte. The sandwich was a good portion, piled with ingredients, super tasty. It was a little spicy from the Serrano Mayo but not in an overpowering way. The ingredients were very fresh and the bun was soft and held up well. The latte was also very good. The coffee was smooth and they offer alternative milks with no additional up charge. Would highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a good breakfast spot!


Breakfast at Farmhouse Victoria is the best place to start the day, I love it for space, place, local food and the girls than run the show! Every item served is local, they are great ambassadors of locally sourced food; from the bread to the home cured bacon, to the locally roasted beans to the made in house treats. They make your orders on the go, so be prepared to wait a bit because, oh my, the few minutes wait is so worth it. Sit on the patio and enjoy the view of the water and the busy people going by, and the flower power of Local Restaurant next door. People are nice in Victoria, really and truly‚Ä¶but the ladies at this place take the cake award when it comes to niceness.


Very tasty breakfast sandwich this morning. If you want something light and not too heavy this is the place to go.


They have really, really good coffee and sandwiches here.  I went  back a couple of times. They have breakfast sandwiches that are popular and also lunch sandwiches. They are delicious and huge!  Everything is really fresh. They also have really good muffins as well, I had a coffee cake one and it was really tasty.

name: Nourish Kitchen & Cafe
editorial_summary: This restaurant & cafe serves simple farm-fresh mains & snacks in an airy, bright Victorian house.
reviews:
Nourish is hands-down the best breakfast spot in Victoria, and in fact one of the best restaurants overall. The food is farm-to-table, and prepared with love and care in delicious and often unexpected ways. The restaurant is dairy-free, gluten-free, and organic, and is loved by us and our kids. We particularly like the eggs Benny, which are prepared with a delicious cashew cream sauce. The seedy bread is also terrific. The coffee drinks are especially creative and are served with beautiful flourishes of design and usually edible flowers. The manager, Amira, is so incredibly kind and attentive. All in all, this is a wonderful restaurant.


Gem of gems in Victoria and probably in BC as a whole. Exquisite presentation all around, both in the beautiful plating of the kitchen selections and the layout of the place. The cafe drinks in particular were stunning, visually speaking.

What truly makes this place stand out is the homemade quality of what seems to be the most fresh ingredients‚Ä¶ both plates we had were delicately crafted: ample sweetness, tasteful seasonings, beautiful pairing of ingredients, humble portions, and a soaring sense of ‚Äúfreshness.‚Äù While prices are justifiably premium, it is more than fair considering the relentless quality of every offering on the menu and sincerity of the staff.

All around, an incredibly memorable and enjoyable dining experience. Quite the standout in what might be one of the best spots on the island!


The cutest heritage house with delicious brunch made with fresh local ingredients. We had the half and half (pancake and half Benny), the golden Benny and their bone broth. Everything was colourful, flavourful, and high quality. Highly recommend you go at least 15min before they open so you can snag the first seating.


Very unique menu! Beautiful location. I got the dandelion beverage with chaga (in photos) and was pleasantly surprised as to how tasty it was! The coffees and broths were also great quality. I had the tartine, my sister had sleeping beauty pancakes, and my dad had the golden Benny with extra bacon. Of the three, our favorite was the Benny (especially the bacon) and the pancakes. You will not be disappointed.


I went in skeptical. The menu online looked too healthy to be flavourful. Boy was I wrong! The oat pancakes were light as air. Everything was tasty. Incredible bacon. Good cup of coffee. Highly recommend!

name: The Village Restaurant
editorial_summary: Busy, snug cafe serving local, sustainable daytime fare with gluten-free options in a sunlit space.
reviews:
Excellent service, everyone was so friendly and professional! And the food was absolutely amazing! The fruit were sweet and juicy and the portions were generous. Kids got a menu to colour in with crayons and their options were equally good! Wouldn't change anything in our experience there. Five stars!


Coming to the Oak Bay Area, this restaurant was recommended both by a tourist website and the front desk at our hotel, so of course we had to stop by. Great service by the staff and delicious food, we could see they were busy but the turnaround time was not bad. Eggs Benny options were what the people around us were ordering so we followed the example, no regrets!


This place has the best eggs Benedict I have ever had. Great french toast as well. They make every thing from scratch and very fresh. The best place to eat brunch in Victoria hands down. I recommend this place 100% you will not be disappointed. Love love love. I wish I could come back for lunch but they close at 2.


Had a great breakfast here. Enjoyed a plate of thier french toast. Food was served quickly and all our orders were tasty. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Offered various options and was helpful. Worth a stop in for a great enjoyable meal.


Consistently amazing food and service! The Benico Del Toro benny is so delicious. Your potatoe latkes keep me coming back! And the almond milk cappuccino with biscotti was such a treat. Thank you for a lovely brunch. üòä

name: Miche Cafe & Bar
reviews:
Lovely hidden place with a relaxing and cozy ambiance. Coffee was good. The server/owner was super friendly and sweet. The food was the only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 - taste of garlic was a bit too strong for me personally. Overall, I had a great afternoon here and will come back for coffee if I ever pass by the area.


Miche cafe is phenomenal! One of the last genuine mom and pop‚Äôs in the city- and it‚Äôs easy to see how they survived the pandemic (thank goodness!) Cozy and social atmosphere, incredible food and even better service. Michelle and Alan are truly delightful people. Easily my new favourite hidden gem in Victoria! Highly recommended the Coconut Curry Lentil soup and the life-changing Focaccia that comes with. Whether you‚Äôre a local or passing through: you must!


We've been wanting to try this place out for almost two years now.  I am so happy today was the day!

It is in more of an industrial area, but I'm happy we drove over.  They have a great outside patio area, as well as some seating inside.  (Not a lot, bit some!)

The staff are very friendly!  There is an extensive beverage menu, hot and cold, as well as fresh baking, and a daily soup and food special.

Today we had donairs (I loved that you got a choice between Halifax sauce and tzatziki!).  We had a side of beef barley soup and fries.  We both really enjoyed our meals!  Flavourful meat, fresh pita and veggies, and just the right amount of sauce!  The fries were fresh and crisp, and the soup was amazing!  Really filling portion, lots of herbs, veggies and meat to make it very flavourful!

It does get really busy over the lunch hour, which does lead to it being chilly when the door is open lots.  The food was worth it though, and we will happily be back again!


Amazing Turkey Dinner with Eggnog cheesecake from Miche Cafe!!!
Thank you so much Allan and Michelle for giving us a mouth watering dinner during our working hours to keep us going!

Best place in town for awesome meals along with very friendly people!
Would give 10 stars if we could! (+‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê)

~ Jordan & Helene Tomei
TOMEI Landscaping Ltd


One of my favorites hidden gems in Victoria! ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è The food is outstanding, the portions huge and Michelle and Alan are always so welcoming and friendly.  They make you feel right at home. Make sure you come hungry!  These pictures are all from their "Miche around the world" Friday theme nights.

Lunch menu averages $10-$15 but for supper, I indulge a bit more. I love that desert is included with the Friday nights.

name: Frank's Honeybun Cafe
reviews:
Cute little place, definitely didn't expect breakfast to be as good as what it was. Prices are right, decent portion size, and good service. While maybe not my go to restaurant, I wouldn't complain about having to eat here!


Frank‚Äôs Honeybun Cofe is a local favourite. They serve delicious breakfast food and American Chinese food that can‚Äôt be beat. Check their window for a daily special!


Okay. Context. This is not a fancy place. But they deserve a 4 because of no frills, straightforward Chinese food that I am familiar with. Savory. Tasty. With all the sauce, noodles, rice and viand combinations. If you‚Äôre in Downtown in looking for a comfort food, this is the place!


Honest Chinese food at a reasonable price.  Consistent and reliable. The menu does not change that I have noticed, but what ever they make, the food is good. Friendly and helpful.


Unpretentious local eatery. Breakfasts and lunch are delicious, very reasonably priced and friendly service. I go regularly because it is good value.

name: Fuego Old Town Eatery
editorial_summary: Classic breakfast plates & Mexican staples offered in a chill, brick-lined space with patio seating.
reviews:
I had a rare Monday off and we happened to be downtown so we popped in here for brunch. I'd heard good things and my expectations were exceeded. From the friendly attentive service, fresh coffee and timely refills, helpful menu recommendations. Everything sounded so good. We finally narrowed down our choices. My wife had the Fuego Benny and I went with the Fried Chicken and Cornbread French Toast with side of blueberry coulis.
The flavours and textures and presentation are spot on.
It was all just so good and we left happy and very full.
Special thanks to our server Michelle for excellent service.
Can't wait to come back!


I decided to try the harvest breakfast and it did not disappoint! It was a tasty dish with a hint of spice that gave it an extra kick. I also loved the homemade salsa sauce - it was so good that I ended up buying a bottle to take home with me.

The service was also very friendly and fast. The atmosphere of the restaurant was cozy and welcoming, and it was right next to the sea which.

For dessert, I decided to try the churros pancakes which were simply delicious. However, I must say that they were a bit too sweet for my taste.

Additionally, there were plenty of parking spots available right in front of the restaurant which made it very convenient. Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a tasty breakfast with a great view and friendly service.


Nice spot for breakfast. Little benches at the front of the building for when you‚Äôre lining up. The service was excellent, from suggestions on what to eat, keeping the coffee topped up and having hand sanitizers at the end of the meal. It‚Äôs busy especially on weekends but worth it.


Enjoyed breakfast at Fuego Old Town Eatery, fantastic service and beautifully spicy breakfast meal. Enjoyed the Fuego Benny with Cornbread. Very tasty with the house habanero sauce. We also had a fantastic view of the Johnson Street Bridge raising while enjoying our meal.


Maybe my new favorite breakfast restaurant in Victoria! Amazing food with perfect portions, extremely tasty and impeccable service.  You won't be disappointed but prepare for a wait.

name: Broughton Street Deli - Breakfast, Lunch & Catering
editorial_summary: Quaint, family-owned counter serve offering classic breakfast & lunch meals, baked goods & espresso.
reviews:
Cute little cafe with some amazing sandwiches and cookies!

Their smoked meat sandwiches are by far their best thing on menu. Pieces were fair and there is a tone of other options as well. They even have some Vietnamese dishes as well, most notably Vietnamese sandwiches.

The atmosphere is beautiful, almost reminding of a classic dinner. Service is extremely quick for how small yet busy it gets! I would most definitely recommend coming for some breakfast!


Cute interior, central location, good service. I got the Montr√©al smoked meat sandwich and squash curry soup - The smoked meat isn't Schwartz or Dunn's quality but it was still good. The soup was delish.


Literally my favourite place to get food in Victoria. The staff is extremely friendly and the food is THE BEST there is. Always SUPER FRESH AND TASTY. my favourite things are their Montreal meat sandwich with their homemade sweet and spic.  Plus their chicken noodle soup reminds me of something my mom makes when I‚Äôm sick but even better. ( sorry mom). The chicken strips are like no others you‚Äôve had in the city. They are buttery and taste like the are made fresh as well. The portions are HUGE and I can‚Äôt get over how delicious everything is. I‚Äôve tried quite a few of the deserts and of course they do not disappoint. They taste homemade and so fresh.  The Halong Bay Salad is something I tried new and of course it was exceptional like everything I‚Äôve ever tried. Their food is worth every penny and I promise you won‚Äôt be disappointed. I‚Äôd start with the Montreal meat sandwich with homemade sweet and spicy mustard. You‚Äôll thank me later. I‚Äôve tried so many delis and sandwiches in Victoria since I‚Äôve lived here my whole life and NOTHING EVEN COMES CLOSE TO THEIR INSANELY , DELICIOUS FOOD WHICH WILL HAVE YOU COMING BACK FOR MORE. I ORDER AT LEAST 1-3x a week it‚Äôs that good ( even if I don‚Äôt eat it that day I know it‚Äôs made fresh so I can keep it in my fridge for the next day or 2 and it still tastes phenomenal). Also the customer service is amazing. Tron goes above and beyond to make his customers happy. Trust me when I say it‚Äôs one of Victoria‚Äôs best kept secrets. I promise you‚Äôll be so happy with any food item you choose and they have something for everyone !! Try it ASAP


I got their daily lunch special which I believe is the Montreal beef sandwich. Bread's really soft and fresh and the meat was succulent and fully loaded (ordered the super size). Polished off the coleslaw which tells you something because I usually despise coleslaw in general, and the chips are good sized and crisp. Owners running the shop are very polite and the food was made to order at a very decent speed (wife at the shop slicing away at the mandolin while husband was chatting with me and the work colleague who recommended this place to try)

For those who are griping about pricing of food... seriously, use your thinking caps on. Rent ain't cheap and they're in a prime location. They're not a franchise or a chain, and there is a lot of overhead plus the rising costs of food ingredients in general. It causes me to facepalm when shoddy reviewers make an incredible poor comparison when their education is lower than a 10th grader and have absolute zero business knowledge. The pricing is on par with the value of the entrees.

Anyway, keep up with the good work. I probably can't afford it on a daily basis because I'm usually a glutton with good food nowadays and can easily burn a hole if I'm not careful but definitely worth it as a weekly or monthly treat for me.


Good mom and pop style food. Decent price and easy going owner.
I would go back for sure. If you want to avoid another Chain breakfast join, go here.

name: The Oaks Restaurant and Tearoom
editorial_summary: An array of Canadian comfort food & tea service in a casual space with rustic decor & warm lighting.
reviews:
A classic restaurant and tea house with considerable local history. Relatively inexpensive with tasty daily specials, each of which has ample proportions. All tea pots are a good size and come with Royal Dalton bone china and a memorable tea spoon. Several wines and beers to match many tastes plus live music Friday evenings. Well worth the visit.


Prices are reasonable with generous portions. This was for 3 people. We did take a while to be seated, because the fridge obscures a bit of the waiting area, and the workers didn't regularly check on the waiting area to see if any customers were there. But once we were seated, the food arrived quickly and service was good.


This is a very unique place! Oldest building in Oak Bay. A YUGE menu, which can be daunting to get through, but everything we had was quite tasty! Fair prices, electric crowd, warm service. More than meets the eye!


A lovely & charming restaurant with delicious brunch selections. First time, I had the Veggie Benedict, and another time, the massive Veggie Omelette.  Both items were delicious.  Servers were efficient and friendly. The only minor "complaint" would be the Red Rose tea. The choice for their black tea was a bit disappointing for a Tea Room.  However, their rich and decadent chocolate brownie made up for it. ;)


Went there on a Sunday, just me. They took forever to seat me. I ordered a coffee and the shortrib eggs benny, the first mug she gave had a lipstick mark on which was replaced when asked. The eggs benny there was plenty of shortrib but lacking of flavor and salt! I don't usually add extra salt after food is served but I had to. The only tasty thing was their parmesan potatoes! I would try a dinner to give them another chance.

name: Marina Dockside Eatery
reviews:
Super friendly service. We got a fabulous peanut butter cookie a bagel, sandwich and some house chips.

My 4 yr old said the cookie was amazing. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his bagel. My salmon sandwich with the arugula was extremely satisfying. And the house chips are a must. I even put them into my sandwich and had no regrets.

And you can‚Äôt beat eating outside by the water.


This caf√© has changed hands over the years, but in its latest iteration it is known as the Marina Dockside Eatery.

I am here on a Thursday morning, just after opening.  There are about ten patrons here, enjoying coffees, pastries, and food.  There is also takeout available.

I‚Äôve spotted a Kindle, a magazine, and the Times Colonist newspaper being read.  Quiet music is being played and only the sounds of conversation, and refreshments being made behind the counter,  are heard.

Outside the entire expanse of windows that wrap around the caf√© are sailboats, other patrons on the terrace, and those who work nearby.

Altogether a lovely spot for this morning‚Äôs cappuccino, which is good, but not quite strong enough for my taste.

Update:  All of my cappuccinos have been superb since.  Well done, baristas!

The caf√© offers breakfast, teas, coffees, wraps, sandwiches, chowder, soups, and other similar fare.

While it has a good ambience, the d√©cor could use a bit of an update.  It is mainly beige walls, fairly modern chairs and tables, though, there is a definite overdraft of beige and brown.  Some pop of colour would be welcomed; even some nautical d√©cor - not the tacky type - but some better pieces.

If you‚Äôre driving, just park at Turkey Head and walk down to the caf√©, or else use the ramp if need be.  Buses also stop at Turkey Head.

The Marina restaurant, just up the ramp,  just recently closed its doors, but the last time I was there for a meal it was far too quiet and the food wasn‚Äôt altogether anything to write home about, so to speak.  It was an icon, certainly, but time moves on.

I will definitely return to this caf√©.  A relaxing place, overall and friendly, chatty, staff.


Breakfast bun was great! Banana bread okay. Service was hands off for amount of people working. This place IS open even tho they don't answer the phone and one of the dockside restaurants says they are closed (its upstairs)


Friendly staff, good London fog, excellent salmon seafood chowder. I would definitely have that chowder again. Perfect comfort food on a chilly afternoon.


We had a lovely breakfast here, very relaxed atmosphere, staff were friendly and beautiful views of the Marina.

name: Red Kettle Restaurant
reviews:
Don‚Äôt understand the raves. Want a cheap no frills egg breakfast? It‚Äôll do the job. But if you want a great breakfast, this isn‚Äôt that. It‚Äôs ‚Äúokay‚Äù. Nothing wrong with ‚Äúokay,‚Äù but the ratings are way too high here for what you get.

Five stars should be memorable, flawless, clean, etc. I don‚Äôt feel it‚Äôs any of those things. But if you‚Äôre looking for a $7.50 breakfast plate, it‚Äôll be fine.

I don‚Äôt recommend the eggs Benny.


Lovely down-to-earth diner frequented by workers around the rock bay area. Ran by a very hard working couple. Ginger beef is an ample portion and I liked the celery garnish.  Will try calling in next time to pre order for lunch which nigjt be faster.


Love Love Love this place. Food is amazing and so are the owners. Best place to grab lunch and you can pre order via a phone call for pickup. Bring cash, there is no credit cards accepted here. Menu is reminiscent of old style soda shops and the comfort food is bang on.


Red Kettle is a cozy restaurant, not too fancy, simple atmosphere, service and food are great though! Run by the owners, they really make the difference. Great service for a good cost.


This unassuming little hideaway in the commercial district of Victoria offers the fast solution for the "working man's" appetite. Burgers, sandwiches and an all day breakfast seem to the mainstay of this establishment plus the constant flow of customers picking up take out orders. The portions are always on the larger side just by looking at what orders were nearby. I ordered an omelette and it was ok, nothing special. The decor would have been appropriate for the 70's but the food arrives fast. Order at the counter and self serve for coffee. I'd go back.

name: Shanzee's Old Town
reviews:
Love this place!! Definitely one of my favourite places to have brunch. Food is always delicious! They specialize in making the best biscuits. Worth trying!!

It looks like a family run business as I see the same people working there. And they are the nicest people!

Overall, whenever I come to Shanzee‚Äôs I have this feeling of being at home.


Yesterday morning I stopped by here to pick up a couple orders for door dash but upon walking in the door my nose was filled by all the delicious smells. I couldn‚Äôt help myself but to stare at all the baked good they had and settled on the carrot cake. It was absolutely perfect! Taste, consistency, ingredients and the icing! I will certainly be back to try more from their menu soon!


I feel like this place doesn't need much of an introduction considering it has a sign at the front that says its on Yelps Top 100 restaurants list. Either way, here's some info. I've been Pescatarian for a little over a year now, but I'm trying to fully transition to vegetarian, which can make it hard to dine with the gf at times since we like to share food for variety. So unfortunately I feel like I might not be doing this restaurant any justice since it has such an interesting and very tempting menu full of meat options. Anyway...pictured in this review is the vegetarian hash and the pancake special (pretty much banana pancakes with walnuts).

Vegetarian Hash - I've never had a hash with spring-mix on top. Usually vegetarian hashes are just peppers and onions, but this was more like a salad with egg and hashbrowns. Still really good once you chop everything up together and dump some hot sauce and ketchup on it. I'd order it again.
The Pancakes - They looked dense but they were so fluffy and their syrup was awesome. I could have taken a shot of just the syrup.

I'd definitely return. It's in a really cool spot called Market Square too. On a sunny day its just a nice place to eat hang out in.


The food and attention was very good.  They should check the ventilation system since the fry from the kitchen is in the restaurant. Our eyes were watering and our throats were constantly burning.  Our clothes smelled of frying, it was necessary to wash our clothes when we got home since the smell we had was incredible.  At the moment they opened the doors to ventilate but this made us all very cold.  The truth is that if it wasn't for this problem, everything would be perfect


Very comfortable and homey with friendly servers. My wife thinks of herself as an expert on biscuits and gravy and said these were the best she‚Äôs ever had. My omelette and hash browns were excellent and well prepared.

name: Soupa Cafe
reviews:
We won a gift certificate and had never been here. We went in on a wet, cold day and had a bowl of chili and a bowl of chicken stew soup. They were both delicious, you can tell they were homemade. Very pleasant staff. A bit pricey but I think it's like that everywhere now. $13 for a bowl of soup/stew. We were very pleased overall.


I can't say enough AMAZING things about this place! I ordered through skip, had never heard of them and took a chance! I'm so happy I did! One of my new favourite places to add to my list! I order a lot of skip for my picky eater mom in long-term care and she LOVED everything from turkey, brie + spinach sandwich on rye to the coconut chicken soup and even the Cobb Salad! A great way to get her to eat her veggies!

Thank you Soupa team and for double checking the receipt to make sure I had everything for my order! You will definitely hear from me again very soon! Through skip  and hopefully in person sometime in the near future.

Love the real turkey in the sandwich and Cobb salad! Best bacon I have ever had!
I'm going to tell everyone to go here!


Let's get to the point: this was the best breakfast bagel I've ever had. The food in this new little restaurant is exquisite, seemingly simple yet beautifully flavoured. As for options, there seem to be a humble yet varied menu of both classics and vegetarian options available, and the staff were more than willing to accommodate me when I mentioned an allergy. I wish I could show you a picture of what I chose, but I ate it too fast! But suffice to say, the breakfast egg'n'bacon bagel is well worth your time.

The staff here are very friendly and helpful. They brought me my breakfast within short order, and checked up on me after to see how I was doing and to make sure i was enjoying myself. I was! The interior is clean and simple as well, nothing dramatic or overstated, although the table art is very fun to look at.  Fairly spacious too. It's a bit like a diner, fresh and to the point, but much less greasy.

In short, don't pass by this little place if you can help it. It's a little startup with a big heart, and it shows in the taste of what you eat.


Had dinner tonight at the new Esquimalt Rd location. Probably the best customer service I have ever had! Soups were phenomenal. The gentleman behind the counter let me try samples of the soups before I made my choice.

They were out of the mulligatawny (sp?) so I tasted the African Peanut and the Creamy Mushroom. That mushroom soup was the best I have ever had. Unbelievably good food. Had the Turkey Bacon sandwich on gluten free bread which was delicious as well. They even wrap the bread before toasting to eliminate any cross-contamination (I am celiac). So glad I came here for dinner tonight!


We heard so many great things and were very eager to try out the newer Esquimalt location for our Friday night take out meal. The staff were amazing and friendly,  and the restaurant smelled amazing at time of pickup.

I tried the daily special, a 7 grain chicken soup, and my wife got the creamy mushroom. They both looked and smelled awesome, but after the first bite we were both really disappointed... all we could taste was salt. I've had canned soup with significantly less salt content. I was quite hungry, so despite this I finished it, but my wife could barely eat half. By the end of the night my joints felt swollen and my face was puffy, it was that salty.

I'm glad that so many people enjoy their products, local  businesses deserve that love, but  unfortunately,  we won't be going back.

name: Bunny's Nook Kitchen
reviews:
This place lived up to the ratings. Got a latte, breakfast wrap, cinnamon bun and a smoothie. Everything was very tasty, and the cinnamon bun is the best one I've had in the Victoria area (thus far anyways). Worth checking out.


The cinnamon buns are sooo delicious. I ordered 2 not long after they came out of the oven and I think they were the best I've ever eaten!! Still warm and soft! Worth the price! The chicken wrap was really yummy too, both of them were super fresh, but the cinnamon buns were definitely the highlight of my time at Bunny's kitcken!!


LOVE LOVE LOVE this cafe!
Visiting from Oregon for a few days and we came everyday.
The absolute BEST vegan breakfast sandwich ever!
Every dessert has been delicious!
What a little gem!


This is the best vegan food in Victoria! I love their breakfast sandwich and I recently had their vegan chicken chaser wrap and it was the most amazing thing I have ever eaten in my life. The dressing was so creamy and garlicy and rich and there was so much chicken and the chicken was mixed with a bunch of parmesan cheese it was so cheesy and delicious and I wish I could eat it everyday forever. This is a picture of one half because I devoured the first half but then realized it must be documented. Thank you Bunny's!


From a non-Vegan to the other non-vegans, don't sleep on this place! I love a good salad and a good veggie burger, let me tell you though, THE PICKLE BURGER is stunning. The patty itself is lovely but the accoutrements that they add to it make it really next level, it's pickly, garlicky, every bite was outstanding and it was filling to boot. The assorted Vegan treats (that would normally rely heavily on dairy) are also extremely good, like really, really good. I mentioned the salads, well let me elaborate, they are big which is nice, lots' of fun textures in there but what really puts them above (a lot) of other salad offerings is the outstanding dressings, my gosh. Truly stellar place.

name: Belleville's Watering Hole & Diner
editorial_summary: Relaxed bar & eatery serving breakfast, sandwiches, global mains & cocktails at the Days Inn.
reviews:
You'll feel like you stepped back in time. Very nostalgic vibe. Fun atmosphere.  Across from the harbor. They have outdoor seating, but it was too ü•∂ for that.  The food was quite tasty and flavorful. Our server Chester was simply fantastic!! He was friendly, attentive and answered all questions with a smile. Would definitely eat here again on my next visit to Victoria.


Yummy casual restaurant. Patio in a great location to watch people & all the cars! I was pleasantly surprised at how good my beet salad was!! I added halibut to it & it was so tasty. And not expensive. My husband had a burger & macaroni cheese bites...also very yummy! Our server was great too. Would definitely come here again next visit to Victoria.


The food was great and it is awesome having a full service bar and restaurant in your hotel only a few steps from the elevator. The food presentation was perfect and the portions were large. I ate both breakfast and dinner here and was not disappointed. Where else can you get both chicken and waffles & red snapper fish and chips under the same roof?


I stopped by on an extremely hot day for lunch with a friend. The patio was great to sit on and has a great view of the inner harbor. You are able to see the sea plane come in and out. The food was also great, I had the falafel sliders, and they were great. Good atmosphere and the wait staff were very friendly and accommodating. Thank you.


Finally decided to come check out Bellevilles for brunch and my god it was delicious. We tried all of the specials they had on and we're not disappointed whatsoever. The food was top notch, the services was friendly, and the atmosphere was delightful. I will definitely be back!!

name: West Coast Waffles
editorial_summary: Casual joint specializing in inventively topped waffles, including savoury options.
reviews:
My husband, son and I, ate at WestCoast Waffles and were delighted with the waffles. Hubby ordered The Canadian, and was pleased that it wasn't too sweet, it had generous portions of fresh strawberries and real whipped cream and the hint of cinnamon and real maple syrup were the perfect match. I had a 'pick your own combination' of bananas, fresh blueberries, generous helpings of real whipped cream and real maple syrup and it was delicious. My son had a sweet choice of the Oreo Waffle, complete with crumbled Oreo cookies, chocolate syrup and whipped cream. The waffles were made fresh to order and were light and not too sweet and the servings of toppings were fresh and generous. The service was also friendly, and efficient. We stopped for a quick bite at this little restaurant¬†and couldn't stop raving about how fresh and tasty it was. Next time, I will go for one of the savoury options. Overall, a great option for breakfast, lunch or tea time in downtown Victoria.


First time visit. Tried the vegetarian options as it was closer to lunch time.
The "Mexican waffle" was great and will highly recommend it. Try it with scrambled eggs.
The vegetarian was decent, but not much too rave about.


Fantastic waffles for a late night treat. The place could be cleaned and fixed up a bit, but let's be honest you're not there for the atmosphere.


Definitely one of the best waffle places in vic by far! The worker who was there was super nice, and definitely made the appearance of my waffle look super pretty and appetizing! It was super yummy and I‚Äôm so glad that this place is open till 4 am on Fridays and Saturday‚Äôs, because it definitely is a great midnight snack.

I‚Äôm just wondering why there‚Äôs only one worker though for the whole restaurant even though it‚Äôs late at night?


Worst gluten free "waffle" ever. It was a mushy cake. Softer and mushier than a pancake. Waffles should be crispy. I tried to eat it, but gave up. I should have turned around when I saw that the place was empty- clearly was for a reason. My partner had a non GF waffle was also disappointed in how undercooked his was.

name: Little June
editorial_summary: This quaint coffee shop with house-roasted beans & pastries also offers light fare like sandwiches.
reviews:
Seriously good breakfast sandwich. Had sausage and bacon, with egg and cheese on English muffin as base. Local ingredients matter as everything I've had tastes so fresh.


Love this "little" spot. Free refills for drip coffee. Oat lattes are delish! The atmosphere is fantastic; with always a SUPERB playlist for vibes. Definitely recommended whether you're passing through, or if you live in the area, or just moved to the area and need a little spot. I'm a local, but I love our vast variety of coffee spots. It is so great to edit, meet people, and enjoy how humans exist.


My daughter just moved into the area so we thought we'd check it out. The chickpea egg skillet was delicious and the chia yogurt was good too but the London Fog and espresso were not drinkable. The service was ok, not bad, not great. We will ill try out other coffee shops before returning.


I like the atmosphere of Little June and the coffee is good. Unfortunately, I have a gluten allergy and have asked for gluten-free modifications to sandwiches, but have inconsistently received gluten-free products. Several times I've left with a sandwich I thought was GF only to go back and ask for a new one because the bread was not GF. They also have very few GF options in general.


Good coffee, great atmosphere! I could have sat in there and read for hours it was like being in a good friends living room. It gets super busy though so you have to get there early if you want a good table

name: The Big Spoon
reviews: A very welcome addition to the food options in and around the Hudson from the lovely folks from Shatterbox Coffee. Everything I‚Äôve tried here has been fabulous from their soups and sandwiches to other local baked goods and savory snacks. As a bonus there‚Äôs also a small grocery section offering veggies, milk and other essentials. Super handy if you need something in a pinch and don‚Äôt have time to go to the supermarket.

name: Macchiato Caffe at The Juliet
editorial_summary: Corner coffeehouse with outdoor tables offering Italian espresso, grilled panini & salads.
reviews:
Staff remembers your name and order! What an amazing memory and care! Service is fast and quality is good! Seatings are super comfortable too. Hope they resume regular business hours soon post pandemic. Well done guys!


Very good food . Seriously some of the best sandwiches in Victoria . Very friendly staff. The staff also just seem extremely happy , either they are are world class actors/ actresses , or they are just legitimately really nice and just happy . It seems to natural to be fake. They seem like a really cohesive group that seem happy to work together. Highly recommend this place !


Been here a couple of times during my stay in Victoria. Great vibe and AAA service.


Just had the kindest service here! They recommended a Spanish latte and it‚Äôs ridiculously good! Food was super flavourful. Also appreciated that an employee was wearing a Moose Hide Campaign pin which was great to see :)


Exceptional customer service! Went in not knowing what I wanted except that I needed caffeine and tbh I‚Äôm a pretty indecisive person but after a few recommendations I decided to go with the Spanish Coffee and I was not disappointed, probably the best coffee I‚Äôve ever had! Will definitely be going again‚òïÔ∏è

name: Boom + Batten Restaurant & Cafe
editorial_summary: Stylish upscale restaurant on the waterfront plating Pacific coast inspired fish & meat dishes.
reviews:
My husband and I came all the way from Vancouver and we were super happy with everything we ordered. The service was excellent and situational aware. We ordered 3 different appetizers to share and they all came really fast. Then for the main course we had lamb and scallop risotto. I have to admit that everything was delicious. I would love to come back soon!


Enjoyed dinner with my girlfriend on the water on a cold winter night with a magnificent view of the water even when it was snowing. Showed up with no wait and was seated immediately and coats were checked. Server did take some time to come but understandable that it was a full house and during the holidays not all staff were on duty. Ordered the Risotto and Short Rib Lasagna and was definitely not disappointed at all. Food tasted great and whole experience was just good stuff. Will definitely be back!


I went for my Partners birthday. It was our first time here, and we will definitely be returning. The atmosphere was great with the amazing views of the Harbour, and the food was amazing.

We shared the bread&butter and the Humboldt squid appetizers(get the squid, seriously). Then, she had the scallop w/mushroom risotto, and I had the lamb.

It's definitely a place to check out .


What an awesome suggestion by our wonderful realtor Dane Kingsbury of Victoria ( I need to write him a review next). Our excellent server Nevin made our lunch a really great one .  We were a group of 7 so open table wouldn't let me book 7 so I booked 4 and 3 and when I arrived and explained to the lovely hostess she found us 2 booths (back to back) with panoramic water views. The food was fantastic and I thought for the price....it was very reasonable. The salads were crisp and fresh, my son loved his wagyu beef burger, steaks were done with perfection, mussels divine ( Nevin brought us a spoon as he gave us a great tip cause the broth is incredible) . Thank for such a great dining experience and kudos to Nevin....he even gave us a good recommendation for his barber üòÜ.


Went for brunch today as I‚Äôve seen the brunch menu and was intrigued by the Braised Short Rib Hash. The brunch menu has a good selection of items with several options of Eggs Benedict and several other delicious sounding items but I was there for the Hash. I like to order any breakfast item with Hollandaise on the side so I can add as much or little as I want, plus I want to see the food before it‚Äôs covered in sauce. The meal arrived and it did not disappoint! The eggs were poached a perfect medium, the potato hash browns were crispy on the outside and fluffy inside (they looked homemade but I can‚Äôt say for sure and forgot to ask) and the aged cheddar was a nice touch. The star of the dish was the braised short rib - amazing! And they did not skimp on the portion! Every mouthful was flavorful and delicious! It was one of those memorable dishes that will bring me back.

On a related note, I was at B&B a week or so ago for Happy Hour  with my sister and mother and we enjoyed a selection of items from the Happy Hour menu and to say we enjoyed them immensely is an understatement. Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt get any pics but next time I go for their Happy Hour I‚Äôll be sure to get some good pics

name: Avalon Restaurant
reviews:
Randomly tried this spot on the weekend and the food was fantastic. All five in our group thoroughly enjoyed our meals. The pancakes were fluffy the fruit was fresh and service friendly. It took a little while for our food to come out but it was worth the wait. I would definitely recommend coming here for brunch and will be back! The prices are also very reasonable.


Tried this spot for the first time, food was fantastic and good experience overall.

We went here on a Sunday morning at 9 and there was plenty of tables available.
We were greeted right away and offered water to start.

Once we had our orders placed, it took a bit of time for our food to arrive. There seemed to be two cooks in the kitchen. The food arrived and it was worth the longer wait. It had good flavour and was well presented.

I recommend this as a weekend breakfast spot!


I love Avalon. In terms of downtown breakfast places, it's slight out of the way... but that means it's rarely busy and there almost never a line. It's a small diner that serves hearty comfort food. They make their own oaten bread and jams. On my last visit, I had the Avalon Skillet and left super satisfied. My eggs were perfectly poached and everything was great!


I just had the Avalon Skillet and it was large, delicious and great value. The eggs were well cooked, and tasty. The homemade oat bread was delicious and I loved the strawberry compote thingy to go with it was nice. The potatoes were also nice and crispy. I will come back with friends and family.


My new favourite breakfast place. It‚Äôs a small greasy-spoon style diner, run by a family. The portions are large, the staff are amazingly friendly and the coffee is refillable. It was very busy the day we went and the staff/family was obviously struggling to keep up, but you could tell they were trying their best and everyone waited patiently. All around this place is amazing and I will go back many times.

name: Olive Olio's Bistro & Espresso
reviews:
Good coffee and croissant. Excellent place to hang out on a sunny day. You can walk to the beach from here as well


Ordered a smoked ham and Swiss croissant, a gluten free chocolate ship cookie and a London fog and all were fantastic. I went in and bought a second cookie, I can't remember when I had a gluten free cookie that tasted so good. Fantastic atmosphere inside, very calm and quiet. Definitely recommend this place for hot drinks and a bite to eat


The Americano was very good! Ham and Cheese croissant and vegetarian breakfast burrito was pre-made but heated up for us.  Pretty good and it was lovely sitting outside.üòÉ


My eldery mother goes here with her dog and Jonathon always takes such good care of her. He is very patient and knows she struggles getting the door open with her walker, so he greets her outside where she sits sorts everything out for her. This act of kindness is rare and my mom has finally found her little place that makes her feel comfortable. Thank you Jonathon!


Had a latt√© and a slice of orange cranberry pound cake. Latt√© was in a disappointingly small cup but tasted good. Cake was very stoggie like glue so def wouldn't reccomend. My friend had a muffin and it was stoggie too. It was impossible to have a private conversation even with music playing. It's a cute place with seating outside as well so we headed out there to talk more privately. Location is great if you're visiting the beach. Too bad about the baking though.

name: The Vic Cafe
reviews:
It's very clean and quiet because it's a cafe in The vic hotel. The staff is kind and the food is reasonable, so you can enjoy your time peacefully.


Staff were superb and very friendly. The coffee was nice and they were very nice about working around the combos for alternative choices. Only problem was the food, I am incredibly disappointed about the avocado bean burrito. I was unimpressed that the beans tasted like they came out of a Heinz beans can and the avocado wasn‚Äôt ripe, it was hard and had no taste as it wasn‚Äôt ready to be used yet. Very small as well
for almost $9, I would have went somewhere else for breakfast if I knew it was going to be like that..


As a proud resident of the Gorge neighbourhood, I am thrilled to see a coffee shop open up. My Americano was delicious and I look forward to trying everything else on the menu. I also saw that they have baby chairs, which is always a bonus as a parent.


Had the eggvacado bean burrito... the beans were from a can and the egg was very dry and the burrito for what you actually got was not worth the price in my opinion. If your in a pinch then this will suffice but if you have options go check out another eatery. The atmosphere is underwhelming and there is only two dining tables to actually eat at, the rest of the seating is couch style with coffee tables for eating. Service was like going to a coffee shop, nothing extra. My husband had a latte and said it was burnt tasting.


Im so happy to have a little coffee place I can walk to with decent hours. The coffee is excellent. The lady at the front is so sweet. The food was awesome, small and simple but very good (and well priced). We will definitely be back! üòÑ My bf says "its a good cuppa mocha"

name: Red Cedar Cafe
reviews:
What a lovely place with such welcoming staff.  Their mandate is fantastic, and it doesn't hurt that the food is quite delicious.  When you eat at the cafe, part of the proceeds go towards their efforts to feed our community.  I had heard such wonderful things about this place, and it did not disappoint.  Get a caesar, go for the breakfast hash.  My partner got the pancakes and loved them.  I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong.


Thank you so much for your "can't pay" payment option on frozen items! If I could use my Visa Debit Acct, I'd love to donate $ sometime.


Went and did some bread bagging at the Ref Cedar Cafe in order to support our community. The people who work and volunteer here are even better than the delicious food! I highly refined this local joint!


I chose to volunteer here with my stepson to have him see and experience the incredibly wonderful help that comes out of Red Cedar Cafe. He was welcomed by the entire staff and was happy to be put to work to help prepare the nutritious meals prepared there.

If you‚Äôre new to Victoria too it‚Äôs a great place to volunteer doing delivery as it teaches you the layout of the city.


I was injured at work recently and my employer (who also provided housing accommodations) laid me off and essentially evicted me. The Red Cedar Cafe has been my saving grace, allowing me to have access to affordable (and/or free) healthy and filling meals.

I recommend supporting them if you can (with money, or food donations) because they‚Äôve got an unreal meal program that undoubtedly helps a lot of individuals and families in need. I hope to volunteer for them in the future so I can give back!

name: Yates Coffee Bar
editorial_summary: Modern space with patio seating & a menu featuring classic coffee shop beverages, pastries, & fare.
reviews:
Don‚Äôt be mistaken -this discreet cafe packs a punch! Hands down high quality dishes regardless of what you pick on their diverse menu. Sometimes they are understaffed but the wait is worth it! Bonus their menu is Greta-approved, vegan without compromise. The have a late-day ghost menu with burgers and other dinner options. Amazing baked goods and coffees.


My new favourite place in town to get vegan comfort food! Their chick‚Äôn club sandwich was the best vegan sandwich I‚Äôve had, you could taste how much effort was put into it! All their other menu items I ordered as well were delicious!


I‚Äôve had the double-decker breakfast sandwich (in an English muffin), an oatmeal-raisin cookie and the B.E.L.T. Deluxe, which was really good. Good food! Sometimes available are day-old muffins for half-price. Great place for food and hot drinks. Central location.


OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!

I don't know where to start. The girl behind the counter was very helpful. Made some great recommendations! We ordered the Spring Fog and Lavender Latte, both were yum üòã, and the Flower Power and Mocha muffin (also delicious!) and lastly the Garlic Cheez Bun and wow! That Garlic cheese bun was so good! So happy I got it


A nice little cafe like this should definitely be commended!

The food feels healthy (as it is!), the atmosphere is relaxing, and the coffee is actually great!

I was pleasantly surprised to find micro-greens here at a VERY reasonable price!

Thank you for helping us to stay healthy when we‚Äôre out and about!

Love this place!!!

name: New Owly Cafe
reviews:
Great bao! Awesome staff. Really enjoyed their coffee too.

We‚Äôve tried the pork, beef meatball, chicken. They‚Äôre all good. My favourite is the pork with surprise peanut butter (pictured) and my partner‚Äôs favourite is the beef meatball.


Very nice people, and lots of yummy looking drinks. Lavender London fog was average: couldn‚Äôt taste the lavender or Earl grey, it tasted like steamed milk. Baos look good


A huge variety of latte choices including holiday season varieties. My favourite snack here is Bao Bun (glazed pork filling).


Cute little place with absolutely delicious Bao. So glad I found this place after moving to Victoria from Vancouver! The drink menu is extensive which is great for someone like me who can't have caffeine or dairy. Still lots of options for me! On this visit had their strawberry acai cooler which was great.

While the branding and furnishings are nice, it does feel more like a hole in the wall to get ones food to go rather than sit and eat. Though they do have a few tables it's a bit cramped and cluttered feeling. Maybe a slight redesign of the layout would help? Still, great spot for a breather while shopping, or to stop by and take something to the waterside. And the food more than makes up for the lack of ambience.


The honey glazed pork bao was simply amazing. I‚Äôm the best bao I‚Äôve ever had and definitely loves up to its reputation. Great value for the small price. Packed with pork, cucumber and cilantro. Lattes are delicious as well, will definitely be back!

name: Shatterbox Coffee Company
editorial_summary: Hip, industrial outpost for coffee, tea, hot chocolate plus soup & baked goods in art-filled digs.
reviews:
I've seen the other location in passing but I didn't know they had a location inside The Hudson. My boyfriend recommended this place when I threw my back out this morning so I'm very thankful he suggested giving this place a try. All of the staff were hospitable and took the time to bring the food to us (we're seated almost halfway in the public market), making sure we have all the condiments needed.

With the food and my pain medication finally kicking in, I feel fresh as a daisy to conquer the day. üôÉ


This breakfast made our day!
Everything is perfect about this place: location, interior, coffee, service, and food. OMG! Even though it may seems that there are not a lot of options to choose from, all of them are very different and you will totally find yours.
My avocado toast was not only very tasty, but also incredibly nutritious.
If we ever come back to Victoria, this will be our Breakfast Place!

Thank you guys! You ROCK!


Probably the only place I have been able to find with GREAT ESPRESSO and a truly LARGE size that doesn‚Äôt cost over $7-8. Better than Starbucks or Macchiato. Love this place for lunch and coffee runs.


Shatterbox is awesome! The staff are so friendly and everything is so good. Vegan and gluten free options are great, no idea about drinks as I didn‚Äôt try any. The vegan option for the benny is really good! The chocolate espresso beans are delicious.


Pretty good coffee! I got the ‚ÄúGraham Cracker‚Äù specialty coffee and it tasted like the pumpkin spice latte from starbucks. Overall, pretty good. The cinnamon is not too overpowering.

name: Selkirk Cafe
reviews:
My favourite place. The nicest and friendliest service. Clean and comfy seating areas. Bright beautiful space. Lots of snack and food options. Nice music. Great for taking a second to yourself or chatting with a friend. Beautiful and cute decor.


Phenomenal cafe. Most delicious Korean lunch options available in the week. Excellent coffee/tea selection and Andrew the owner and the staff are the kindest. This is the cafe to visit while you are in the gorge area!


Tasty, but not worth the money. Paid $15 for the Tuesday special which is tasty but consists of nothing but white rice for the most part and a tiny piece of (very tasty) fish. For a work lunch, it is not worth the money. For less I can grab a diverse and tasty meal at other cafe's in the area.


Great and kind servings, and cozy and comfy atmosphere. The lady owner welcomed me and my wife for our first visit and gave a nice explanation of the menu. And the barista served awesome coffee, soup and Bibimbab which is one of Korean traditional meals.
Taste and service are all perfect!


Perhaps the most cheery staff of any coffee shop in Victoira. Very well extracted espresso, nice milk technique and just that little bit of effort put into an otherwise glass and metal cube to show that they care.

name: Tre Fantastico
editorial_summary: Understated cafe serves coffee & espresso plus small plates & charcuterie to pair with beer & wine.
reviews:
Terrible food and service. We had toast that look like bread sticks and the yogurt parfait tested expired. It was so sour. They said it was Greek yogurt but the taste was so sour we couldn‚Äôt eat a single spoon of it. They offered to replace the yogurt with a bagel and then they told us they would charge us for it.


This little cafe is on the ground floor of the Parkside Hotel and Spa all suite hotel. They have a healthy line up of patrons waiting to order, and only four tables outside. We drove by one day and saw people holding their food and looking at the four little tables outside. I think they also have a couple of tables setup in the lobby of the hotel, plus the hotel lounge area, I'm sure Tre patrons can sit in the lobby as well. We had breakfast there. They experienced internet problems when it was my turn to order and pay, I had to pay cash. And fortunately, I had some cash with me instead of just relying on mobile pay. Cappuccino, latte, toast and jam. Although the bread was nice and chewy, they cut the slices so thin that it was almost like eating fresh melba toasts. The home made jam was too sweet for me. The picture of the cappuccino shows very wimpy foam ‚Äì yes, that's what it was.


We had a family vacation at the hotel and this was by far my favorite place.  Thank you James and crew for fabulous service, food and drinks on the Friday night.  The kids loved the hot chocolates in the morning and I enjoyed a few Chai Latte's. Definitely recommend a nice place to unwind at the end of the day, or get yourself going in the morning.


This was the location attached to our hotel, which gave a gift certificate for our stay.   We would have gone anyway.   Weather was beautiful and we could eat outside, creating a particularly nice ambience.  Happy hour meals were quite good, as were drinks.   Service was attentive.   We would return.


Wow!!! 5 Star Flavour at an incredibly affordable price - Did I say Wow?! Lol üòÇ A medley of comforting delight (Sweet Potato Gnocchi) but with a mysterious twist! Radish, Peas, Roasted Apple, and a Beautiful Homemade Cream Sauce! Arugula Garnish on the side - Tasteful and blended perfectly.

On a rainy night, a wonderful local option and at 7pm open for dinner!!

My favourite coffee shop but now a dinner place? Amazing!

name: Uptown Bistro
reviews:
First time going to the Uptown Bistro. Loved it and would return. Ordered their calimari which had a great spice to it (was so good) and no unpleasant fishy taste! Highly recommend you try this. I also got the chicken strips and fries. The strips were good, the fries were great. Waitress was friendly and attentive. Great meal!


Had a lovely dinner. Staff were fantastic and the burger and salad were top shelf. Highly recommend stopping in.


Updated: I can no longer recommend breakfast. I don't know what happened. It used to be a great place for a classic breakfast. Now it's like some experimental kitchen serving unrecognizable dishes. I tried the French toast, a simple dish of bread, eggs, and milk, fried and served with butter and maple syrup. What arrived was thin slices of bread absolutely drowning in what I can only describe as thick orange goo of some sort, with a pile of bananas on top (a generous portion at least). It didn't resemble French toast in any way. A good example of "improving" on a simple idea until it becomes a disaster. I really should have photographed it because it was unbelievable. The flavours in this dish are supposed to be simple and delicious. Whatever this was ruined it.

By all means, come for lunch and dinner. The burgers are excellent, the steak pie is amazing, and the server is lovely. One of my favourites. You also can't believe the value. It's still one of the least expensive diners in town. But skip the breakfast as the chef seems bored with it and is trying to overcomplicate it.

Earlier review below:

Returned for dinner and enjoyed a wonderful steak and mushroom pot pie with a lovely flakey pastry crust. The service from Gurneet was friendly and welcoming.


The food was not good. Everything was incredibly bland. I had the salmon sandwich, and it was overcooked, dry, and underseasoned.  My wife had fish and chips that were incredibly underwhelming.  Fries had no seasoning at all. Food was just bad. Low quality ingredients and poorly executed.
My partner asked for a long island iced tea, and our server basically just said no because she didn't know how to make it. Ummm... that's what Google is for.  Look it up! Make it happen. Her response just blew my mind as I could see all the ingredients on the bar shelf. Our server did go off shift before our meals arrived, and the girl that took over was about the only highlight of our entire experience.  The second server was quite pleasant, but it didn't make up for the awful food.
Needless to say we will not be back and I would recommend you just keep driving. Skip this place.


Kid you not Victoria, if you haven't tried their BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger you're missing out! Make sure to go down and get it as it's way better hot and fresh, and cap it off with a $5.50 Blue Buck :)

Whatever they've changed over the past year is working! Way better than most places in town, and the pakoras are absolutely bang on too!

name: Beacon Drive In Restaurant
editorial_summary: Long-running, old-school diner known for its burgers, sandwiches, hot dogs & ice cream.
reviews:
One of the best places to have food around Beacon Hill Park. Don‚Äôt forget to check out the soft serve ice cream (vanilla), chicken burger and my personal favourite Fish n Chips. Food works wonderfully on your taste bud. Staff is very efficient and hardworking. Loved the in restaurant service as well. Staff absolutely deserves a raise. Highly recommended while being in Victoria especially around Dallas road. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è


Food was really good. A nice place to stop by for lunch. We thought it was a drive through but there is actually parking and seating available. We had the eggs salad, chicken fingers, chicken burger and oyster burger. Oyster was my favorite and a definite must try. Oh the ice-cream was also certainly good.


My friend and I decided to go here for lunch.
We went inside as the line was short.
It was super busy and very loud.
When I picked up our food, I noticed that I got French fries instead of the onion rings I ordered .
I asked for them to be replaced.
Then, to make things easier, I said I would eat the fries.
The gentleman helping me said he would bring me onion rings.
I was truly disappointed as they were stuck together and way over fried.
I had to go back to get sauce for chicken fingers and was told I had to pay. Even though 1 pk is included.
He ended up bringing the sauce over, not knowing we had none.
Then it was time to get into my burger.
It wasn't even warm.
I took it  back and asked for my money to be refunded.
The same gentleman brought me my $ to the table.
I have been to this place so often and have had excellent burgers.
Today was a disaster.
On top of that, the same gentleman had to ask an employee to get up from one of the tables that is for paying guests.
The two older ladies actually apologized for asking her to move.
Wth?
What is the matter with this generation ?
I have yet to call the manager and put in a complaint.

I get that fast food places get busy.
It was one issue after the other today.
I'm completely disappointed with my visit today.


What a fantastic spot! Food comes up promptly and always so good! Ice cream of course is delicious too! Staff works very good together and makes the experience that much better. Very family friendly and good for any occasion.
Enough parking around and there‚Äôs also a bus stop next to it‚Äôs so accesible too (routes 2, 3, 5, 10)


We ordered a screaming hot burger, onion rings, and a turkey sadwich for $21.  A side of 3 pickle slices was $1.20. The onion rings felt like they were fried for two days. My burger had me screaming in regret. The sadwich made me sad. I was confused if this was how my order was supposed to be. If you're looking for the place that's got that juice, this ain't it. But they have some ice cream.

name: Breakwater Bistro & Bar
editorial_summary: Cozy, waterfront locale with pub grub, local craft beer & coffee, plus outdoor seating.
reviews:
Had a crispy chicken burger and and ice coffee on the patio. Super delicious. Perfectly seasoned. Service was friendly and reasonably fast. If I could change one thing it would be to add an umbrella over our table but I could have chosen to avoid the sunburn and sat inside. Not the restaurant‚Äôs fault. Will come again.


Great place to grab a bite or grab and go. The service was friendly and efficient.   The serving sizes ample.  Good thing we could take a walk after our tasty meal.


Beauty view, amazing location! I had the veggie burger and a non-alcoholic mojito. Very tasty. Would have given 5 stars if the burger had a few more toppings. It was a bit light but otherwise really good!


This a great place to have dinner, coffee or desserts after a walk on Victoria s Dallas rd waterfront. Good menu selections at reasonable prices. Great nachos. Tonight we had a glass of Grafigna Malbec with chocolate tart.Mmmm. Personnel is very friendly. The view of the pier and the cruise boat terminal is very nice.


Woke up decided to come to the Breakwater for breakfast. What a genius idea. My Avocado Toast, scrumptious, my latte, served the way I like it, Euro style, and came with a heart. Music is great, I felt as if I was in one of those restaurants you see in tv. The young serveur was nice, attentive, came few times to check on me. I love this place. I suggest everyone to come here for breakfast. No greasy food here.
The ambiance just great!!! Okay, now heading out to work!!!

name: Sherwood
editorial_summary: Contemporary bistro with a patio serving gourmet light fare & sharing plates, plus cocktails.
reviews:
Had a fantastic, romantic evening at this lovely restaurant.  Great ambiance, very cool Industrial decor.  The service was amazing - they asked about dietary restrictions (vegan, celiac) when confirming our reservation over the phone and when we arrived, the staff was knowledgeable and was prepared to discuss/adjust the menu for us.  The food was excellent - presentation was beautiful and the food was delicious.  Highly recommend and we will be back.


Oh that breakfast sandwich‚Ä¶. I got the aji verde breakfast sandwich with a side of bacon and it was delicious!
The eggs in the omelette were so fluffy and flavourful. All the flavours meld together beautifully and it is very satisfying. The brioche bun was soft and fresh.
The portion sizes are plentiful.
Modern chic vibe and friendly staff.
Service was fairly quick


Great spot for breakfast & brunch! The outdoor seating is great, too. Our server, Jack, was super friendly, and the food and coffee were both perfect! It made our morning. They have options for vegans -  I had the avocado toast, minus the egg, and I got extra avo in lieu of the egg. I can‚Äôt wait to go back & try the Bircher oat bowl next time.


I feel the need to shout this from the roof tops!!! This was an excellent meal with excellent service. I can‚Äôt believe I spend as much time as I do in Victoria, with parents who live here and I didn‚Äôt know about Sherwood until today.

I met a friend here for coffee and was so happy to see that they offer coconut milk. The last of the plant based milks that are offered at coffee shops.

I took a peek at the dinner menu and talked my dad into trying it out for dinner (my last meal with him before I fly out).

First of all we had THE best waitress/server!!  Ally was bubbly, informative, and attentive. She knew the menu, made amazing suggestions and took the time to get to know us.

It‚Äôs suggested that the plates are for sharing so that‚Äôs exactly what we did.

Cauliflower steak, sardines, beetroot salad and mushroom calamari. Fresh, delicious, inventive and beautiful.

Cocktails were amazing as well. I had the humble bee and asked for it to be less sweet than normal. The bartender personally came over and made sure that I didn‚Äôt need anymore locally sourced honey. The 4 ingredients were all grown within 4km of the restaurant. Fabulous!!!

Victoria needs more creative, inspired restaurants like this one. I will be back for sure.


Was an absolute hidden gem for our first trip to Victoria. We were heading to a highly recommended place across the street that had a line for brunch, too long for us. Took a shot at Sherwood and am thankful now for that long line across the street. Would absolutely make this stop again the next time we‚Äôre back in Victoria. Service was amazing and some how, the food was even better!

name: Bubby Rose's Bakery & Cafe
editorial_summary: Quaint mainstay for house-baked sweet & savory items, including gluten-free goods, in a cozy setup.
reviews:
Do not think about it. So far best desserts I've tried in so long! So I've always like dessert but must of the times in happy with them but there's is something missing. I've ordered new York cheesecake, flourless chocolate tart and apple caramel apple crumble, and let me tell you they were amazingly delicious! My favorite would be the cheesecake. I was looking for the perfect cheesecake in BC and found it here. Totally my favorite place for sure


Had a great latte and Salmon Breakfast Sandwich here (the sandwiches are pre-made, but they heated it up for me). The breakfast sandwich is made of buttery, savoury biscuits which are delicious. Took some cinnamon buns to-go: very tasty (almost as good as my mom's... but that's a high bar). Reasonable prices. Solid place - check it out if you're in the area.

*Note: Bubby's bun is the left one in the pic; I did a "cinnabun-off" against the Sally Bun, and I have a slight preference for Bubby's (although both were good).


I‚Äôve been here a dozen times with friends and it‚Äôs always enjoyable. They have amazing mochas and it‚Äôs what I usually get. Their croissants and breakfast sandwiches are definitely worth the try if you‚Äôre looking for something savory. All of their desserts are delicious. They are also open pretty late which can be nice after work/school.


Great little place with indoor and outdoor seating. Good selection of vegan food for a light meal. Terrific coffee as well.  Say hi to Esteban as you walk in. I enjoyed the vegan chili w a gluten free bun.


Absolutely yummy baked goods! Vegan options available too. Our favorite was the caramel apple crumble and chocolate shillings. The chocolate quinoa sandwich was great too.

name: Bubby Rose's Downtown
reviews:
I have to change my rating of Bubby Rose‚Äôs üòü I primarily would go to Bubby's for the espresso, and did really enjoy it. Good crema, shot volume, heat, etc...Alas, recently they decided to change the bean & roast - and it is no good. Why are decisions to change the espresso bean & roast made by people who don't understand(or value), produce, and drink great espresso..?! (I would also mention that Bubby's snack's and location are still great!)
So I continue my search for the best espresso in the land...simple process yet very difficult to produce, both on a 1-off basis as well as over time.
üòî


Met a colleague for a business meeting here for my first visit last week.The staff are very kind and friendly. The atmosphere is totally not pretentious. Tables are quite small. Makes for a socializing but not the best for sitting down to discuss business, and probably not enough space if you like to work for hours at a coffee shop, plus there is no plug to charge your device.
