The girl who was working at the time was very nice and help full, she even offered me to charge my laptop behind the bar (in their working area). The other comment I have is the ordering area. t is a little awkward if you have not been before. But hey, it's about the coffee, food, quality of service and ambience and they all definitely score high with me. I would visit again.


First off I am sure the owner will jump in and reply to this negative review (see my post below for why) so I‚Äôm just going to be honest and upfront‚Ä¶
This was our first and last visit to Bubbys, we live right across from them in a condo and we are so disappointed in our visit.
They asked if we wanted our sandwiches toasted and our pizza reheated up..
Absolutely we did so we said yes, what happened next shocked us both‚Ä¶
they microwaved our sandwiches and pizza- yes microwaved the sannies with lettuce, tomatoes, onions etc inside.
ü§¢
And the pizza, well holy moly‚Ä¶
What happens when you use a microwave to heat up meat and veggies in a bun with sauce etc‚Ä¶
The pizza, well hello gooey and goopy dough, just inedible.
Absolute mush and disgusting, the staff didn‚Äôt seem to care and said the owner will most likely say something if we posted our review online.
We mentioned how this wasn‚Äôt what we were expecting and they didn‚Äôt know how to reply they just said this is what the owners wanted down.
We threw away our food after one bite each and decided to not go back to any of the locations
The services wasn‚Äôt great but the food was shameful and an embarrassment.
Save your money and go elsewhere, trust me on this one.

Also, there is a post about this company on Reddit, wow, I encourage everyone to look it up on that site, there are over a 100 people complaining about this business ever since it changed hands in 2018.
What a shame.


Great atmosphere and good food. Support local!


I always thought the food was good enough, not outstanding but overall tasty!

The management however is unprofessional and sketchy (not paying staff on time or the right amount for example).

Anyone complaining about the service don‚Äôt blame the students working there.

name: Heron Rock Bistro
editorial_summary: Casual Canadian bistro with occasional live music & a menu of seafood, poutine, burgers & breakfast.
reviews:
Everything I ordered was NYC quality, no kidding. Hole-in-the wall‚Ä¶don‚Äôt let it fool you. They make & bake so many things in-house it just puts their food over the top. Calamari & Caesar salad were awesome.  Oysters were super fresh.  Prices were quite reasonable compared to the tourist places downtown.  Go here you will not be disappointed!


I absolutely love Heron Rock! Best Chicken and Waffles Eggs Benny in town. Tucked away in James Bay with a warm friendly atmosphere and the loveliest staff, definitely worth a visit! I would highly suggest brunch, they serve all week until 3pm. Chefs Choice Triple Benny is a great way to explore the menu or for people who can't decide and like a surprise. The chef will make you three different Benny's of their choosing and it's been super yummy every time! If you're feeling like a Cesar or Mimosa, Heron Rock has a fantastic list of all kinds of Cesar's to try as well as their "Manmosa".


Heron Rock Bistro is a really great place to dine in and enjoy a meal. My wife and I visited from the Edmonton area and we were very glad that we found this place. If you are not familiar with a certain menu item, it may come as a surprise, so make sure you know what you are ordering first. I had the reuben sandwich with a house salad, which was spectacular! The dinning experience was nice and the staff are accommodating. Thank you Heron Rock Bistro staff for the wonderful experience:) We hope to visit again one day in the near future.


What a lovely place with fantastic staff and great & tasty food. I had the freshly cooked mussels, they were amazing, afterwards the warm Reuben sandwich which I also enjoyed. The bread pudding was delicious.


After a long absence, it was wonderful to come back to the Heron!  The place is even better than before, and the staff are upbeat, knowledgeable  friendly and enhance the dining experience.  The kitchen continues to shine with tasteful  innovative creations and the whole atmosphere is genial, comfortable,  and inviting.!

name: Wannawafel
editorial_summary: Low-key, quick serve outlet offering Belgian-style waffles with various fruit toppings.
reviews:
Awesome waffles! Best waffles in have had so far! This was the highlight of our trip to Victoria. Cozy little place in the market square. Looking forward to visiting again!


Amazing Belgian waffles out here. They are authentic and served fresh. We got the basic waffle and ice cream scoop and enjoyed every single bite! 10/10 would come back!


Came here years ago when I was visiting Victoria. The waffles were really good so I thought I would give it another go. It's still incredible and the guy working here was very nice and quite helpful with directions. Would absolutely recommend!!!


The best waffle shop in Victoria, almost every one knows about them. The shop is in a very nice location at market square where you can check out other stuff around too. One star off because the staff wasn‚Äôt so friendly when we visited recently but overall, they got delicious treat, even the plain one with no chocolate sauce or whipping cream, quick and nice service most of the time. I will always go back here for waffles


The best Belgian waffle I ever tried in Canada. Tastes very authentic. They are served exactly like in Belgium, fresh, warm, rich and sweet. Amazing!

name: Ruth & Dean - Luncheonette & Bakery
reviews:
Popular cafe on a cute little street outside of the Victoria city centre. We stopped in on a long bike ride for a quick coffee and stayed for some baked goods. There was lots of space to park our bikes and to sit outside and enjoy the weather. The staff was very help and friendly!


Pleasant neighbourhood bakery and caf√© with indoor and outdoor seating. If not famous already for the breakfast sandwich, it will be. This was bacon, egg, cheddar, tomato, avocado and chimichurri on a magnificent biscuit. The caf√© offers numerous other choices along with excellent coffee. Friendly service of course.


Ruth & Dean has one of the best breakfast sandwiches in all of Victoria. Chimmichurri on a house biscuit, egg, cheddar, tomato, and of course, avocado. The bacon is an add on, and boy is it worth it. The treats are delicious and almost impossible to pass up. The coffee is hard to top. Very family friendly and located in the quaint Estevan Village, a short walk away from Willow‚Äôs Beach.


My elderly dad and myself visited Victoria from Vancouver just before the long weekend of Thanksgiving. We were originally going to take one of those red double decker bus tours from The Empress Hotel but unfortunately & fortunately they were closed between Tuesday and Thursday so we decided to just get a day pass for regular BC transit buses and took the #2 bus to tour from DT to James Bay beach then back to DT and then eventually to Oak Bay beach area. As the result, we saved $70 for both (the red double decker bus is $80 for two) and we were able to find this cute corner bakery/coffee shop, ‚ÄúRuth & Dean‚Äù. It totally looks just like a country side rustic coffee shop which I like personally, and we decided to grab some drink and sit outside table on the side walk under the beautiful old huge oak tree. And I had chai latte with almond milk (lactose intolerant üòµ‚Äçüí´ü•õ) and it was delish! Their baking goods looked also so good but unfortunately we were already full with lunch earlier so we saved for the next time. Their beautiful cake looked so good, the ladies ahead of me ordered a big slice of it and she said it‚Äôs very good! And I believe her. üòÇ The place is very spacious, nice outdoor tables and nice cozy and peaceful atmosphere all around that area. I recommend anyone who likes to have a little get away, find this little cute community with some other shops and restaurants. The gorgeous clean beach is just a few blocks down on Estevan St. It was such a nice treat for both my dad and myself to relax and refresh ourselves from living in the heart of Vancouver DT.


We quickly googled a spot to stop for lunch while we were out biking & just the vibe in the pictures made me want to check out this gem of a place! And we were so happy we found Ruth & Dean‚Äôs! We had the BLT with salad, corn chowder, the oat & fudge bar & a mocha. üëå Deeeeelish!

name: James Bay Inn Restaurant
reviews:
Nice old place in the heart of James bay 10 min walk from down town no line up big and roomy  ordered a full candaron breakfast first bite amazing. Tastes like home made bread  vary happy with the size of the breakfast. The service is good. If you like a place for breakfast without a line up  this is your place parking is easy too


Can't say enough great things about this hotel! Immaculately clean. Roy at the desk was a gem. Dinner in the bar was great with friendly conversation, and they accommodated us when we said we needed our breakfast to be quick. Great location to visit the stunning Beacon Hill Park. Rooms are small, but that's to be expected for an historic hotel like this. Highly recommend!


One of the best breakfasts for the best price I've had in years.  And all of the eggs Benny's were phenomenal. Also, the various servers each of the 3 times I was there were absolutely fantastic. Can't wait to go back.


This is the second time I've stayed here. I love it, the rooms are small and still use the old style hot water heating radiator so if it's cold in there it will take a bit to heat up. There is no AC so I'd expect it can get hot in the summer. The hotel has a colourful history and is over 100 years old. The hallways are adorned with Emily Carr Paintings (she died there) also the hotel supposedly is one of the most haunted in Canada although I haven't experienced anything while there.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you're into older style hotels that aren't just another boring place then this place is for you.


This is one of my favorite spots for dinner when in town.  I‚Äôve tried almost everything on the menu and have yet to find something I didn‚Äôt enjoy.

In addition to the regular menu, they have specials each evening, which typically include a pasta and a main entree.  These can sell out quickly on busy nights.

The Caesar salad is amazing and I always get one!

There are several vegetarian options and the veggie burger is great.

Bar options are limited in the restaurant but you can enjoy beer or wine with your meal.

Service is always friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is cozy.

name: Bubby Rose's Bakery & Nosherie
reviews:
The atmosphere was chill, The service ok . The peacan, raisin, cinnamon roll was really Good üòä.
The coffee ‚òï was also very Nice.


Nice neighbourhood bakery with friendly service.  Prices are reasonable and comparable to Starbucks‚Äô bakery but here tastes better and less greasy. The bakery items has a homemade look and tastes great, not overly sweet. I ordered a carrot cake, Portuguese tarte, and a chocolate chip cookie.   Carrot cake has pineapples, cinnamon, and I think walnuts. The Portuguese tart was different than the ones I usually get in Chinese bakeries in that these ones have vanilla bean in the custard. Chocolate chip cookie is the crispy kind and had a caramelized chocolate flavour.  Very yummy, I would come back for more!


Great coffee and a good assortment of pastries and sandwiches.


Nice little coffee shop. Good cup of coffee, great selection of pastries, cakes and sandwiches.


Good food,  lots of options, I recommend the croissants.
But if you're not a young attractive university student don't expect the staff to be particularly pleasant. The staff will bend over backwards for a pretty face, but otherwise you're just wasting their valuable time.
Do yourself a favour and head a few blocks north to the Cook and Meares street location, same great food and drinks with much better customer service.

name: Fern Cafe and Bakery
editorial_summary: Cozy vegan cafe dishing up housemade burgers & handcut fries, plus classic poutine & bakery items.
reviews:
Funky cafe on the corner with people of all walks of life coming in and out. We came here to test out their vegan options and they didn‚Äôt disappoint.

Breakfast sandwich had vegan eggs and sausage, packed between a fluffy ciabatta bun. The sandwich was a mouthful to say the least that will keep you filled for a while. Western scrambler was my favourite, it tasted just as good as it looked. The tofu scramble was packed with veggies, and the tomato balanced everything perfectly. Not too much sauce and also a very generous portion, but not so heavy that you leave feeling lethargic. As for the coffee, it was pretty average, wouldn‚Äôt say it was anything special.

Overall, this is a cozy place to check out for great vegan eats. Price is reasonable, generous portions and large selection of vegan items. They also had festive drinks üéÑ


Fern consistently delivers 10/10 for friendliness, cleanliness, food variety, punctuality, and flavour. I have NEVER been disappointed in anything I've ordered. Within my first couple visits years ago, they remembered my name - which is so homey, and definitely adds to the experience!
It's always difficult to decide what to order - so my husband and I always choose 2 separate hot meals (so we can taste both), and 2-4 pastries üòÅ
The portions are HUGE, and easily 2 meals - so the pastries (also huge) are always saved for later.
I usually bring my stroller inside while dining in, and the seating has ample room to accommodate, so we don't have to go sit outside or in the car to enjoy a hot meal.
A friend of mine is gluten free, and said she's had no problem with Fern substituting items in order to accommodate her preferences.
My omnivore friends don't believe me when I tell them that yes, everything you're eating is definitely 100% vegan.
Thanks so much for always being a welcoming environment, and for such delicious food! It's so lovely to go somewhere and know without a doubt you're not accidentally being served non-vegan food.
Thank you!!


Decided to give this place a try looking at the reviews and turned out the reviews were 100% accurate.
My customer service experience here was top notch! The staff were friendly and helpful hosts!
My order was ready pretty quick despite how busy they were.
The "chickun" was crispy on the outside and juicy inside! If I could make vegan food this good I would turn vegan instantly!!!
The pancakes were light and super fluffy! I also ordered a mocha with oat milk which tasted delicious!! Looking forward to next time!!


So. Freaking. Good. I stopped by  for lunch with a girlfriend of mine who is a regular and did not leave disappointed! As someone who doesn‚Äôt eat meat for moral reasons, one of the things I missed most was a good chicken sandwich, and man I found it. I think this may sway my non-vegan hubby as well (slowly but surely!)

The texture bang on and flavour was delicious. I had a side of Caesar salad, which was crunchy and tasty as well. Not to mention the brownie and latte for desert, drool.

The owner clearly takes such pride in creating and serving delicious, ethical food options and considering the price of good ingredients, and portion size it‚Äôs good value.

I will be back soon, and can‚Äôt wait to try more of the menu.


When I first moved here to Vic I think every single person recommended me to check out Fern! I haven‚Äôt been back since they opened their indoor dining but their take-away service at their window was super efficient and covid-friendly! I appreciate all the creativity they bring to vegan options!!

(pictured: poutine, mac n cheese and pumpkin spiced latte)

name: Vis-√†-Vis
editorial_summary: French-inspired mains, charcuterie & wines in a wood- & brick-lined bistro with an intimate vibe.
reviews:
Very nice patio and two different menus options ( you can also order from The Penny Farthing menu). I only don‚Äôt give them a 5 star review because the menu doesn‚Äôt specify what the gluten free options or any other dietary options are. The service was good and they are pet friendly at the patio. I had a gluten free Brie pear prosciutto chicken burger. It was good but later on I realized that I could have opted for lettuce wrap and my server didn‚Äôt even mentioned anything. Anyway we enjoy our food and will definitely come back. üòä


First time dining here this weekend and was very pleasantly surprised it lived up to the hype! Best french onion soup I've ever had and escargot was fantastic. Will definitely be back!


1. chicken supreme
- so good! soft n tender, mushroom sauce and cabbage was right on the point 10/10!
2. lobster bisque
- amazingly good and i love the texture, could be more salty and richer though
3. french fries
- hot and crispy just perfecto

in general: very good service, there was a bit of waiting for the food but that‚Äôs fine, dinners good!

ratings: 9/10


Everything has been incredible, the attention of the staff and the food.  I recommend you share the menus, since they are very abundant.  I recommend this restaurant.


Worse restaurant food ever. Very lukewarm service.  Pictures say a thousand words. The carrots were charred black and inedible, the duck leg was black and there‚Äôs a rat, named Remi, that makes better Ratatouille.  Believe it or not, we had to pay for this.  Very, very sad that we didn‚Äôt go to our favourite, Brasserie l‚Äôecole.

name: Fathom
editorial_summary: Casual eatery with West Coast-inspired bistro fare at the Hotel Grand Pacific.
reviews:
Enjoyed a nice meal here with some friends - we shared all the appetizers on the menu (except salad) as well as the scallops entree. Service was excellent, room is very cozy and a nice amount of space between tables - really lovely renovations. The food is interesting yet approachable and you can tell the chef has really taken the time to created an elevated menu. My only ‚Äòdislikes‚Äô are personal preferences so I won‚Äôt get into them, however a couple dishes were a little busy and some of the fried items could have come a little crispier. Overall a great night, will definitely be back to try more dishes & drinks. A much needed addition to Victoria‚Äôs restaurant scene.


What an excellent find! We grabbed a table at 12:25pm on a Father‚Äôs Day Sunday, needing to be back across the street at the ferry terminal by 1:30pm for immigration/customs, and the kind folks at Fathom did an excellent job. I got a Caesar beverage ‚Äî good and spicy ‚Äî and we got a chorizo and bacon hash, chicken sandwich, and a classic eggs Benedict. All were served with flavorful home fries, and they were all really delicious; the portions were generous and the hollandaise was on point. I particularly liked the great spice level of the hash. The decor was elegant and classy without being fussy. It was the perfect Father‚Äôs Day brunch!


We stayed at the Grand Pacific so it was nice to just go downstairs and grab HH. Glad we check the restaurant out. We enjoyed the modern cozy atmosphere, warm welcome, and delicious drinks made by Chad. He is a character! We enjoy his company and drink a lot! His negroni version is phenomenal!
We had a couple of bites and it was pretty delicious!
Going to dinner here next time we are back in town!


We enjoyed our dinner at Fathom! The atmosphere, service, and food quality are absolutely 5 stars.
Thank you Francina for having us at the beautiful and comfortable window seats and Donna for helping us select our food and drinks to pair with.
Can't wait for the next time! :)


My husband and I have discovered this place through dine around Victoria this year, and we took our whole family to restaurant for mother‚Äôs day dinner this time. Food was delightful and atmosphere was comforting. The waiter was very professional and friendly. Their Arcadian salad with prawn and spicy tuna bites were absolutely 5 star starters and spaghetti vongole, steak and wagyu burger were really delicious, but scallop risotto was bit salty (Still good though). Overall, we had a great dinner and we will definitely be coming back.

name: 10 Acres Bistro
editorial_summary: This romantic option for farm-to-fork meals also offers cocktails & garden patio dining.
reviews:
We had an amazing experience at this location. The patio was such an amazing, peaceful and chill vibe. The food was incredible. We ordered the Mexican Corn, Halibut & Chips, and French Onion Soup. Everything was very well prepared and blew us away! For dessert, we tried the French Vanilla Creme Brulee which was absolutely incredible. The servers were very kind and ensured we were taken care of. We will definitely come back and dine here again.


10 acres delivers! the food is delicious, looks great and all from their own farm.
Make sure to make a reservation so you get a great table.
We had the chicken and mussels,  I feel it was a mistake. Should have stuck with one theme. Either seafood. Or no seafood.
The chicken was very very good.
I‚Äôd have it again.


Great location. Cocktails are not worth it although they sound really good on the menu. Service was a miss. Took us about 30 minutes from being seated until we got our orders in and took a bite. Quite loud if seated indoors. Seafood charcuterie was bomb! We were starving and this was THE fix. Humboldt squid appetizer was also very good. Worth trying.


The cocktails are great!! And the fresh onions soup has cheese on it bread in it. The lamb is the best I've ever eatenÔºåvery soft and juicyÔºÅDelicious oysters and pastaÔºÅ Black forest Chocolate cake also üëç


What an awesome place to hang out and eat good food. The exterior and interior screams chic and posh but the service and the warmth by the staff are anything but. It instantly feels welcoming and inclusive and the servers were so approachable as well. Got the set dinner and went with whatever the server recommended and legit, following their advice was the best choice I ever made after saying no to hardcore drugs.

Good intimate vibes, quiet enough to chat, enough white noise to fill out awkward silences and awkward moaning over food, and the service is quick and friendly. Would take all my significant others to this place because the servers seem sharp enough to pretend they don‚Äôt know about my other significant others. (It‚Äôs a joke I‚Äôm joking but not about the food it‚Äôs really good)

name: LURE Restaurant & Bar
editorial_summary: Casually elegant resort restaurant with a waterfront patio serving local seafood, cocktails & wine.
reviews:
Amazing service and saying the food is divine is an understatement. Plus, the view... We love the dome, it's much quieter and private. Last time we had the kids with us and we were so at ease there as we knew we were not bothering anyone and our toddler wouldn't just runaway. We ate at peace. It is not just good food, it's a dining experience that all couples and young families should have.


Let‚Äôs start with the positive. View is extraordinary, you get to see the inner harbour from a very good angle. Staff are friendly and helpful. Now the terrifying part is the food which is a hit and miss. Chicken wings were amazing. Burger, sandwich, and fish and chips were horrifying. It‚Äôs hard to screw up fish and chips on the island. So many other places do it so well. The batter was very thick AND soft. Thick batter we have seen, but soft thick uncooked batter is weird. As for the the burger and sandwiches, bacon was very hard, patty all you taste is salt, and the buns were quite burned. Fries, some were not folly cooked. Manager was quick to address our experience. People here are nice, but I don‚Äôt know if I would risk the chance for the food though.


Overlooking the harbor, this restaurant offers a stunning view that captivates. Too bad the rest wasn't the same. While the service was fine but not great, the food falls short of inspiration or taste.  Nonetheless, the picturesque location may still appeal to those seeking a scenic dining experience with average culinary offerings.


I took my mother and grandma here for dinner. It was wonderful to sit in one of the domes out side and have our own private space. The heater made it so cozy and we appreciated that there are blankets if we need. The food and drinks were amazing and the server was lovely. Our only complaint is after they served us coffee and a drink after dinner, the server  completely dissapeared. It would have been nice to have another round of drinks/ coffee but, we waited over 20 minutes AFTER finishing our drinks before giving up and going in to pay. At a nice establishment like this, I expect service right to the very end.


This place was great. Nice big restaurant area. Staff were great!
Really good quality food and nice drink. We actually laughed at another review about this place because it must have been an off night. Everything was great, big wine list too.

name: Aura Waterfront Restaurant + Patio
editorial_summary: Seasonal Pacific Rim‚Äìinspired cuisine, plus wines & microbrews, in a contemporary harbourside venue.
reviews:
We chose Aura for this year‚Äôs ‚ÄúVictoria Dine Around Dinner‚Äù.  Wow, simply the best food and experience.  Of course the views and vibes at the restaurant are what you expect‚Ä¶ sitting there makes you appreciate why Victoria is loved.  Service was friendly and welcoming.  Food was on another level, and the wine pairings were thoughtful and enjoyed. There is so much care, technique and experience put into the food.  With that in mind, I think the prices are on the low side.  Everywhere has increased their prices because of current issues surrounding operating restaurants in 2022 - so I feel you get quite a lot of value for their current pricing. It‚Äôs appreciated but understand if prices need to be adjusted.


It was such a peaceful experience eating with a sea view. We had brunch, which was chicken with waffles and eggs. The flavour in all the dishes was unreal, especially the soft texture of the waffles. We didn‚Äôt have a reservation but the staff was super nice and still gave us a view table. Couldn‚Äôt be any better. Big shoutout to Kaitlyn I believe, she was so friendly from saying hi to bye. She told us about the dishes and about places we could visit in Victoria while we were there. Overall, great staff and amazing food. On a side note, patio was closed when we visited so if you‚Äôre going to have a patio experience, just call the restaurant and confirm.


Spent a lovely night with good friends/fellow chefs thanks to the aura for supplying a amazing dining experience. The food was some best I've ever had in my life. Especially the tuna and the pork belly. Muah üëå. The plates are were all small and shared between two people yet by the end I was stuffed despite a big appetite. To conclude, for the price of only 65$ per person and eating such delectable food till a full belly I'd definitely recommend either this menu or single plates off it.


Would definitely give the overall High Tea experience at Aura a high score. The service was on point, the presentation beautiful, and the views are some of the best in the city. I also really loved the Japanese twist on most of the bites - starting with salmon aburi on an onikamiyaki pancake & a chicken katsu sandwich, ending with sesame tarts, matcha opera cake and more. But I did find myself wishing that all flavours were kicked up about two notches. Standouts we‚Äôre the glazed scone and katsu sandwich. Could live withouts include the pork bun, tamago sandwich and beets on a bun.


Great Western omelette and Aura Benedict! We enjoyed our stay in the hotel as well as our breakfast at Aura waterfront restaurant. We were also with 3 toddlers and they were kept busy with the provided drawing supplies which was nice.

name: McRae's Restaurant Ltd
editorial_summary: Contemporary bistro with outdoor seating & eclectic, globally inspired sandwiches & entrees.
reviews:
I love the atmosphere and service (waitress was great). However, food wise we only liked the Korean cauliflower per the suggestion from the waitress. My green salad was missing tomatoes and had almost no pumpkin seeds and cranberries. Felt very cheap. My friend power bowl had no sauce, and so little quinoa. Again not impressed and we were disappointed. Sangria were good. I‚Äôm willing to come back but I might stick to burgers.


A friend took me to McRae's for the first time and I was a little disappointed with the food I received. Granted, the restaurant was quaint. To start, my friend and I shared the hummus that was in the 'share plates' section and it was delicious. The naan bread/pita tasted super good with the hummus and the carrots was crispy and fresh. We weren't super hungry so we got a grilled cheese and the mac and cheese off of the happy hour menu. Can't go wrong with the grilled cheese, nice and crispy. The mac and cheese on the other hand, it was really disappointing. The cheese sauce they used made the whole thing super unappetizing, also the cold cheese and breadcrumbs on top just made it worse. Also it was lukewarm, it did not taste fresh at all. The service was alright, there was a lack of eye contact super mediocre.


Good veggie burger, great kids mac n cheese, tasty pulled pork sandwich. Nice service. It looks nice for having drinks with friends


Found this place via a Google recommendation. Love the cozy atmosphere and speedy service. I had the Salmon burger and it tasted so fresh and cozy. The bun and sauces added to this very satisfying flavour that I haven't tasted in a burger before. Furthermore, the onion rings were incredibly crunchy. Great meal. I'd personally recommend.


-good nachos, not a huge serving
-blue moon wings were great, came with carrots and dip
-sat outside on the patio with the heater

name: Q AT THE FAIRMONT EMPRESS
editorial_summary: Regal place at Fairmont Empress Hotel with locally sourced special-occasion entrees & global wines.
reviews:
Stayed at the Empress for 2 nights and looked forward to breakfast at the Q every morning. The food was fresh, prepared well, and tasted, well, like food should taste. It wasn't greasy, overly seasoned or overly salted.

Service was professional but friendly and the atmosphere was wonderful. The restaurant was clean and the Christmas decorations were very tastefully done.

I ordered the tater bowl which was very good. It wasn't oily and felt "clean". The fully loaded oatmeal was fruity and had a good mix of flavors from the berries, banana and brown sugar, cream for the oats. My partner had the French toast which she really enjoyed. The granola, we were curious what a 14 dollar granola tasted like, it was just granola with fruits. It was good, but not with the money. There were better options to be had.

Overall, I loved breakfast and look forward to returning again.


Atmosphere is very nice and high end. Service was very good, waiter was very on top of water and refills for our drinks.
I had the Lamb and without a doubt this was the best lamb I have ever had. The crust was made to perfection, very crisp but not burnt and season very well. The lamb flavor was present but not over barring. When I took a bit of the lamb, this was one of the few times I had to pause and close my eyes to full immerse myself in what I was eating. I would 100% recommend the lamb.


We‚Äôve been to Q a couple of times now. The first was summertime and enjoyed an outdoor dinner that overlooked the harbour. All the food was fantastic and the drinks were well crafted. Our second time we enjoyed sitting in their lounge and enjoyed late night pizza, complimentary popcorn, and some incredible desserts. The ambiance was lovely and we had excellent service from our waiter. A highly recommended experience if you‚Äôre willing to spend the money on it.


Received a gift certificate and used it with my partner. Server was polite enough and very professional as there definitely is an image to be held there I guess. It got busier around 6pm. Food was good, but we were able to splurge as the gift certificate was an appetizer, entree, and dessert per person with no maximum. The entrees are pricey.. $40 for a chicken dish ! But they are quality ingredients and you're also dining in a touristy spot of the city (we were asked where we were visiting from by the server for small talk). The other customers were dressed very casual to.


First time visit at the Fairmont Empress.
Went in for a lunch to celebrate a friend's birthday.
Kind of disappointed with the food offering, but that is compensated with the ambience and the live music.
Their Roasted tomato soup was really great.
And the Pizza dough they use is very healthy and tasty.
You have to have their rich chocolate cake if you are ever eating here, it was amazing.

name: The Courtney Room
editorial_summary: Stylish, cream-hued outpost serving dry-aged steak & seafood, plus a raw bar, cocktails & wine.
reviews:
Had an amazing dinner here last week! I‚Äôm still dreaming of the chocolate cake almond dipped dessert thingy‚Ä¶ it was to date the best dessert I have ever had ever!

The pricing isn‚Äôt for the faint of heart but the experience makes it more then worth it :)


Nice atmosphere, really good drinks provided by the best bartenders, Anton and Eric üëèüèº

From classic cocktails, the best fancy corn dog and one of the most unique cocktails I have ever had, the Mind Hive. Happy hour runs from 2 to 5.

Loved The Cortney Room.


I have been the The Courtney Room for brunch, happy hour, and dinner, and I have never been disappointed.

The food is fantastic, and they have numerous gluten free options if you require gluten free (even a separate fryer). A piece of advice - you MUST get the potatoes courtney - they are literally out of this world.

They have a fully stocked bar and can make you just about any drink, and they have a cocktail list that features unique drinks which regularly changes.

I would highly recommend The Courtney room for a special occasion dinner, happy hour drinks with friends, or a nice weekend brunch.


Underwhelmed. We went for Mother‚Äôs Day brunch and it was really nothing special. Their cappuccino was velvety and delicious, but everything else was a bit of disappointment. I had heard some many good things about their brunch over the years but I didn‚Äôt live up to my expectations, unfortunately. They do, however have great, fresh oysters for dinner.


The first time I went there, so the review is based off of one time. The food is alright nothing special, the chicken and waffles was room temperature at best. The Shakshuka was better for sure and worth a try. The service was not good, we had to keep trying to get their attention and barely had them check up on us.

name: Earls Kitchen + Bar
editorial_summary: Sleek, upscale chain serving gourmet burgers, global comfort food, cocktails, wines & beers.
reviews:
Not the best earls I‚Äôve been to but still good food! There‚Äôs not a lot open late in Victoria so this is a good option for a decent selection. The rare steak was very good, the truffle fries were really good. The rest was just OK.

The new truffle ravioli was disappointing and I got it with the prawns but they were pathetically small and underwhelming (not worth the extra $). The ravioli was good but felt a bit undercooked, the sauce was a bit watery and didn‚Äôt adhere to the pasta well.

The Cajun chicken was tasty and not dry, the ribs were a little dry. It came with potato salad which was kind of bland.

The atmosphere in here is nice and decent service! Good location, but if you‚Äôre driving since it‚Äôs downtown you need to take a bit of time to park.


I visited Victoria Canada on 6.30.2022 not only was the city breath taking the food at Earls was phenomenal! Our waiter was attentive and he was on top of our meal. It was delivered hot and he was such a nice person. I ordered the impossible burger and yam fries as my meal and they taste delicious. The appetizers were salt and pepper and BBQ wings everything was great tasting. I will return üòã.


After a tiresome day travelling, my partner arranged dinner for me. Given the quality of airport food (you already know), I was absolutely starved when I got home.

What a blessing this food was. From perfectly braised BBQ ribs, to potatoes with bacon bits and sour cream, to a fresh slaw, every bite was pure heaven. So much for trying to be vegetarian again ü•µüòÇ (joking of course, ish). The birthday cake was just as delicious. It was my first time trying those additions that came with the cake, but they really provided a nice texture and satisfying taste. Will 100% be returning !


Giving Earles 3 stars. First the positives. Decor was nice and the restaurant was clean. Also very friendly staff from hostess to our waitress.  Food came out promptly and visually very appetizing. My wife ordered the tuna poke bowl and she said she liked it. Unfortunately I can't say the same for my dinner. I ordered the Nashville chicken sandwich which was supposed to be spicy however it was anything but.  I understand it's supposed to be deep fried chicken but where's the chicken? And what was there I couldn't really taste because the batter was so heavy, dried up, and cold.  Needles to say if you are going to Earles avoid the Nashville chicken sandwich.


we did not book a table, but on Saturday evening they found a free place for us. Very attentive waiters. We ordered spring rolls, spinach - very tasty, beautiful serving of the dish. The only downside to this place is that the music is very loud....

name: 5th St. Bar & Grill
editorial_summary: This relaxed option for gourmet pizzas, roast chicken, beer & cocktails features two patios.
reviews:
Maybe I'm ordering the wrong items, or my taste buds are wonky?

Highlights:
Great service
Atmosphere
Location
Saw a number of group tables which looked happy
Wheelchair accessible (looked like it to me, which is nice)

Extra things to consider:
Parking

My experiences won't really stop me from coming back. We have family dinners for peoples birthdays and we manage to rotate as best as we could around restaurants in Victoria, so I'm sure someone will choose this place as a venue again.

Overall, family members (party of 9) mostly were pleased with their meal. All of us was happy with the service. We didn't feel forgotten, or felt like we were inconveniencing them.  Atmosphere is always consistent and warm when you walk in. The outdoor patio looks comfortable.

My only complaint is the food... never seems to be enough in fries (ok sorry, I guess potatoes are going up in price). My husband ordered the strips and fries (strips are always good, with the honey mustard), but the fries portion keeps seemingly getting smaller every year we come back. My pizza was good, but just good; seemed more like a fancy flat bread. It felt like it was alright, but felt like something was missing. The Artichoke dip was flavourful, no complaints there- nicely cheesy, had good consistency, didn't feel like we were really saving on portions so much.

Since the place does get busy, it's good to maybe note that parking could get tricky. We had to park a little further down at the residential street.

Again, maybe I'm just nit-picking, but I'll probably be back. I will just say the service is always good.


Absolute delicious food, they never disappoint! The place is lively and always has something going on. I have been here for trivia and music bingo and it was loads of fun! The bartenders are absolutely delightful and super knowledgeable! They also have a lovely fireplace.


Very much looking forward to coming here again. The atmosphere and decor were stellar. I had the 1/4 chicken and rib dinner and everything was delectable, including the coleslaw which usually never finds its way off the plate. The gravy was out of this world and everything on the menu was very reasonably priced.


Round two & Redemption (from August 2022): We thought we would give this place another shot and glad we did! The food was spectacular and service was on point!!

From 6 months ago (January 2022): The great venue and atmosphere was enhanced by the fantastic service and food!!! The wait- staff were amazing! So much so that we came back the next night after a long evening's work (6 hours) at exactly the same time, but sadly to find out the kitchen staff decided to shut down early to have a few pops. The night before was fantastic, the next night... not so much.


The lady who served me was absolutely wonderful! Check back in often, made sure I was comfortable and had my food served in a timely manner. Very well done, will be back again

name: Vista 18 Restaurant + Lounge
editorial_summary: Seasonal, organic cuisine is served morning til night at this chic harbourview rooftop eatery.
reviews:
Took my best friend here for a birthday breakfast, as his first time at Vista 18. In my reservation I had requested a table overlooking the Inner Harbour if possible, for the special occasion. Upon arrival we were taken to the other side of the restaurant and seated with a less than desirable view of some buildings below. It was slightly busy, but noticed some empty tables as we walked in, so I inquired about a better table as per my online request. Though not a ‚Äòwindow‚Äô seat, our server was able to seat us at an empty elevated booth near the Harbour side of the restaurant, across the aisle from the windows, giving us a view of the ocean! My granola parfait was oddly mostly pineapple chunks, which I left as I dislike them; however, my breakfast potatoes were very good, and my friend enjoyed his benny. Our banana smoothies were also very delicious! Overall, it was a nice breakfast, reasonably priced, and our server was very nice! Would pass on the parfait for next time.

*Note: the empty tables pictured were mostly all occupied when we arrived*


The food here is simply amazing. Wife and I loved the food and the amazing views and service. It is one of the places that you promise yourself to come back for more. All aspects from drinks to dessert all top notch. We waited in hotel lobby after a long walk to refresh with some chilled lemon water before heading up. There is a Lego model of hotel in lobby which you have to see.


Overall upset about the service. Firstly, despite requesting window seats since booking close to 2 weeks in advance, they could only give us a booth across a walking aisle because the host said they were booked upon arrival. Throughout the meal until the end, I walked around the restaurant for the different views and for the bathroom and no one ever sat at those questionable "booked" tables. The view wasn't spectacular either way. The food was not bad as the flavor was on point and portions were as described. However, my $40 steak had over 25% worth of inedible membrane in it and I voiced my disappointment to the server. He was very polite but couldn't offer any good explanation. He mentioned he could get a discount on the bill but never got back to us until I question the bill at the end. Wish they could just offer a small percentage discount or even a small complimentary dessert. That could easily win a five-star. Small offerings to satisfy an upset customer goes a long way. I have been to many similar-level restaurants that could do much better. Quite a bit of improvement in management is needed, including seat allocation.


A convenient downtown Victoria location, with a fantastic 270 degree wrap around view of the inner harbour. The food was excellent and the service staff were professional and very friendly. Made for a memorable dinner with friends.


We went in for me and my friends 18th birthday. Amelia was fun, helpful and very knowledgeable about the menu. She did a great job creating a laid back lovely experience. Food was fantastic, views absolutely worth it. Will be back the next time we are in the province!

name: Saveur Restaurant
editorial_summary: Buzzy French spot offering tasting menus of high-concept, artfully plated cuisine & an intimate bar.
reviews:
I‚Äôve been holding off on posting a review because I really dislike leaving bad reviews. My partner and I went to Saveur during Taste of Victoria. We are both adventurous eaters, and we like a wide variety of tastes.  Our dinner was probably one of my least favourite meals that I‚Äôve ever had - it was genuinely not good (in addition to being very expensive, but we knew that in advance). For Taste of Victoria, there was a set menu so I ordered one appetizer and entree, and my partner ordered the other choices. We did not enjoy any dish. The highlight of our meal was the pickled radish that was on the side of Skate dish, which speaks to the quality of the rest of the food. The service was fine. We were really excited to try here after seeing the amazing reviews but it was a very disappointing experience.


Absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. It‚Äôs the sort of meals that brings you to wonder‚Ä¶ how did they manage to turn mundane ingredients, you find in any fridge, into something so delicious!?

The setting is clean and nicely decorated, the seatings were well sectioned for covid as well. I think they did try their best to serve but they were a little bit understaffed.

Would love to try more dishes next time in Victoria!


Worth the splurge!!!  Yes it's expensive. And yes it was amazing! Good things are worth spending money on and if you've never had a fine dining meal, this should be on your local list to try! Service was attentive and on point. The meals were paired wonderfully with reds and whites appropriately. We started off with a super fun creative chai inspired whiskey sour! If James has it available, order it!!! When they say their tenderloin is like butter, it's true. And yes, you should pair wine with your dessert!
It's a small venue, with small tables but the service keeps on top of your table helping to avoid clutter. Thanks Chef, James, and Ryan for the great time!


Nice french restaurant with an Asian twist. The food is all very pretty and the service is great (prob cuz they add an 18% service charge regardless of the no. of people in your group).

The food is on the pricier end but it's is pretty good. I especially liked the pork belly.


Great food and wonderful service! The flavours were delicate and well balanced, yet super flavourful and unique. The presentation was beautiful. The service was great; We took our time and didn't feel rushed.

name: Browns Socialhouse Victoria BC
editorial_summary: Chill restaurant & bar with elevated takes on pub fare such as burgers & pizza, plus weekend brunch.
reviews:
Super yummy food! I loved the butchers block burger. Crispy and tasty, not too messy. I upgraded to yam fries. We also got the southwest bowl which was good! The desserts were ok but not the best.

The one thing is, it wasn‚Äôt busy or anything but I felt the service was very slow. Took a long time for them to come around to us. But the food is great ! The patio portion is heated and enclosed which is cool.


The customer service in the restaurant was good, our servers were friendly and welcoming. All of the items we ordered were delicious. I was a little busy inside the restaurant, but a majority of the restaurants around this area are and it was definitely worth the wait. Would definitely come again!


Browns is always a nice place to go for lunch. My mom enjoys their veggie burgers and I enjoy their selection of drinks. The service at Browns is always good and staff is always friendly. I decided to try their new brunch options and was a little disappointed however they are new and they might need time to perfect brunch.


There are a few Browns in town, we went to the one downtown which has good location, staff are friendly, allow reservation and more importantly it is not too busy as the one uptown.  Highly recommend.


Went looking for a place to have brunch. Had immediate seating which was a bonus on a Sunday morning in Victoria. Food was good and plentiful, but the potatoes were undercooked. Server was very nice and attentive.

name: Milestones
editorial_summary: Contemporary chain known for their Bellinis, featuring twists on typical bar & grill offerings.
reviews:
Had a great experience at this location. Even tho it was mothers day and we didn't had reservation they were able to give us a table. We got a nice table with harbor view. My favorite was bloody merry with pineapple, shrimp, mozzarella and kabanos. We had a quick lunch while exploring city during our cruise stop at Victoria. Lovely island with lovely parks and scenery.
I took mushroom soup which was too bland for me but spinach artichoke dip and my husbands tacos were excellent. Price was very good as well.  Service was very quick.


Restaurant looked super busy but was able to be sat in less than 5 minutes. Fast service and food was delivered in a reasonable amount of time.

Fish Tacos with Fries, Sweet & Fire Cauliflower, Margarita, Peach Bellini were all delicious.

Food was fresh and drinks were strong!  Plenty of outdoor seating. Family friendly, close to the water. Highly recommend if your in the area.


Enjoyed Happy Hour at Milestones Grill + Bar on the famed Victoria Harbour. Fortunate to get an outdoor table on a beautiful summer day. The food and service were excellent and thoroughly enjoyed the fish tacos and bloody Mary's. The location is also hard to beat with all the energy of harbour life including sailboats, water taxis, seaplanes, cruise ships, power boats, tourists and sidewalk vendors. Well worth checking it out!


We enjoyed Happy Hour at Milestones on the Wharf. The scenery, food and drinks are always outstanding. Another great feature about this establishment are the efficient and pleasant servers; ‚ÄúAvril‚Äù in particular, made us feel welcomed and heighten our dining experience with exceptional service during the busiest times!  You‚Äôll be delighted with superbly prepared meals and drinks at Milestones on the Wharf.  The ever changing views (activity at the harbour, water taxis, sailboats, architecture etc) are so captivating! üç∑üòé ‚õµÔ∏è


Delicious food, and excellent staff. We went to Victoria for our 14th anniversary, and chose Milestones for a romantic dinner. The atmosphere wasn't as romantic as we had hoped, but the other diners seated around us seemed like they were having a wonderful time, and it really helped boost our mood. We liked it so much, we went back the next day for brunch while we waited for the ferry.

name: Argyle Attic
editorial_summary: Popular tavern with a warm, charming feel for elevated pub plates, many whiskies & breakfast fare.
reviews:
This is the place!!!  A great nostalgic atmosphere with fantastic food.  This is especially a top notch place for breakfast.  PS: To my military brethren you will definitely feel at home here.


10/26/19: This place is a nice pocket to chill in. Connected to Smith Bar it's quieter and more intimate. The grilled cheese, Attic burger, and classic poutine are spot on comfort food. Bartender was nice and attentive even working the entire upstairs solo.


The food was delicious, the decor and atmosphere quirky and fun. We only found this place through Groupon and we were glad we did. The curry poutine was unique.


Poutine tots with cheese curds, hollandaise sauce and pulled pork was pretty dang tasty!  Friendly service and quiet... winning combo for breakfast.  Don't forget range free poached eggs too


Delicious breakfast! Had the breakfast sandwich and it was super filling and very affordable. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was great too. Felt very Canadian and quirky! I would definitely go back.

name: BC Legislative Dining Room
editorial_summary: Cozy, old-fashioned cafe the Legislative Assembly building offering a breakfast & lunch menu.
reviews:
Best kept secret in Victoria. Reservation recommended.

The food was excellent, and the service was amazing. Great food and low prices. What more could you ask for.

We went there for lunch one day and breakfast another day. Both meals were perfect and under $20.

Be sure you plan extra time to walk around the building and see all the beautiful stained glass windows.


We really had an amazing experience here. Food is great at amazingly low prices. From entrance to exit all are super organized, really appreciate. Would love to come again. I visited for breakfast and lunch as well on different days, it was fun !! Never expected food to be that good.


To my Mom and I went for a lovely lunch.  We had a lovely server Pilar. We loved our server, the decor, the food was yummy, the setting was very nice , white table cloths, a Christmas tree and Music, white china, heated plates, we enjoyed the fact that we did not feel rushed to leave. The prices were great. We have booked for 2 weeks from today so we can try another menu item.


I had breakfast there a couple of days ago while visiting visiting Victoria. Both the food and service (so professional!) were very good. Prices were extremely reasonable - excellent value!  I wish there were more places like that. It‚Äôs nice to sit at a table with proper tablecloth and special tableware designed specially for them. It was a lovely experience.


As always, today, July 21st, 2022, the experience, the menu selection, the service, not to mention our blueberry pie dessert which we shared,was amazingly good! I‚Äôd highly recommend this breakfast/ lunch restaurant that might be one of Victoria‚Äôs best kept secrets. You are checked in through security, so bring your photo ID. Before you even eat, you wind your way through the basement corridors with painted brick and stone walls, of the Parliament buildings, going out one door and into another before arriving at the beautifully decorated Tudor style restaurant. Servers are prompt and friendly‚Ä¶food is delicious and best of all the prices are very very reasonable. You can check the specials of the day on their website. You will need reservations about 48 hours in advance, especially during the busy tourist times.

name: The Fernwood Inn
editorial_summary: Pub fare & local microbrews served in a relaxed pub with an outdoor patio & art-filled walls.
reviews:
Stumbled across this gem off the beaten path on route to pick up a book at a used bookstore, and I'm really glad we did!! The historic charm of the building and neighbourhood is immediate. With street and retractable canopy outdoor seating, and indoor restaurant and bar places to sit, there are plenty of options to enjoy a beverage and a bite to eat. The food was great as was the service!


Server was wonderful, as we waited for our party to arrive and as we celebrated a birthday. Food and environment was great, and they allowed us to store the cake in their fridge. Server sang happy birthday and provided a lit candle and large knife to cut the cake.


Went with my fiancee and a friend a few weeks ago. Definitely a nice neighborhood pub- currently nice for outdoor seating, and seems to be OK with the dogs outdoors. The speed of service was good, we didn't have to wait longer than about 8-10 minutes until our order was taken, and it looked like a busy night. The food was brought out in a timely manner as well, nothing was missing, food was hot. I has the fish burger with avocado. Unfortunately the avocado didn't do so much for me but it was good nonetheless. I would definitely come back to try more menu items, as they looked really good as well.


Great place for a meal with friends and family.  They are all really kind even with some of our table's specific orders they can accommodate almost anything.

I would recommend the chicken strips. Burgers are also really good. Juicy and full of flavors.

I would recommend getting a reservation if you plan on going in the evenings. They can have longer wait times if you show up at the door.

There is also parking to the side of the building, not too many spots though.


Stop here everytime I'm in the area and love it. Great food with good service and friendly staff

name: Browns Crafthouse Vic West
reviews:
Had a great lunch experience here, for my first visit. The staff were friendly and very attentive, and we were seated, ordered and served lunch faster than expected. Especially as it was busier than expected. The menu is a good size, without endless options. So many dishes looked good enough to invite return visits. We sat out on the covered patio, under space heaters that made me feel like bread in a toaster. Thankfully the server lowered it for us. I had the Cowboy salad, and while plentiful and tasty, my sole complaint was the dressing was too light. The rougher wooden tabletops aren't smooth, and there was long blind hair stuck in ours. Must be very hard to keep clean. Then the closet size washroom was claustrophobic, and washing my hands made the air dryer sensor trigger and blow the water everywhere. Whoever designed this didn't try using it too. Not a big deal tho, I'd go back.


Sooooooo,  it was not busy and inside was nice.  Our server gave us our drinks and we waited at least over 30 min for our meal.  I ordered the spicy crispy chicken and my wife got the turkey dip.  My burger wasn't really hot nor spicy and my wife's meal was dry and rough to eat.  We saw our server soon as we got our meals and did not even offer us water or a refill in our drinks,  she even walked by us at least 5 times with a empty glass and did not even talk to us.  My meal was okay, our server was not good at all, and the prices were too high.


Great bartenders, good selection of beer. Didn‚Äôt eat much but the food I‚Äôve seen be brought out looks good. Came here to watch some hockey games and was pleasantly surprised.


Absolutely my fave pub restaurant in the city of Victoria & in West Vic/Esquimalt.  How they consistently not only hit the mark every time but somehow get better each time I eat the same thing over & over, I‚Äôm really not sure, but the WOW factor is there. Super friendly and professional service, awesome bar/mixologist, food yum, hot, crispy, oozing delightful goodness over & over again! As always, my burger, the BBQ Bacon cheese burger, amazing, the Parm fries, crisp, just enough parm, garlic aioli & the deep fried mac 'n cheese balls with an amazing marina sauce with a full on 'the real deal' cold vodka with olives martini......They get it! Service, taste, presentation & vibe! Bravo Brown's Crafthouse Vic West on Wilson Dt, just over the bridge from dt Vic. You are the best! This was my farewell martini burger dinner as I am moving to The Okanagan next week, but might have to pop in for just one more before I go. And that martini! A simple thing really but rarely does one get it as right as tonight! Thank you! xBüç∏üçî‚úåÔ∏è


My boyfriend's buddy Matt recommended this place for its French Dip (stated it was so good that even his dad, the pickiest food critic he knows, liked it). My boyfriend is sold on the French Dip, saying it is the best tasting beef dip he ever tasted. I'm more interested in trying out other entree choices such as the crispy chicken ramen. Next visit I'll try the salads as they seem interesting but too full for this time around.

name: Tractor Everyday Healthy Foods - Victoria Harbour
reviews:
Best local hidden gem in downtown!! This is a business that I would totally support any time. Best quality of food, fresh; healthy, and hearty! Friendly and knowledgeable staff, always welcoming and give lots of thoughts in preparing the food. Best part - their coffee and pastries. I love the dark chocolate pistachio cookies and the dark chocolate banana bread. come here every week we are in downtown


Can‚Äôt say enough good about Tractor. No waitresses + order at the counter = faster service and affordable prices. Food quality is superb. Nutritious. Open flame grill. Mellow. Authenticity. Fair and good business. Menu does not force me to get a big combo plate. Proteins, salads and soups each bought on own.


Can't fault a thing! The food was just flavour packed, healthy, sustainable and I thought pricing was fair for the value. Their self serve cutlery station and water tap allowed us to social distance safely while dining out. The curry sandwich was a great portion size and truly authentic. Their blueberry parfait had great textures and flavours while being very healthy to eat. And their compostable food containers made me feel ethical about my dining decision. Way to go guys!


Exactly what we needed! Tasty, healthy, fulfilling food at a good price plus the location is perfect! I love that they have so many gluten free and vegetarian options that are not necessarily a salad, but full meals. We ordered a cup of lentil soup, chicken sandwich, Thai bowl with tofu and chocolate / pistachio cookies. The staff was really friendly


If your looking for a great healthy place to eat in Victoria this is the place!  They also have several Vegan options available!

We tried the Chicken Avocado Sandwich which was served on a Ciabatta Roll. We also tried the Nourish Bowl which comes with Power Greens & Brown Rice. You get the option to add two Market Sides to it. We chose the Edamame Crunch & Lemon Kale.

Everything was great. Plenty of indoor seating, also a great outdoor area as well that looks towards the harbor.

Pet Friendly Patio.

name: JOIE French Caf√©
reviews:
Amazing crepes, great service. Such a cute little location. If you go when it‚Äôs not busy it‚Äôs like you‚Äôve got the whole place to yourself and it‚Äôs very nice and quiet. It is on the pricey side but the price is reflected in the amazing quality of the food.
This is one of my favourites and will definitely be visiting many times in the future.


This cafe is a hidden gem! Quiet and spacious, the menu has the perfect balance of savoury and sweet items and you can tell everything is prepared with care. It's not cheap but you get what you pay for- large portions, high quality ingredients, and kind service. Can't wait to come back :)


The most ADORABLE cafe ever! It has regulars, the staff is so sweet and courteous, and the food and drinks are phenomenal. My partner and I were able to play bananagrams while eating crepes and sipping on a delicious mocha. Highly recommend you stop by for a pleasant visit while in Victoria. ‚ù§Ô∏è


Very friendly service and crepe was delicious! Ordered the vegetarian crepe with portobello mushroom, goat cheese and brie. Drink was a long espresso with whipped cream.

Can foresee outdoor seating being comfortable but indoor seating seemed a little temporarily built.


Best restaurant in Victoria, to be honest. (Although I haven‚Äôt visited their dinner restaurant yet.)

I go here almost every week, so I decided I should finally make a review.

The heart of this place is the delicious selection of CR√äPES. I especially love the savoury crepes. They‚Äôre filled with different kinds of melted cheeses, with protein (bacon, fried eggs, ham, smoked salmon, scallops, prawns, etc.) on top, and often a sauce of some kind as well.

My favourites are the Lorraine (bacon and eggs on top with cream cheese inside), the saumon fum√© (cream cheese inside with smoked salmon, lemon, and truffle oil on top), and the mira-mar (Swiss cheese inside and scallops and prawns on top). If you order one of these and don‚Äôt like it, you must be crazy.

The sweet crepes are also amazing!

This place also has the most delicious iced tea I‚Äôve ever tasted, with a very unique and interesting flavour.

The staff are very kind as well.

I could write much more, but yeah, I really love this place. I‚Äôm very lucky to live just across the street.

name: Bar 500
reviews:
Really enjoyed the pasta. Great texture on the noodles. Creative sauces and accompaniments. Tasty dessert. Wish the bread was grilled/warm. You can taste the quality of the ingredients and everything was well-made.


Wonderful meal ... AGAIN!! The selections are always tasty and well presented.  Never disappointed and we were happy to bring two couples with us this time. The "first-timers" were as impressed with their selections as well.  There is an accessible washroom (single room) which I believe is part of the hotel.  Unfortunately, there are a few things that need to be improved to make it friendlier.  The hook mounted on the door is too high for someone in a wheelchair as is the towel dispenser which requires hand motion to activate it.  These things could be easily fixed by adding a lower coat hook and lowering the towel dispenser.  The room is a good size and the there is an assist bar mounted beside the toilet.


Very good portions, delicious, and the bacon was HUGE and cooked to perfection! Seriously, if you like bacon, then try theirs. The local made bread was a little too crunchy, but she explained that the bread company was concerned the bread was overbaked. I think they should have used different bread because serving it today was mouth painful. I am sure it has been better other days, but today was quite rough. Was overall still worth the brunch. And our waitress was pleasant, fun, perfect and on the hosting ball.


LOVE going to the Bar 500 for jazz nights. Its a cozy atmosphere and not too crowded. The menu is small and the food is delicious. Our only request/recommendation is to add a few monthly dining features to change things up a bit. We would come more often then. All in All, a GREAT venue.


Came in for New Years brunch. Advertised as a buffet for 39.00

Got there and found out it was only 2 coursed for 39.00

1st course was supposed to be bakey plate and fruit. I received a single scone.

My partners chicken and waffles was good. I ordered the crab cake Benny. When the food came I was presented with the wrong order. I had wait 15 minutes for the correct item to be brought. The Benny was unseasoned and bland and the hollandaise was broken.

We watch two other tables walk out as one if them wasn't impressed with menu and the other was upset that there order was not coming out

The breakfast was not worth 90.00. Next time we're going to a real breakfast place.

name: The Hallway
reviews:
Lovely experience. Excellent service. Beautiful and unique drinks (although pricey). The food was very good, but I wouldn‚Äôt suggest the kale Caesar salad, as it was too salty (this is coming from a person who enjoys salt). Modern and artsy. We‚Äôll be back :)


Wow, wow, wow.

Incredible, locally sourced and seasonal ingredients crafted into well-balanced, playful and beautiful dishes. Comfortable, intimate atmosphere. Well-trained, knowledgeable, friendly staff. Perhaps the strongest cocktail program in the city with simply transcendent cocktails crafted by a bar staff who can build layer upon layer if flavour.


Totally blown away by the prix fixe menu we had a couple weeks ago. From the cocktails to the dessert everything was simply incredible. Best part of the courses were they were all things I wouldn't have normally ordered for myself and I love each and every one of them.


The seafood pasta is outstanding!! I forgot to take a photo of the chicken sandwich and was so delicious, very crispy outside and soft inside.

The atmosphere was so chill and I think the place is perfect for cozy dinner dining. The owner Segar and his partner both know the industry very well that's why their food was awesome.

It's my first time visiting The hallway. My boyfriend and I had a fantastic experienceüôèüèΩüëç The beautiful ceiling lighting gives me a rolls royce ceiling lights vibe and I LOVE IT.


It was a really nice spot and the food was so good. My friends and I were surprised with the portions and the price but wow, such good food. We had the crab cakes, the pork chop, the strip sirloin and the seafood spaghetti. great service! great music! and our server was so polite! i love this spot and i highly recommend!

name: Part and Parcel
editorial_summary: Hip restaurant crafting small plates, salads, sandwiches & mains with locally sourced ingredients.
reviews:
Following the high rating on Google I made my way to this inconspicuous little gem in the Quadra Village of Victoria. It‚Äôs easy to pass it on the street so keep looking if you miss it first time. The food is some of the best I‚Äôve ever tasted. I got there in time for happy hour and tasted two amazing appetizers for $8 total. One was made from only chickpea flour and deep fried to perfection served with a delicious spicy sauce. The second delicious piece was grilled pork belly. The flavour was fabulous. I ordered the Kalettes veggie main course and again the flavours didn‚Äôt disappoint. Rich and unusual while being amazing. My server strongly recommended the chocolate dessert which I cannot say enough about. It was sweet, salty, creamy and decadent without being overpowering. Overall the meal was 5 star. The vibe of the place is calm and smooth while being friendly and relaxed. I will definitely be back.


I want to come back to Victoria just for this restaurant. Every single dish was fresh, delicious, and a unique combination of flavors. Food came out at the perfect cadence and staff was super attentive. We ordered 2 smaller plates and two of the larger ones plus a dessert which was a good amount for two hungry athletes. Also plenty of gluten free options! This is a BC farm to table style restaurant you don‚Äôt want to miss.


Overall great experience! Started with a condensed milk shaft that I absolutely loved and every dish that followed was great. I ordered the pork and the texture was perfect, very soft and dissolved in your mouth. The broccoli and the cheesecake were also super tasty. I ordered three dishes to share, one cheesecake, and one cookie and it was more than enough for two people so I recommend sharing. Service was great, we sat at the bar and they were very attentive and helpful when explaining portion size etc. I would definitely recommend this place!


Good food, nice staff, and cute atmosphere!

Probably more ideal for groups between 2-5, though I'm sure larger groups can be accommodated for if you come early enough.

No on site parking, but it was easy to find a spot around the block.

However, I do agree with another reviewer about prices. I didn't mind it because I enjoyed the food in the end, but, for what you get, the price does catch you a little off guard. Would still recommend going here at least once, though!


Rice and Pickles bowl, with fried chicken.

Peanuts did not smell like they were freshly toasted, but instead had a musty aroma. Rice was clumpy and not well washed/cooked/fluffed. Pickles were okay, chicken had great texture in the batter but seemed pinkish and the seasoning had not penetrated throughout the meat. Food was served warm but not hot. Mediocre at best.

Service was good, atmosphere close to perfect.
Overall a disappointing experience due to the food.

name: Nohra Thai Kitchen
reviews:
Best food I‚Äôve had.  Owner awesome gave us a free dessert. Saw on Check News. Awesome service. Friendly people and in a charming area of Oak Bay. The food dishes are creative artistic and tasty. So happy to be there for our last meal out with our daughter. This was spectacular. Highly recommend.


Love this coconut soup so much! It‚Äôs creamy and rich, but has a little lemon juice in there to balance the flavour to make it just right!
Really liked the papaya salad! The chicken was good but not really impressive.
Overall really good! Love the atmosphere there! The staff was really nice, great service. Probably the most fancy feeling Thai restaurant I ever been to in Victoria


Appears to be a hidden gem. Deep within darkest Oak Bay, at Estevan Village, is probably Vancouver Island's best Thai restaurant.

The pad thai was great, and the chili-basil stir fry was very tasty. Portions are human sized.


Best Thai in Victoria!
Such a delight. The ambience is beautiful, servers are warm and friendly, and the food is incredible. Try the Massaman Curry...incredible.


Nohra Thai is a treat. The staff go above and beyond to share their amazing food. I‚Äôve dined here before and loved it so much I wanted to share it with my coworkers. We placed a large order for take out to share and taste the wonderful dishes. Everyone on staff are quite the foodies and they raved about the creative takes on traditional dishes. Some of the favourites were the crying tiger salad, fried lemon chicken, pad Thai chai ya, and the Bangkok wok noodles.

name: Bimo Burger Stand
reviews:
Amazing!! My boyfriend recommended this place to me and I had it on my list for a long time to check out while visiting Victoria. He came back in 2012 and he has remembered it since as one of the best burgers he‚Äôs ever had. Definitely lived up to his hype!! Between me and my best friend, we ordered a cheeseburger, mushroom cheeseburger, regular fries and the Montreal smoked meat poutine, which was HUGE! They don‚Äôt cheap out here. The prices are very reasonable and have better quality and taste than the typical $16 burger you grab at a restaurant. I love how this place is literally just a random stand in a parking lot in a slightly commercial/industrial area. The ladies/owners are SO sweet and friendly ‚ù§Ô∏è I will be returning every single time I come to visit here!


Work lunch group wanted to try something new and found this place.  A small hole in the wall good truck.   Really good prices for what you get and I was very impressed with the food.  I also enjoyed getting a cup of gravy.   Made me laugh.   Definitely would eat again.


Place may not look like much, but the burger and fries I had were fantastic. A big menu which I hope to explore over the summer.


Food was okay.  Fries are definitely homemade and peeled before they are cooked. I saw boxes and boxes of potatoes.  That's what made me stop in the first place.  The hamburger, although advertised as homemade, doesn't look like a fresh patty of cooked hamburger.  Both items tasted fine.  Not sure I'd go back unless it was for my mom to taste the fries.  She's always looking for good freshly peeled homemade fries.  The stand had continuous customers.  Some regulars as the owner greeted the people by name.


I have recently visited this gem!
Fast food at incredibly low cost.
So yummy as well.

name: Papa Moe's
reviews:
Just went to Papa Moe's. Great selection of vegetarian options üòÅüëç
House cut fries
Mexi fries
Hash browns
Onion rings
The daily soup was also vegetarian when I asked.
Same with the vegetarian chili
Asian coleslaw
Hummus and naan
Caesar salad or house salad
Great tofu hotdogs too
And 2 pasta options available vegetarian.
Also great selection in meat sandwiches for who is interested.
The chef also informed me that infact the fruit salad is also vegetarian friendly. But sadly it is coming off the menu. ‚òπÔ∏è


Love this spot. The gelded steak and the Moe's burger are so good. Everything tastes fresh, lots of flavour. The berry aioli on the burger is interesting and delicious. Multiple glizzys on the menu too, the Shetl is legit.

Not to mention the staff. Very friendly and accommodating. Simple little eating area with funky old timey music. I wish I lived closer

Don't sleep on Papa Moe's!


This place is AMAZING. We got delivery, and the driver got a little turned around so it took a little longer to arrive, but it was still so delicious. The quality and care really comes through. The bread was perfect at holding my loaded Ruben together. 15/10 will go back!


I just ordered papa moes cheesesteak sandwich on uber eats. It came hot and packed with flavour! It was so delicious! The serving was more than enough, I even shared a few bites with my girlfriend. Really happy with their food and i‚Äôll be a regular for sure!


So Good!! Can't wait to go back!  We ordered the Moe's Burger with curly fries, was very delicious and good quality, especially for only $13!  Service was super friendly and professional, place was clean and tidy, great vibes in there. See you guys soon!

name: Ayo Eat
editorial_summary: Colourful take-out window whipping up spicy Indonesian & Thai dishes like curries & nasi goreng.
reviews:
Always phenomenal, and for a very reasonable price. Without fail, I'll bring friends here if we want a delicious causal meal.
The owner is super nice, and you can tell that they are passionate about the food that they make.
This spot is my go to for takeout when I'm downtown.
Given the small scale, they can get busy quite quickly around the lunch hour, so plan ahead :)


Not bad at all but not all the dishes lived up to my expectations.
The spring roll was delicious (tofu, egg, vermicelli, spinach) and the peanut sauce is perfect. Satay chicken skewers used the same sauce but the chicken itself was a little bland. He was very nice to give us four instead of three! Spicy hard boiled eggs with rice was good, the chile crisp sauce flavourful, coconut rice paired well and pickled veggies was a nice addition. The beef in the rendang was very tough and did not have a lot of flavour, but it could‚Äôve been an off-day because we were the last order.

Keep in mind that the dishes are quite spicy except for the skewers and spring rolls. The chef is very kind and works hard to make all the orders as a one-man team! Get there early as we came back after an hour to pick up our order. Overall came to around $50 for the four items!


Has to be my favourite
Food in Victoria so far! It tasted amazing but it‚Äôs very spicy! We had the green curry and the spicy hard boiled egg dish and wow‚Ä¶ we will be coming back soon!!! Good prices (13-20$/dish)and great location. The owner/cook is very kind too! I would recommend to anyone


Was visiting Victoria and came across this place in Market Square - was NOT dissapointed. Ordered the rolls and peanut skewers and both were absolutely delicious with great flavour. This was my first time trying Indonesian food and definitely won‚Äôt be my last. The cook was a one man show and very pleasant. Expect to wait a bit since it‚Äôs only him but it will be worth it!


I absolutely adore this place!! The food is so packed with flavour, fresh, and authentic.  Bana is so so lovely and sweet I'm absolutely in love with the food he cooks. I wish there were more places like this. Definitely make sure to drop by!! Highly highly recommend!!

name: Hank's *A Restaurant
editorial_summary: Compact eatery with mostly bar area seating, featuring brews & vino amid loud music.
reviews:
This was our first time at Hanks and it was perfection. We went for the tasting menu of the week and were given 6 courses.

I wouldn‚Äôt call myself a picky eater, but I‚Äôm not very adventurous when eating at restaurants, so I usually order a meal I‚Äôm familiar with and know I‚Äôll enjoy. I ended up ordering the tasting menu because I wanted to try items I wouldn‚Äôt regularly order and I‚Äôm happy to say each plate turned out amazing. Special shout-out to the cheeseburger because it was DELICIOUS. Every detail was spot on; the bun, sauce, crispy cheese, and juicy patty.


My partner and I came in to a fun filled kitchen/seating area for 


I had an incredible evening at Hank's. I sat at the bar with my friend and ordered the tasting menu paired with wine. What an experience!

The amount of food was perfect. The selection was very diverse and delicious. There will be pictures of each dish, so check them out! By far, my favorite dish was the elk leg and mushrooms.
