Our chef explained each dish in detail, so I will spare my attempt at doing that and say that if you go, I'd reccomend sitting at the bar. He is very inspired and passionate about his craft. We were lucky the owner was there to bring each glass of wine to life!

I'm very much looking forward to returning for another incredible evening.

Thank you everyone at Hank's for putting love into what you do!


I remember clearly as a small
child that the ‚Äúbest‚Äù things came in small packages. If you are one of the lucky ones to get inside this Victoria Gem called  ‚ÄúHank's *A Restaurant‚Äù , then you‚Äôve just won the lottery of an experience like no other.

We ordered and shared the Walnut and Arugula pesto & the Cheeseburger with potato fries . Each bite was like the first time you experienced Disneyland for the first time . Clark , the Culinary Artist  and part owner,  personally checked to see how our meals were. His attention to detail and passion for his craft is why we will return to experience many of the other incredible menu items .

We hadn‚Äôt even finished our first meal experience, and we were already talking  about what we‚Äôd order next time.

A true Victoria Gem definitely worth experiencing !


Here for a quick trip to Victoria and wow walking by saw this little gem. It‚Äôs an absolute must! We ordered the squash, the meatballs and the steak.  The taste, presentation and flavours were out of this world! Completely impressed, it‚Äôs quaint and perfect for a group of 3 , a single or a romantic couple we shared each dish and it was a perfect portion! Unbelievable üéâüéâüéâ far exceeded any expectations! This is a must eat here spot!
If you live here and haven‚Äôt been - this is a must and for any tourist wow you must stop in!

name: Fresko One World
reviews:
Just a little hole in the wall you do not want to miss! Went here for dinner last week when it was snowing and had a Cubano sandwich and it was delicious! The service was so good and the people were very friendly and welcoming! I will definitely be going back to try other menu items.


We went to this restaurant in search of the best reviews.  We ordered two types of food that tasted relatively good overall but the preparation of the food was very long and it was not satisfactory.  Given the high score, we expected a crowded restaurant, which was not the case. It might not be a bad idea to try it once.


Absolutely delicious. Walked by here so many times over the past few years and finally went in yesterday. We asked for what the owner recommended and it was just spectacular. Husband asked to go back within the month!!


Authentic Mexican food.
Great, very friendly and warm service.  A little taste of Mexico but being in Canada.


Really good Huevos Rancheros yesterday. I can back to try the Huevos Rancheros Mexicans and found it even better, through I liked the Huevos Rancheros as well.

Came back again to try the tamales. I had the chicken which really tasty.

Today I am having the pupusas. Again very tasty.

name: Mom's Kitchen
reviews:
I recently ordered takeout from Mom's Kitchen and had the pleasure of trying their chicken dumplings and chicken teriyaki. The takeout process was seamless and "Mom" was very friendly and nice

As for the food, the chicken dumplings were absolutely delicious. The filling was flavorful and the wrapper was cooked to perfection - not too soft or too chewy with a little bit of crunch. The chicken teriyaki was also cooked to perfection, with a sweet and savory sauce that complemented the tender chicken perfectly, nice to have it on a rainy day

Overall, I had a wonderful experience here. The food was excellent and had the home cooked feel to it. I'd definitely recommend giving this a go, if you're in the area


Amazing and Authentic food. Mom does it all on her own.

My friends and I make this spot a regular go to when we are in town. Great flavours and just the right amount of food.

Teriyaki chicken and teriyaki beef


This was a nice finding inside the shopping alley. A mix of Korean and Japanese cuisine. Not those elaborate menu options but selective items and all for 12$ each was a good option to go for. Served in cardboard boxes with plastic spoins and recyled wooden forks. We ordered fried Dumplings (actually Korean Mandus), Bulgogi, and Chow-mein‚Ä¶ my little daughters loved dumplings and chicken and beef pieces in them. For parents, it was a little bland. More flavors needed. Probably they have adapted dishes to Canadian palate? But I know Canadians love spicy food too. Isn‚Äôt it? I forgot to take pictures of the food we bought, so I don‚Äôt have them in my review. Anyway, it was an okay-okay hot food option on that sunny yet windy-chilly afternoon. So we won‚Äôt whine about anything. All good. Ladies taking orders and cooking were nice and gentle people.


We ordered weekend special. The food is amazing. Quality of food is great. Felt like eating at home. Highly recommend


A cold chill blows through Victoria, it's 11am on a Saturday, and I walk up to Mom's Kitchen. I order the shrimp udon and wait, watching the bustle of market square. I ate my soup under cover, watching the raindrops drip from the dips in the canopy. Steam billowing from my bowl. This was very wonderful udon. Would reccomend to anyone who wants to get food, but also brought their dog and can't go inside. This warmed my soul üíñ

name: The Drake Eatery
editorial_summary: Relaxed bar & eatery serving thoughtfully sourced comfort food dishes & a large menu of craft beer.
reviews:
I LOVE the atmosphere here.. I'm pretty sure this is going to be my go to spot for any dates or any such outings in the future. It's perfectly setup for having a great conversation.

The music is subtle (but good),the staff are lovely, and the food is excellent. Plus the menu is mostly sourced from ingredients local to the island.

One Cool thing about The Drake Eatery:

If chess is your thing, then I'd recommend you hit this spot with your favorite set and play buddy. It's not like tournaments happen here or anything like that. I just saw a pair playing when I was there and it just seemed like they were having a really good time.


My first impression was the bar is well put together and atmosphere was awesome for downtown Victoria. I enjoy the somewhat open kitchen concept. You have to come up to the bar to order your food. The food is a hit/miss, the potatoes was a 3/10 very dilly. The Beef Tongue Reuben was a 7.7/10. First time trying beef tongue so it was good. The craft beer I ordered was okay. After you order your food, they don‚Äôt really check up on you and ask if you need anything else.


We really enjoyed our lunch at the Drake Eatery. I had the delicious quarter chicken and it was ample for me, and my hubby had the corned beef sandwich which he said was really good.  I really loved the cold slaw salad and dip that came with my chicken and my hubby really enjoyed his home made potato chips, they even came warm!!! The cider was good and so was the wine @ $10 a glass very reasonable, considering it‚Äôs DT Victoria.  The ambience was nice, good tunes and the we loved the Persian rugs, nice touch and made it homey.  Staff were very friendly and accommodating. We will be back! Thanks for great service, food and drink!!


We've visited The Drake a few times, and it's become a must stop when we head to Victoria. They offer a great selection of local and imported craft beers, as well as really nice snack plates. The service is excellent and the folks that work there are super friendly. A great place to pop in for a drink and a bite!


This is our "Go To" place for drinks, lunch and a friendly vibe.  The staff is very helpful and welcoming.  We have never been disappointed with any of their offerings whether it be drink or food.  There is a portable ramp at the front door which needs to be put in place for wheelchair access but the staff is very helpful.  There is a single room, accessible washroom as well.

name: Tacofino
editorial_summary: Popular compact taqueria serving up creative tacos & burritos in simple counter-serve environs.
reviews:
AMAZING. I‚Äôve had Tacofino in Vancouver, but this was even better! The tacos are great (especially the yam taco), and the crispy chicken burrito was the best burrito I‚Äôve ever had.

Lots of space inside and out for seating, but busy with dine in and take out orders.

The staff was really lovely and accommodating. They gave me the wrong taco and were quick to rectify in an above and beyond manner. 10 ‚≠êÔ∏è


Went to Tacofino - WOW!! This place has the best tacos I've ever had in my life! I got the Fish, Tuna and Chicken tacos and I was not disappointed. Taste, portion and presentation beats anything else in Victoria!! They have Dino Sour stone fruit on tap and I gotta say it really complimented that to-die-for meal.

I only gave 2 stars as the kitchen REALLY could use a clean. I understand it's super busy all the time but that kitchen needs an entire scrub down, then a plan to keep it clean.

The staff were awesome! The service was great, the hostess and other workers were very nice. Great atmosphere and all around amazing place. I will be returning - Hopefully the kitchen gets some attention after this.

-Will update when I visit again next month, and amend the star rating / comment :)


Holy smokes these were delicious tacos!
I got the tuna taco and the yam taco.
The server recommended getting two and said it's the perfect amount, she was right! They were bigger than I expected as well!
The flavors of each taco were so different and amazing in their own way.
The restaurant is small and filled up very quickly for lunchtime and it was on a Tuesday, I can imagine a wait here on the weekends.
Food was quick and so fresh!
I will 100% be back and recommend this place to anyone visiting the area!


Thank you to the manager Kelsey Van Nes and the whole team at Tacofino for perfect delivery of our order and accommodating a food allergy!

These tacos really packed great flavour and the nachos had a great cook! Vegetarians will LOVE the yam tacos. I could eat those all day! Portion sizes were generous and the tacos came loaded just how I love them.

We will return again!


The praise for Tacofino menu needs no specific affirmations from my end. They are hands down amazing.
The restaurant is clean and well decorated.

WAITING TIME can be crazy even for takeouts ( expect 1 hour wait time over weekends).

TIP:

They take orders over the phone so you should order over the phone before you go in person to pick your order to avoid waiting longer.

But avoid weekend evenings to eat here as sometimes the staff doesn't pick the call as they are already overbooked for in house and take out orders.l understand its not a good customer service practice but nevertheless it's what l experienced myself and decided to share with you folksüòä

Must try from Tacofino:

-Fish Taco :Too good.Cladsic dish and a must try.Well stuffed. Filling and super yummy.

- Fish Burrito : Well made,tastyüéâ,perfect amount of the filling to make you happy.

- Chicken Burrito üåØ: Nice one to try if you want to have something other than fish üêü.

name: Flying Otter Grill
editorial_summary: Laid-back pub offering a surf 'n' turf menu & other comfort grub, with cocktails & harbour views.
reviews:
Not sure why I don't come to this restaurant more often; I enjoyed the ambiance, location, food, and menu items.  It's a reasonable place to take someone for a date- however not too intimate, pretty casual for a setting.

Date dinner with the Hubby almost a month ago (haven't reviewed), didn't know it was two for one appetizer Saturdays. OF COURSE we ordered the two-for-one! Why not? It's there, if it wasn't something we enjoyed, we didn't have to order it or come back, so there was nothing to lose.

Had no regrets on the selection; ordered the wings with Apple BBQ flavour, and the calamari. Be warned, the calamari does have some spicy kick to it- and I like spicy. Still delicious. Wings were crispy, even with the sauce- just a personal preference.

For the entrees my husband ordered the Halibut burger - but somehow ended up with the two-piece halibut fish and chips- he went with it, and didn't have any regrets. The batter wasn't overly thick, and the fish was thankfully not dry. My own order was spicy prawn tacos, and they were lovely. nice, light, refreshing. It comes with a side, but thankfully I chose this, because the appetizers were filling enough. The fries were nothing remarkable, but I did enjoy them.

We arrived around 5:30pm, to which dinner was just getting started- the tables were about 90% full, and our food still arrived at a "reasonable time" (we were in and out in an hour, without rushing our order and dinner).  The atmosphere was overall good; didn't feel rushed, didn't feel like we were inconveniencing anyone when we asked for refills of our drinks. I will, of course, come back again. Even for a somewhat price-conscious person, I'm very satisfied with my visit.

Highlights for me:
Accessible washroom
Two-for-one Appetizer Saturdays (excluding a few items)
Easy parking
Good service and food

Take note:
No dog patio


Absolutely blown away! The food was fantastic.  The best shrimp tacos I've ever had.
Everyone at our table raved about their food, even the kids! I tried some of the cod and chips and the fish was perfect.
The atmosphere is wonderful. You can't get any closer to the water. The staff was friendly and kind. I liked ordering beforehand and it reminded me of how they do things in Australia. If I had a critique, I guess I would have liked to be checked on a bit more to see if we wanted more sauce or drinks, but I was so satisfied with my meal that I didn't realize this until after the fact.
Highly recommend this restaurant.  Take the water taxi right up to the front door for a really unique Victoria experience.
We will definitely be back over and over again!


Great food, nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Not much seating space, and also ordering & paying upfront is not really convenient (especially if you want to add to your order later, you need to line up again). But again, the food was really good so they're getting 5 stars. üòä


Found this place while wandering aimlessly around Victoria. We loved the name and decided to give it a try. It was a little busy, but the hostess gave us the option to sit at the bar. I'm so glad we did. The Otter has an excellent drink selection, including local brews. We split an order of poutine (IYKYK) that was absolutely fantastic! We loved watching the activity on the docks as we ate, including one seagull that liked to look in the windows to see what people were eating.

The staff were amazing and friendly from the jump. They also worked incredibly well together, anticipating what others needed, which increased the level of customer care and service. They elevated the experience tenfold.


We sat in the patio and had a pilsener and an apple cider while we waited for our Caesar salad and halibut fish and chips. The food was great. some of the best fish and chips I'd had. I'd recommend a bit more dressing on the salad but the fried capers that it came with were a nice touch. Our server was attentive but not over bearing. Would go again.

name: II Terrazzo
editorial_summary: Intimate, candlelit Italian nook with brick fireplaces, patio seating & a notable wine list.
reviews:
The atmosphere and the aesthetic of this restaurant makes a fantastic spot for a romantic dining experience.

Greeting staff welcomed us and we were seated right away. Try to make reservations as this spot gets pretty busy and they book up quickly (which is a good thing).

I have no complaints and only good reviews on the service from start to finish. Our server was good pleasant and made great recommendations. Not once was my glass of water close to being empty! Further, our drinks and food were delivered very quickly and most of the tables were full.

There‚Äôs a good variety on their food menu and even more so for their drink menu with a wine selection for days. Wine lovers must try!

Our meal was fantastic! We were given bread to start. Pricier but the taste, presentation and portion size is there.

I highly recommend this location and this will definitely not be my last! Thank you!


One of the best restaurants in British Columbia! That‚Äôs all I can say;)

The whole restaurant is a vibe. I loved loved the interior design of this place!  So cozy and warm.
The staff is AMAZING. Very knowledgeable and excited about the food
You will love it!!!


Be sure to book a table at least a week in advance if you need a certain time! Very attentive waiters, they offered to add water at least 5 timesüòèthe most comfortable atmosphere, even though the flyers are sitting close, everyone speaks quietly and everything is very personal.  Only the kitchen upset us, maybe we ordered the wrong
dishes, since there are no photos of dishes on the menu. This place deserves another visit at least for pizza tasting‚ò∫Ô∏è


Oops‚Ä¶up a dress size! The food here is so amazing, full of flavours. The portions are huge too, we had to take some away in a box for tomorrow‚Äôs dinner. The decor is lovely, like being in an Italian courtyard. There‚Äôs a good wine list plus service is excellent.
We couldn‚Äôt manage desert, tempting as they were.


Visited this place while we were in town as recommended by a friend. Upon reading a number of reviews, we ordered a seafood pasta and a calamari since we were feeling still half-full from lunch. They gladly accommodated our request for substituting mussels for more of other kinds of seafood. We were amazed at how everything tasted so fresh, from the focaccia and olives to the pasta! Especially the pasta was simply the best seafood pasta I have ever had (remember we were not too hungry to begin with..)! We loved it was tomato-based rather than oil-based, and the prawns and scallops were cooked to perfection. An added bonus was that our server, Marissa, was incredibly friendly and made us feel comfortable the entire time.

name: Dunlop House Restaurant
reviews:
Excellent experience
Great to see the new up & coming restaurateurs and hotel managers


Student run restaurant best deals in town for three course dinner.  Delicious and creative. Student staff we professional and attentive.


Old fashioned elegance with outstanding food while new students learn the culinary industry from beginning to end.


A great place to learn the aspects of hospitality. Thank you Carl for welcoming me there


The students put on a great themed pub night on Thursday nights!

name: Brasserie L'Ecole
editorial_summary: Celebrated brasserie for French fare & wine served in bustling, unpretentious quarters.
reviews:
Got lucky that there happened to be a table and didn‚Äôt have to wait. French onion soup was great for the cold rainy weather out. The duck with Roquefort sauce was a nice combination of flavours, and burger with truffle fries was tasty as well. Restaurant interior was cosy, a lovely place to dine for special occasions.


This very special French Restaurant operates on a first arrive,first basis so we arrived 30 minutes early and there were several enthusiastic customers already lined up‚Ä¶the discussion among those waiting was enthusiastic about what each individual was interested in ordering..the staff made regular visits along those waiting to answer any questions and to determine how many in each group..when seated, the service was excellent and all questions were answered..the cuisine was exceptional and we appreciated each portion of our order..the dessert was very delicious‚Ä¶we will be back soon for another adventure in this French Atmosphere..


Adorable spot, pretty busy so try and get your name on the list for one of the settings. Feels very cozy inside but still intimate. Salads were amazing and food very well prepared. Would highly recommend trying it out


I was very impressed with this place across the board.   The food is classical French done to perfection - generous portions, I suggest sharing a salad, appetizer then having your own main.  Wine was superb and the service exceeded any possible expectations- she even called us a cab and helped get cash for our babysitter.


A hidden gem with a rotating menu. Some of the best steak I've had in town, hands down. Also, some may view it as an after-thought, but even their French fries were terrific!

name: Stir It Up
reviews:
The service and atmosphere were great the woman working was also friendly... we only grabbed the jamacain beef patties to try. The pastry was really good, and the temperature of the patties was also good. However, we found the filling a little underwhelming, no real flavor or spice... the prices are fair, and the location is easy to access.. I'm definitely curious about the rest of the dishes...


Had great food; jerk chicken, curry chicken in roti and was very delicious. Don‚Äôt be in a hurry to get your order as it‚Äôs not very fast when ordering


Had the jerk chicken, oxtails and pattie‚Äôs. Highly recommend. Great service and atmosphere.


Lovely staff and outstanding food. Curry chicken roti was super flavourful, tender chicken, and the perfect amount of heat (for me).

Will be back often!


Stir it Up! So good. Very humble and authentic joint dishing up carribbean soul food. It‚Äôs all made fresh in house. There was one guy working at the time, and very pleasant. Had the jerk chicken roti. Chicken had crispy skin and the mix of sauces was perfect. Hot, sweet and lots of tang! Will be back.

name: Chorizo & Co. Restaurant & Bar
editorial_summary: Relaxed, dimly-lit industrial eatery offering Spanish tapas dishes plus wine, beer & sangria.
reviews:
We enjoyed our dinner at chorizo and co. Calamari as appetizer were tasty with fresh ingredients. We had to order some extra bread.
We then ordered the large paella and the plate was huge. It was topped with large amount of fresh fish and calamari steak, very nicely seared. The paella dish was a bit wet (too much sauce) but we enjoyed it. We had no stomach left for dessert... Maybe next time!


We hit upon Chorizo & Co. when the place where we intended to eat was closed.  What a happy circumstance!  The food was delicious.  Shared the Mediterranean platter with a friend - best hummus I‚Äôve ever tasted, and the grilled pita was delicious.  Our companions were also very happy with their corn dog and specialty burger.  Would definitely eat here again.


One of the top restaurants in Victoria! Unique menu with amazingly perfect flavor profiles. Great for a special date night or just a a casual dinner out. The staff are very friendly and very knowledgeable with food and wine pairings. 100% recommend - it is definitely my go to spot to impress friends and family!


OVERALL:  Nice place with a great atmosphere. Not a great price / value ratio - Good Menu but  needs to improve the dishes. Realistically this place is somewhere between very good 3 stars and bad 4 stars.
DETAILED REVIEW:  Drinks were good and the service solid (Local Draft beers and an OK wine selection). The food was a disappointment unfortunately - we had high hopes. We had the croquettes (these are OK, these tasted too much  bbq sauce), cabbage rolls (good dish, but not cooked properly, the cabbage was still a little uncooked, and not soft), calamari starter (interesting BBQ flavour, ok but not convincing ) -  the paella (large hopes and biggest disappointment. Dish was super salty, the mix of seafood didn‚Äôt seem right - it came with broiled fish and grilled calamari steak on top - in a nutshell just weird and not well balanced) + we finished with a grilled foie gras (not great, somehow not a fresh and good flavour + too pricey).


My husband and I came to Victoria and heard this place was good. It did not disappoint. Creative dishes and unexpected yet delightful flavors! The wild rice cake was amazing. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. I had the burger. Will be returning for sure!

name: Cafe Brio
editorial_summary: Unpretentious choice for salumi, wine & Italian-leaning meals, made from local ingredients.
reviews:
No surprise that the food and service was amazing. A medium sized menu with a nice variety of choices. Most have the option to get half portions so you try a few different dishes easily enough. I assumed the full portion would be smaller due to being a fancy joint but it was very filling.

I had the pork cutlet which was mouth watering. I tried the beat salad and carbonara pasta as well - both amazing.

The only thing to complain about, and you can probably tell from the photos, is the lighting! If it's so dark your wait staff carry flashlights to read the menu... It's probably too dark.

Would be happy to return!


Reservations recommended. Went with the brio family style shared dinner @ $67 per person, chef‚Äôs choice, 6 dishes overall. Since it‚Äôs random, I‚Äôll speak to what we were served: clam chowder cup (meh, soup on the lighter side, New England style). Romaine lettuce salad (ok, garnished with crumbs, garlic, sharp cheese) charcuterie board with pate (good), bresaola (good) rabbit terrine (delicious) sausage (good). Mains: gnocchi (good) duck with beets (yum) fish with pancetta(?) and fingerling potatoes (yum). Party of 4 + bottle of wine = $380 not including tips. Overall, I‚Äôd stick with ordering charcuterie + individual mains, though the variety was nice. Service‚Ä¶our waitress was good though didn‚Äôt bring the requested balsamic vinegar and olive oil.


This place was great. The atmosphere perfect. The bartender was friendly and made my friend a custom drink. The boards are delicious‚Ä¶the duck with the Brie and quince jelly was a 10/10 combo. My only regret was not getting the bartender‚Äôs name to put in the review because he was both authentic and kind.


Had the most wonderful anniversary dinner here tonight. The staff were delightful, the environment was beautiful and the food was exquisite. Thank you all for such a wonderful dinner.


Absolutely incredible meal - from service, to atmosphere, to quality of the fare. We had the lamb, fish of the day, steak, and cured meats (which are made in house), and cheeses. Everything was fresh, well balanced, and very flavourful. One of our new favourite staples in Victoria

name: Yalla
editorial_summary: Middle Eastern staples like falafel, shawarma & hummus at a snug, contemporary counter serve.
reviews:
Over the past few of years I‚Äôve walked pass by this place couple of times, finally today my friend and I finally paid a visit. We came in at the tail end of lunch time and there are still people ahead of us waiting to pick up their orders. From this phenomenon I can tell that over the years the locals have found this place a gem.
My chicken sharwama wrap tasted delicious. I tasted light curry and yogurt amongst the greens and chicken fillings. The wrap towards the end leaked out oil, while that might just be me not eating it fast enough/ in the right way.
Cashier knows the menu and is friendly. Your order gets brought to you when dinning in. Large glass/ plastic jug of water on the side free to fill.
All the staff are in the kitchen prepping food orders. I know I would feel more comfortable if the tables could be wiped down after each use or at set schedule. Marvelous that diners have been decent tiding up after themselves. Nevertheless, the virus is still around and death number still gets published.


Good portions, priced well, the chicken was moist and juicy and not chewy like other places. The design is also perfect. Best Shawarma In BC  so far I tried a couple more even in Vancouver. The young lady Is very friendly and super nice. One thing to improve slightly heats the pita before you bag it.  Thanks


Decided to follow up on a recommendation to try this place out. Valid recommendation. I tried the bowl with a customized mix of chicken, lamb, and eggplant. All were good but the eggplant was special. Lots on the plate to feed two of us.


I recently had the pleasure of dining at this Middle Eastern/Persian restaurant and was thoroughly impressed by both the food and the hospitality. The maquli bowl, which I ordered, was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The portion size was generous and left me feeling satisfied but not overly full.

What really stood out to me, though, was the warmth and welcoming nature of the staff. From the moment I entered the restaurant, I was greeted with a smile and made to feel like a valued guest. Throughout my meal, the staff checked in on me to ensure that I was enjoying my food and had everything I needed.

Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for delicious Middle Eastern/Persian cuisine and a warm and welcoming dining experience. I will certainly be returning soon!


The place is nice and the atmosphere is good. Service is good. My problem was the food. The meat was dry and not juicy. In the lafa, not enough salad, no tahini. The portions were kind of small for the price. Limonana is super sweet! Even my kids couldn't drink it. We had big expectations for the flavors and were disappointed.

name: My Thai Cafe
editorial_summary: Informal restaurant offering classic Thai stir-fries & curries with customized spice levels.
reviews:
I loved the Tom Kha Coconut Thai soup with prawns. The best ever! All ingredients fresh and the soup wad seasoned perfectly. The host was super friendly.


Great local eatery. Lunch menu prices are really reasonable, generous portions and include soup and a spring roll. My partner did a fried egg add-on for an additional cost and it was great on the rice dish. Thai iced tea was decent, a little bit on the sweet side but not bad. Their pad Thai sauce is a little on the sour side for me and their mild seems a bit spicy (I would personally get no spice in my future visits). Hence the 4 stars.


It's a small but great place to eat Thai food. Jared is also very helpful and friendly. Careful when ordering Thai original spiciness, I thought western food can never be spicy but they are truly as spicy as chili padi.


What a beautiful place set in a little cute area of town in Victoria. After purposefully getting lost in locating a little place for dinner, I was pleasantly greeted by a very professional and polite and welcoming young man. I was happy to hear him welcome me and when I asked for take out he politely handed me I menu and took my order. After I sat he professionally offered me some water and even poured it for me which shows the etiquette of serving tables as being very impressive. I was delighted and felt at home immediately as I waited for my food. Upon returning home and opening my food I was eager to taste the flavors for I had asked for as spicy as possible. As I enjoyed my food I realize that this was a wonderful meal that had rich flavors, spiced and the right amount of temperature in spice as well as temperature of food. I would recommend this place and would only caution that though it is a small establishment it is huge in flavor and good quality food. My compliments to the chef.


This small Thai restaurant on Cook Street tells a big story in their cooking. Lunch is a treat, with delicious flavorful soup and a spring role with every choice. And there are lots of excellent choices! I had the Gaeng Massaman Gai, which was filling and fresh and very delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant,  for lunch or dinner.

name: Taco Justice
editorial_summary: Easygoing mobile outpost serving Mexican fare such as tacos & burritos with meat & veggie options.
reviews:
Nice food truck with really great service from friendly staff! Great options for food, with some interesting flavours! The portion sizes are also excellent for those who like to eat a lot (like me). The burrito was excellent.

Not much in terms of seating, this is more of a takeout place for lunch.


Had a Belly 2 Belly as a burrito bowl. They happily customized it to my liking with less rice and extra chilli. All I can say is WOW!! What a satisfying bowl. The Thai flavours were pretty authentic and the whole combo works well.

I only wish they put out a few seats like the Greek food truck next door. I would have loved to sit out in the sun and eat it right there.


A group of us travelled from Vancouver to Victoria for an Outreach Clinic(work) and ordered Taco Justice for lunch. Delivery was on time and our bowls were super tasty. I ordered the Belly Bowl (pork) which was SO good. It was pretty oniony but nonetheless I would order from Taco Justice again if I was in Victoria.


I‚Äôd driven by this food truck quite a few times- I finally decided to stop and I‚Äôm glad I did! I had the delicious fish burrito bowl; it was filling and flavourful. Staff was super friendly! I‚Äôll be going back to try their other menu items for sure!


Little taco food truck, for take out and delivery! Really really love the flavour combinations! The burritos are large and have lots of meat, and fresh ingredients. The "nachos" are my favourite waffle cut fries, loaded with fresh toppings. Definitely worth your money. The folks running the truck are really awesome as well. Thanks!

name: Bin 4 Burger Lounge
editorial_summary: Busy, modern grill offering inventive, locally sourced burgers, handcut fries & draft brews.
reviews:
There is no doubt, this was the best decision of my life.  The meal wasn‚Äôt just take-out, it was an experience that just kept happening.  When i felt that urge to tap out, there was more experience to be had.  I eat a lot of burgers, mostly my own concoctions.  THIS was better than my cooking and i gladly admit to that.  Grade-A, top-shelf food.  Fantastic work Bin 4!

Don‚Äôt forget to tip your server or the person taking the payment - most places are tip sharing so it goes to everyone.  TIP at LEAST 20%.


Best gourmet burgers in Victoria! A group of us (around 20 people) went, and had a fantastic time with great burgers. Bin 4 serves quality and quantity. The burger set meals (burger + sides) are worth the money. The meat is well seasoned and well cooked. The meat was moist (not dry at all), and had the juicy succulent flavor.
Recommended:
Bin 19: The big dipper (meal filling enough for a full meal).
As sides, I had fries and Bin 4 house salad. I would prefer fries and onion rings. The house salad is a regular salad, and wasn't the right fit for me.
Overall, a place that serves great gourmet burgers and has a great vibe! Last but not the least, service was awesome, kudos to the ladies for being prompt.


Great place to visit if you love burger and fries.
They has options for both vegetarian and non vegetarian burgers.
Onion rings is must try!
Staff is friendly and service is good.
Recommend to book reservation on weekend evenings.
Good to visit in happy hours as any burgers are usually 11$ if we order alcoholic drink with it.
Large seating options with big heated patio available.
Ample parking available.


One of the best tasting burgers in town. If not THE best. I was surprised with the garden salad. It had a hint of sweetness. Very enjoyable place. Nice seating outside as well. Friendly waitresses. I'd go back ! Baby friendly ! Was a great day in the sun. Lovely just lovely


Late night special of 50% menu-priced burgers (with the purchase of a drink) after 9pm was the main draw!

Plating was a big thumbs up from me, considering it‚Äôs just a burger and fries! That being said, for a restaurant with a primary focus on burgers, the food was mediocre. Definitely better burger stops all over town. A few of the ingredients were over-cooked, including rock-hard bacon and dry onion rings. While the portion size is generous, the quality doesn‚Äôt seem up to par. The beer menu was decent, but the bar classics fell short.

Would come back here just for the late night special and the hangs, but it‚Äôs not to be construed for a premium burger restaurant. Worth mentioning that they were absolutely packed, so although that meant minimal service attention, it‚Äôs definitely a popular spot!

name: Bodega
editorial_summary: Intimate fixture featuring Spanish tapas, wine & cocktails in a warm atmosphere, plus patio seating.
reviews:
We love this restaurant the best for this short trip! All foods were high quality and tasty! Won‚Äôt get too much burden since all dishes were served small plate! We love it! We tried various and they all perfectly matched with baguette! Wonderful time!


Love the food here! Great service, really nice cocktails and overall awesome vibe. I think you'll be happy with anything on the menu, it's all crafted very carefully. Small side patio which is nice if you can get a seat, watch the hours as they close early earlier in the week.


Good food, service & atmosphere. We really enjoyed the flavours of all the small tapas dishes we tried. It is in a great district of downtown Victoria. I would recommend you try this place.


Excellent food. The soup was super good, pepper and coconut. I took the trio platter to try a little of everything. I did expect more for the price ($15) however, it was very tasty. I would recommend to just go with a full dish instead of the trio, you get more for your money. Finishing touch, a nice espresso. I will be back.


A wonderful spot to grab some delicious, HIGH quality bites and great wine. Cammy was a sweetheart and gave us some excellent menu recommendations. Thank you for a lovely evening Bodega!

name: Superbaba (Victoria)
reviews:
Went in for lunch, was not disappointed. All of us ordered off their bowl menus and portion size was reasonable.
Nice and Clean Tables, good service, good good.
Would recommend a visit for sure, and if planning an outing their menu is also very good for take out.


Simple but very impressive place with nice and minimalistic design.
Food was great üëå but I felt the price is bit high for the small portion of food served.
Overall good and authentic food experience with neat presentation on the plate.
Friendly staff.
Paid street parking available on the adjacent street.


I stopped at Superbaba for lunch, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. They make fresh pita breads daily, and that‚Äôs key. You can see them baking the bread in a hot oven. The pita bread is soft and slightly chewy. I got the falafel wrap, and it was delicious. The chickpea fritters were crispy. I enjoyed the fresh and crunchy vegetables in the wrap. The flavours are exquisite. I love their aesthetics with modern flair.

Additionally, I also decided to try the turmeric cookie. Along with the turmeric, I appreciated the rose water. The rose water adds a distinct and unique floral which, in my opinion, is very unique. The cookie had a good texture, with a slightly crisp outer shell and a soft and chewy middle. Highly recommend. Next time, I shall order ahead.


Ordered the spicy falafel bowl for lunch. It took a bit of time but was worth the wait. Fantastic flavour and a good slow burn when finished. Add this to the go-to list for lunch! Next time I'll order ahead.


The fries I got were burnt. Also the quantity of the chicken in the platter was so little as if someone deliberately put less. The food tasted okay but that meal was not worth the money at all in terms of quantity. Not buying again anytime soon. Vancouver location has much better service.

name: Virtuous Pie
reviews:
I've come here often and have ordered via skip to my home. I've always had amazing food experiences here. I have tried all the pizzas on the menu and quite a few of the monthly features. They have all been amazing. The staff have all been really amazing as well. Great service and great manager. Also, they have a patio behind the restaurant where we were to have our dog with us. Oh ya the ice cream is seriously awesome too.


For me and my family the best vegan place to visit in town and have a hearty meal. Don‚Äôt worry about ordering any item on the menu if you‚Äôre a vegan as everything is plant based even though the names might suggest otherwise.

The pizza‚Äôs are really light and have lots of variety. Flavours are a lot different than pizza‚Äôs from chain restaurants. Of course this is attributed to the fact that it‚Äôs not regular cheese in there and all plant based toppings. Try to order a couple of them at least if you are two or more people.

For Dessert we had one of their Sundae‚Äôs and it tasted good with the in house made waffle cone.

A few starter options and salad to go on the sides as well. All in all we always love to go back and try out different items.


We had a few pizzas, a couple salads and the garlic knots. Everything was really tasty! Great flavour, the crusts were really lovely and the service was good. Would definitely eat here again.


You would be surprised how insane vegan pizza can go! When I first heard about Virtuous Pie, I didn‚Äôt even know it was vegan.

I really appreciate the sheer amount of pizza‚Äôs this place has. For having many dietary restrictions, the food has a ton a flavour and large variety to choose from. Prices are a little higher than average, but the quality does support the cost. Also really enjoyed their lemonade type drinks. The one with pomegranate stuck out to me.

One thing I would highly recommend is to double the amount of pizza‚Äôs you usually order. They are much smaller than normal.

I love the modern and clean look of the location, plenty of space, and wonderful service!

Taste: Excellent
Presentation: Good
Service: Excellent
Uniqueness: Excellent
Atmosphere: Excellent


This is the best vegan pizza I‚Äôve ever had! üçï They know what they‚Äôre doing and you can taste it! It was my first time here. I loved that they have huge booths in the main area and seats back in their garden patio. I decided to go for the classic Margherita pizza. The pizza was delicious and tasty. To be honest, you don‚Äôt really miss the dairy/cheese on the pizza. The pizza‚Äôs crust was amazing and not soggy at all. The service was good. Additionally,  I got the vanilla bean ice cream pint to go and it was phenomenal. All in all, I highly recommend Virtuous Pie and I shall return to try other pizzas and items off their menu. üíØ

name: Bao
editorial_summary: Informal, easygoing place specializing in Asian street food such as baos plus cocktails & beers.
reviews:
I have to say, I really don't get the hype! It was a super long wait for two people both days we went, and we ended up going for an early dinner right at 5pm in order to get seated. I got the bibimbap and my husband got the ramen, and together, we sampled the bao.

The food was tasty enough, but: nothing was authentic, the bao was over sauced / overly salty / + soggy, and the bibimbap was not nearly as flavorful as it should be. Service was okay but not great, as it seemed they were understaffed.


Our final meal in Victoria before heading back home. They don‚Äôt take reservations so we arrived just before they opened to ensure we get seated. You need to give and pay your order before getting seated so know what you want üòÄ so many dishes to try!

üî∏ Korean Fried Chicken bibimbap
üî∏ Mei Fun Stir Fry
üî∏ Taiwanese Classic bao
üî∏ Chinese BBQ bao
üî∏ Pork Meatball Banh Mi bao
üî∏ Buttermilk Fried Chicken bao

We devoured the delicious food just in time to walk around Chinatown before heading to the ferry to go back to reality.


Presentation looked good with a trendy atmosphere but we ordered take out as it‚Äôs easier with kids as we stayed a block away. We found the soup base with the tan tan men and port belly ramen a bit too salty and not the flavour we were looking for. The buns were good but a bit small and on the pricy side at $4/each. We liked the chicken in the bitmap but the pork was all soggy from curry sauce. Not sure if this the same Bao in Vancover which we‚Äôve never been to but just had higher expectations as were a bit disappointed.


LOOK NO FURTHER! This is the best place to eat in China Town, hands down! For starters, hubs and I are in our 40's, parents of teenagers, restaurant owners, and brought our large vacationing family to Bao from other blogger recommendations. We couldn't be happier that we tried it out!! Everything we tried was amazing, the 13 year olds loved theirs as well! Small, quaint, clean, fast, friendly, and absolutely delicious! We can't wait to visit Bao next time we go to Victoria!


My sister and niece couldn‚Äôt stop raving about this place so when a buddy from out of town asked if I wanted to meet for lunch I suggested we try it out. We were very impressed! Decided to try 4 different Bao and split them, along with an order of Korean Fried Chicken Bibimbap. We also ordered a couple of Vietnamese Iced Coffees. Everything was delicious! The quality of the ingredients is amazingly fresh and the flavor profiles of each of the different Bao were all delicious and different. We had the Taiwanese. Classic, Chinese BBQ, Pork Meatball Bahn Mi, and the Tonkatsu Chicken Bao. Every one of them was incredibly tasty and the Bao buns were soft and fluffy and so fresh. We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and would highly recommend trying them out.

name: Oak Bay Bon Sushi
editorial_summary: Easygoing eatery offering familiar Japanese food, including rolls, sashimi & noodle dishes.
reviews:
One of the best restaurants around when it comes to the quality of ingredients.

When I go out for sushi, I‚Äôm usually hesitant about all-inclusive Japanese restaurants that do it all and prefer to go specifically to a sushi-specific joint. But this place was quite the pleasant surprise - on top of many other offerings, they serve some amazing sushi.

The quality of the fish was beaming fresh. The fish-to-rice ratio on all the rolls was just perfect. My friends who got the vegetarian rolls were also quite satisfied.

Great food all around, and really friendly service to top it off. Will definitely be back here - likely one of the best sushi stops around!


10/10 best sushi place. Always the kindest customer service, great prices & reliable food! Really great vegan options as well.


Went there for sushi with my friend. The sushi was actually good, we tried the spicy rolls. The other dish we got was a ramen, pretty good too. The restaurant is cute, but unfortunately the spaces are a little narrow. The waiter was polite and everything, but there was some miscommunication therefore we got there and they gave us a table: once sat, they told us that there were other people waiting before of us, but nobody warned us or anything so we had to get up, go out again and wait to be called inside. Besides that, the food was good! I hope it was just a one time thing :)


Amazing prices, exemplary service, and the best sushi I‚Äôve had in town. If you‚Äôre looking for dinner, these people are looking to feed you and your soul.


Fantastic. Went for lunch. My wife and I ordered a Bento each and one side dish. Everything was delicious and we were stuffed, yet also amazed at how well priced our meal was. Will definitely come here again on our next trip to Victoria.

name: Pho Vy Restaurant
editorial_summary: Small Vietnamese storefront cafe specializing in pho & other traditional fare for dine-in or to-go.
reviews:
The food was tasty and the service was fast. We came with a larger group of 6 but they were able to accommodate us quite easily. Only thing I wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of was the customer service, it was very pushy and it felt like they were trying to get us in and out as fast as possible. They would come over every 20 seconds to ask if we were ready to order when we had just sat down and as soon as one bowl was taken away they were giving us the bill and asking us to pay.

The food again was great but feeling rushed after a really long day sightseeing wasn‚Äôt a great feeling.


From all the viet places Ive been to over the years, this one had the most tender and tasty meat by far in the bun bo hue. I would recommend the dish to anyone looking for authentic viet food, i just wish it came with purple cabbage! It was amazing still, one of the best ive had. If you‚Äôre visiting Victoria, do not miss this place!


I am not a Pho connoisseur by any means, but I definitely enjoyed this simple but very flavorful pho.  I had the basic beef version for lunch, and it was plenty of food, and served extremely quickly.  I liked the sliced Jalapenos served with the bean sprouts to enhance the soup.  I will be back.


The best of the best, one of my fave viet spots in Victoria AND Vancouver. Owners are a class act. Food is always fresh and hot, portions are huge, prices haven‚Äôt been raised either. Absolutely delicious.


Great little spot for a hot bowl of pho on a cold rainy day. Gets very busy around dinner service so go early if you can, otherwise no complaints! I got the house special as i always do, but for some - tripe, tendon, all the interesting fixings may not be appetizing to you. However, i enjoyed it.

name: Moxies Victoria Restaurant
reviews:
Conveniently located, this establishment offers delicious food and a friendly staff.

While there was a minor issue with finding a hair in my sister‚Äôs drink, they promptly replaced it, demonstrating thoughtfulness. However, they didn‚Äôt remove it from the bill as a gesture.

Overall, the ambiance and service were good.

If you‚Äôre visiting Victoria, it‚Äôs worth a try, but be cautious about the hair incident.üòâ


Food is good and service was excellent. Very kid friendly place with a kids menu. A little pricy for what you get, but you're also paying for good service. We had 2 adult meals and 1 kids meal, along with 2 drinks - bill was $100 before tip.


Being a chain restaurant, I really didn't have high expectations. I was very pleasantly surprised by the whole experience! Nice clean atmosphere, great wait staff, and surprisingly delicious food. I had the spicy chicken sandwich with truffle fries, and would definitely come back again for more. Is it the most unique restaurant I've ever been to? No. But the consistency of food and service would certainly bring me back again!


Amazing! I'm absolutely impressed by this restaurant. The burger was fantastic, probably the best burger in Victoria! üòä The ambience in the restaurant is really nice. And our waiter was extremely friendly. I can absolutely recommend this restaurant. üëçüíØ
Greetings from Switzerland


Ordered off a deliver app and the ribs I got were a bit dry. I called moxies and asked if anything could be done. They gave me a few options and remade my meal. It‚Äôs delicious and the ribs are perfect!

They went above and beyond with their customer service and even added a brownie bite I was not expecting.

Thank you moxies for the great customer service and really good food! I will be back :)

name: Island Pok√© (Downtown Victoria)
reviews:
Best Pok√© I‚Äôve had. And I‚Äôve had a lot‚Ä¶

I got the Island Bowl and was seriously impressed‚Ä¶ the fish just tastes so fresh and has an irresistible marinade coating. All the ingredients were bursting with flavor and worked together so well‚Ä¶ was a bit steep at $15-20 per bowl but ended up being so good that I‚Äôd go again.

Definitely recommend trying this place!


‚ÄúWhen life gives you lemons‚Ä¶ squeeze them, add salt, garlic, oils, honey, and create a marinade for cubed fish‚Äù‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.this is what I imagine the owners think at Island Poke.

Very fresh and bright ingredients. I had the Ohana bowl for lunch. A great size and prepared by friendly staff. I will be back. Yum.


‚ÄúThe fresh fish goes crazy good. There is a wide variety of bowls and all the signature are tasty. Their service wizard fast no lie‚Äù
-Ton

‚ÄúWould recommend the spicy salmon, always a solids choice. I like how you can pick and choose whatever you want. Higher the spice, the better the food.‚Äù
-Tarek

‚ÄúNever even heard of Poke before but nows it‚Äôs going to be apart of the daily vocabulary. The quinoa is good for the portions you know?‚Äù
-Everett


The food was exceptionally fresh and excellent tasting. I ordered a bowl ü•£.
All kinds of choices for your bowl. You can pretty much have it made the way you want it. The service was great we got to watch our food be made right in front of us. Stayed at the restaurant to eat, and this little place was cozy.
I'm not much for raw sushi type foods. I'll tell you one thing,, I was impressed and probably will go back.


Delicious poke with crunchy and umami toppings. Requested the tangerines on the side and the service kindly put the portion into small containers.

name: Sushi Story
editorial_summary: Down-home kitchen doling out sushi rolls, sashimi & bibimbap, plus tempura & other Japanese staples.
reviews:
Me and my girlfriend go here frequently and it's our choice for sushi always! The servers are unbelievably nice and the food is always great and good portions (the chicken teriyaki was so shockingly big haha). Also LOVE the complimentary spring rolls! 10/10


Been here twice in a span of 20 days, which is a little too soon for me. Within those two visits, I've both had great services and great food. That consistency is very valuable to me, which I usually give restaurants one visit where the food may not be as good that time.

I may be in a disadvantage for points of view, but I did order two dinner Bento specials in a row. It is typical Japanese food fare, but the value is good for what you are getting, in my opinion. The menu is massive, which can be good or bad depending on your preferences. They have hot pot (shabu shabu) specials on Tuesdays and Thursdays, and they also have featured Korean fried chicken on their menu on my most recent visit.

Being very extremely picky, my complaint would be that the pork katsu batter was too flaky or overdone that it was very delicate on the pork and was coming off too easily. This was on the latest visit. However, still very consistent in flavour otherwise. The server is very lovely, we had the same server both visits. Despite having two tables that are groups, she was very careful in ensuring orders are delivered, and customers got their requests. I realize it's very tedious to keep handing mini plates to customers in tight corners, so props. I like the cart for delivering many orders, it just really helps the server a lot.

The location may be far for some, but I recommend giving their establishment a visit! It does get busy at times, I suggest a reservation if you plan to come in a group.


The sushi Tasted fresh, delicate, my only wish is that I got my sockeye vs farmed, had they offered to fix it when I noticed I didn't speak up for what I wanted better I would have given them 5*, but I will be back as it's the best I've had in victoria, interested to try more.
Their combos are well presented and the food looked delishes, so good I forgot to take a picture before I started.
I oredered the monkey brains, the tagadashi combo and a salmon roll.


Very sweet staff and very delicious food. Loved the service and the experience. Would love to come back and try more stuff on the menu.


Dined at this restaurant recently! Their food was great with a very affordable price! Try the Crazy Girl and the Crazy Boy! We also had the Bibimbap as well. It was a great visit!

name: Foo Asian Street Food
editorial_summary: Easygoing place serving varied Asian street food, beer & cider in a contemporary space with a patio.
reviews:
Dishes are well served, really nice quantities. We ordered 3 dishes and we had to take 1 in a box (2 adults and 2 kids). This place is delicious. They cook your plate on the spot, pretty fast too. The people there are very friendly and will consider go back on our next visit!
I personally recommend the Caramel Chicken when visiting this place. Good luck!


The crispy ginger pork was an explosion of flavor in my mouth. I would definitely recommend it. The spice level was just right for me.

My wife got the famous caramel chicken which she enjoyed. Both dishes are delicious. The potstickers though were just average fried pork dumplings. Their meat serving  was plentiful that we had to ask for a to go box for some leftovers.

Prices were reasonable considering it already includes taxes. Service was fast.


One of my favourite comfort foods in Victoria is the caramel chicken. I can‚Äôt tell you what the rest of the menu is like because I love the caramel chicken too much.

I think $16 after taxes is a great deal for the huge portion of chicken you get. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the small box. Great things come in small packages.

If you need doting, fussy service, you may find it lacking here, but I think the service is friendly, fast, polite, and professional. They‚Äôve never gotten an order wrong and they‚Äôve never taken longer than they said it would. Can‚Äôt beat that.

And when the rest of the city shuts down on Monday and Tuesday, Foo‚Äôs got your back. (It‚Äôs a Monday today.)


What a gem! This is what you might call a ‚Äúhole-in-the-wall‚Äù treasure chest of a restaurant, given its humble appearance in proximity to just another liquor store‚Ä¶ but the food was divine! Some of the best spins on Thai classics I‚Äôve seen and tasted and I look forward to trying more. Not the most ‚Äúcozy‚Äù spot given limited space and seating, but perfect for a quick yet quality meal alone or as a pair.


We will be back for more!

Had passed by this place many times, and finally stopped!  Really glad we did.

The s&s pork Belly was really tasty - the green beans were sneaky good!  We also had a daily special - lentil dahlli - which was super good too!  The fry bread was a welcome appy, as it was a unique dish!

Parking is a challenge, but the walk is worth it.

name: Ithaka Greek Restaurant
editorial_summary: Traditional Greek appetizers, platters & desserts served in a bustling, yellow-hued dining room.
reviews:
Came back for the first time after they moved to a new location.
Tried new things this time! Got a platter for 4 to share with.
Really liked the moussaka and lamb! The salad is nice and fresh too. My friends liked the calamari a lot. Their tzatziki is so good! Love it!
Everything was good not nit surprisingly good, still would recommend friend to try Greek food here


Wow was I impressed with this restaurant! The staff was so incredibly nice and the food was off the charts! I had the lamb chops medium rare and they were the best tasting lamb chops I've EVER had!!! The cook and the seasoning were absolute perfection. We shared the flaming mozzarella for an app that was truly delicious. I would highly recommend eating here. You won't be disappointed....I promise!


It‚Äôs so beautiful there, really friendly and disciplined staff. The chicken souvlaki was great. Lamb shank was a over priced. Three star because the potatoes were super salty, a pinch of salt is understandable but this much of salt was a surprise for such a well rated restaurant. I had a good experience because it represents Greece but probably not the best choice of food for a Greek restaurant. They can do better on the dishes for such a great place, but the tase was not extraordinary.

The menu was printed on regular piece of paper by a default font Microsoft word, absolute minimum effort, really?! It needs a better one.


Update on November 17, 2022:

My statement is pretty clear all the time. The reason why we are so mad and disappointed and left a 3 stars review is because: Our server that night, after we found that parchment paper from our food, he DID say sorry to us, but he DIDN‚ÄôT take the INITIATIVE to say anything about something will be complimentary, or what the thing(parchment paper) that my friend ate and found was. He DIDN‚ÄôT take any INITIATIVES to SAY something, such as ‚Äúsorry about the experience you encountered, we will offer you‚Ä¶‚Äù Or even easier ‚Äúwe will make sure that will not happen again.‚Äù
Are these really hard to say? We want to see their attitude and hear about the explanation about what they would like do to solve this problem, but they didn‚Äôt. Taking the initiatives and having communication with your customers are important.

I can apologize for my friend‚Äôs aggressive tone when she asking what the thing was in our rice. But we are the one who almost swallowed the parchment paper, not anyone else.
Here is my apology to the server for my friend: I am sorry for her aggressive tone that might made you uncomfortable, we were upset at that time, because my friend almost swallowed it.

The reason why I left a 3 stars review and described the facts about our experience was because I wanted to see their improvement, but now i just received more arguments from it. But I do need to apologize for some improper wording underneath, because I m not good at using a second language. That‚Äôs it.

====================

Met up with friends here once and ordered calamari, meat ball and creek style fries from happy hour, and two types of souvlaki from the regular menu.
The food was good, but they insisted on serving all the dishes at the same time, but lacked a heater to keep the food warm, resulting in all the dishes being cold, even the fries and calamari.
The service was slow, perhaps because the host put us in a seat above the steps and our waiter never found out when we needed help.
But the most disappointing thing was that we found a small piece of plastic or parchment paper mixed with our food, and my friend almost swallowed it. When we told the waiter about this, his first reaction was to try to destroy it and apologize to us in a careless manner without any explanation.
We all thought this was ridiculous, and although the waiter eventually removed the dish where the plastic piece was found from our bill, he never informed us of any action taken by the restaurant from the beginning to the end.
All of us work in the hospitality industry as well and this is a failure in customer service, whether it is a casual apology or staying silent at all times and not informing the guest that the restaurant is responsible for their problem and what action will be taken.


An okay Greek restaurant with a beautiful interior, and great staff.

Unfortunately, it is over priced. The food was good, but the portions were much too small, and the quality did not make up for it. The restaurant is trying to go for a more fine dining experience by changing their style and switching to this new location, but unless they do something about the food, I don‚Äôt see this lasting long.

name: Pagliacci's
editorial_summary: Pasta dishes & other Italian staples served at this stalwart eatery with kitschy decor & live music.
reviews:
We came for dinner on an early Monday evening and there was already a lineup. The host told us that it was the ‚Äúfastest moving lineup in Victoria‚Äù and, not too long after, we were seating inside.

The atmosphere was very lively and the decor had lots of interesting things to look at.

Overall, the food was delicious! The house-bread was so good that we just couldn‚Äôt stop eating it. We ordered an assortment of appetizers including the Crab Cakes, Meatballs and Mezze Platter; and for mains, we tried a couple seafood pastas and mixed seafood bowl.

The portions were substantial although the amount of seafood in of the pastas wasn‚Äôt as abundant compared to other dishes. Also, some shrimps could have been cleaned better.

We also tried several drinks and cocktails; and, they were nice. We sat close to the bar so, the bartender took good care of us personally.

The rest of the staff was very friendly and diligent as well.


When they say they‚Äôll find you a spot and the lineup will be fast they mean it! It‚Äôs so busy and booming with life in this restaurant and makes for great atmosphere. The food was delicious, we got the Minnesota Fats to start, followed by The Prawn Broker and The Big Easy for our main. We also had sangrias on tap, and a glass of wine each. The service was great considering how busy it is, there‚Äôs always someone making sure every table has what they need and asked for in a timely manner. I highly recommend eating here if you‚Äôre in Victoria, all around great experience.


We stop by this place for lunch and love it! All the staff was super friendly, helpful, and kind. We enjoy talking with them. Everything we ordered from the food and drink was savory! They have such a huge selection of lunch and drinks.
The restaurant itself is small, but they do offer outdoor sitting. Walk-in only. First, come serve. Thursday to Sunday they offer live jazz music. Check them out if you are in the area.


The food (pasta) at this place was amazing!!!

I ordered The Shell Game dish and I got to say it's probably one of the best pasta dish I ate. The only complaint I have was that the size of the food is small so definitely go for size Large as it's just a few dollars more!

The happy hour appetizers were also good.

The service was also excellent although I can see our waiter is way too busy (it was crowded) so he forget us a couple times but he was pleasant nonetheless. The setting is sort of very crowded (tables too close) so that's the only real downside.

I'm definitely coming back here again if I'm at Victoria Island.


This restaurant is what my food dreams are made of. Everything, and I mean everything, was the closest to perfect I have ever experienced. From the clever item names, to the perfectly procured *local* (silk road brand) tea, and the live band. We shared the duck wings (a little spicy, perhaps too spicy for some), and I had the enchantment under the sea salad. Unfortunately, they were all out of salmon, but their grilled chicken did not disappoint. Bring a hefty wallet (worth every penny), your appetite, and enjoy!

name: Ebizo Japanese Restaurant Ltd
editorial_summary: Cozy spot for creative sushi & cooked Japanese fare including teriyaki dinners along with full bar.
reviews:
Favourite sushi bar in Victoria. Great location to walk to if you‚Äôre downtown, near great shops off government street. Service is always excellent. The atmosphere is quiet and a great layout, not a huge place so at peak times you may have to wait for a table. I‚Äôve purchased takeout as well and quality is still superior to other sushi takeout. A favourite place of mine for lunch. The food is top notch, always peak freshness, excellent presentation as well.


I honestly think 3 stars is really generous. I had high hopes based on the past reviews, but its not that good. You need to make a reservation since it's not that big, and the service is slow and indifferent at best. I think we waited for more than 45 minutes for our food and it didn't arrive at the same time. Im thinking take out orders were given priority. The sushi was fine, but the rice was cold. The salmon and new york steak teriyaki were also just okay and served almost western style.  The beef noddle soup was bland and didnt taste like anything. Honestly, there are better Japanese restaurants nearby, so please avoid this one.


The staff was all nice and it was super busy when we walked in. The food was good, especially the vegetable tempura, but even after the restaurant was no longer busy it took way longer than it should have to get our sushi. There was almost a 45 minute gap between our tempura and the sushi. Besides that everything else was great.


My work colleague rants and raves of this place all the time and had been bugging me to go all these months. I finally did somewhat reluctantly; I had a one-time unpleasant experience eating here with my dad when I was 16 (my older daughter is currently this age just to give you a time stamp) and had bad diarrhea afterwards, nearly missing my first Young Drivers appointment back in the day. üôÖüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Food quality is okay. The sashimi is fresh but not that huge deal that it melts in your mouth and you must go here now that I read in other reviews. ü§î As you can see, the presentation for their large assorted sashimi is very lacking; 15 pieces yes, but of very limited type and for the price? Not a good value to the eye of a sashimi connoisseur. My beef teriyaki was overcooked. They asked how I liked it done, I replied medium rare, but dish was medium borderline well done.

Service was there but quite slow; we were given the bill but took a very, very long time for them to come back for the POS. I mean, why bring the bill if you're not ready to accept payment right then and there, and made to wait? ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

No stomach upset this visit which is a plus but even ordering their two biggest entrees, I left the place hungry still and underwhelmed. I feel this place is overhyped, would only go back here with accompaniment, and would most likely order something completely else on the menu. üôéüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è


Make a reservation, because the fact that our reserved group of 6 (the max they'll reserve for) went on a Tuesday evening and the place was just packed, says it all. Really good food; really good service. If you love sushi, do not miss this opportunity. And if you have celiac disease, just ask for gluten-free options and they'll have you covered. I went there with my gluten-free Meetup and it was excellent. Reasonable prices too, considering the times we live in. A great date-night idea in the heart of downtown.

name: Little Yunnan Restaurant
editorial_summary: Casual restaurant focusing on traditional specialties from the Chinese province of Yunnan.
reviews:
Really excellent food. We had the traditional crossing the bridge and the seafood. Both were amazing and had a bunch of ingredients I'd never heard of before. Definitely delicious. Also tried the healthy juice. Tasted like a strawberry white wine, it was very nice.

They were out of the fish ball soup I wanted to try but that wasn't a big deal at all. Next time I would try the cold pigs ears because that sounds exceptionally interesting.

Just barely knocking off a star for the service. Fairly quick seating but it did take almost 15 minutes to receive a menu. There were only two servers on that night and it was quite busy. They were very obviously stressed and running around. If I went again I'm sure I would amend my review to 5 stars. The waitresses could have just used an extra hand :)


Nice restaurant located in Victoria Chinatown near the Fan Tan Alley. Their feature is cross bright noodle soup from Yunnan. To be honest not the worst but not the best either. Feels like the soup base add a lot MSG because very savoury. The portion is not big each ingredient like only one or two bites. Noodle doesn‚Äôt feel fresh it‚Äôs pre-cooked. If just for simple dinner that‚Äôs okay but don‚Äôt expect too much fancy.


ONE OF THE BEST NOODLES I‚ÄôVE HAD IN MY LIFE!

Not only it was a great experience of serving ourselves the noodle mix, the taste is incredible. The waitress is also very nice, very fast service.

Their pork ribs is also a must try, and their pork belly is also good.

Definitely coming back when visiting victoria & its chinatown.


The food was so great and the price of it is reasonable. It is also good for a whole family to have dinner or lunch here. I like the decoration and music playing in this restaurant as well. I really enjoyed the delicious broth and rice noodles in this restaurant and the waitresses told me that it took around 8 hrs for them to make the broth every day!

More importantly, although there were full of people in the restaurant when I was eating, the waitresses tried their best to bring the drink and food for me as soon as possible. There were just two waitresses and almost all of the tables were full, so I think they already provided their best service and all of the customers in the restaurant also waited for them patiently and didn‚Äôt rush them.

What a nice place and people here were happy. I would definitely come here and enjoy other dishes soon!
100% recommend!!:)


Not a big fan of the "crossing the bridge" noodles but A BIG FAN of all the other traditional Yunnan dishes we tried: Cured beef, spicy braised chicken, sweet and sour marinated veggies, spicy seaweed, etc. We love those and will be back. The restaurant was quite popular that it ran out of food 1h30 before the closing time.

name: Yummy Truck: Mediterranean and East African Cuisine
reviews:
Terrible experience. I‚Äôm sorry but putting processed rotten tasting chicken and processed cheese slices on you club sandwich Is a joke. People are paying you good money to eat and you offer garbage. I won‚Äôt even start on the fries üòí just bad all around.


Great Flaffle wrap and great customer service


This shawarma tastes like heaven! Try the beer shawarma with garlic sauce if you like the garlic taste, it is great!


Great shawarma. Best I have ever had actually. It took a few minutes to make but it was so fresh it was worth the wait. Friendly service too. Will definately return. Located behind the museum


One of the best wrap kebab of my life.
Service fast and just perfect.

name: Sushi Time Express
editorial_summary: Casual Japanese eatery serving sushi, noodles, rice bowls & more in quirky surroundings.
reviews:
Excellent food and services! I made a quick stop to pick up some food before taking a ferry back to the U.S.

We ordered a teriyaki chicken and tuna sushi bowl. The food was ready within 10 minutes and both dishes were very fresh and tasty. The tuna bowl with the spicy sauce (called Gochujang if you are familiar with Korean food) was filled with flavor.

The owner provided more than excellent service - she brought us some cold water while we were waiting for the food to go and perfectly packed the dishes at our convenience. Her hospitality was one of highlights of our trip in Victoria.

I'd recommend this place to anyone who wants fresh and healthy meals.


I had no idea that a truly authentic Japanese eatery place exists. This restaurant is located on the first floor of a building. I walked by it many times.

Food is authentic. The couple (Magarete and Don?) running the restaurant make truly authentic Japanese/Korean style food. They are super friendly. The food tastes like what I had in Japan. My avocado sushi is delicious. Reasonably priced.

Great value for the price you pay. I would go back to try other vegan Japanese food without any hesitations.


Great counter service and lots to choose from! I ordered avocado rolls, a Philly roll and a Teriyaki Noodle Box with Veggies and Tofu. They've been here for 9 years!


Not only is the food great here, but the customer service is some of the best I have ever seen.

The owners are so nice and courteous, and provide detailed attention to each customer.

I got the grilled chicken roll and it was so fresh and delicious. You can tell they use good ingredients here, and really know how to make proper Japanese Sushi.

I definitely will be back to this great establishment.


Incredible food with the friendliest hospitality! I was amazed that the owner knew so many of her customers by name. My favorite is the Unagi roll

name: Rebar
editorial_summary: Contemporary vegetarian eatery with a low-key vibe, plus a selection of juices, wine & beer.
reviews:
Lovely and lively lunch. I was visiting Victoria and decided to give Rebar a try. Even though it was past 1:00 pm, the place was busy and bright. Colourful table covers greeted me. I had the full Rebar salad that was both filling and delicious. The lemon square for dessert was just the right balance of sweet and acidic. Staff were friendly and efficient. Enjoy!


We walked here for lunch on Wednesday and arrived about 1230.  There was no wait and about 6 or 7 other occupied tables.

We were quickly seated and the waiter came by twice as we weren‚Äôt sure what we were going to have and were busy chatting.

The food came out pretty quickly and looked fantastic; we had the Rock Fish Tacos, a rice noodle/peanut salad and an egg sandwich.  All were very tasty and a pretty good portion!

We were however disappointed with the service after we got our food‚Ä¶like we had been forgotten.  Not once did anyone come back to check on us - we had 3 empty glasses on the corner of the table for more water and sat with empty plates for quite sometime.  We attempted to gain eye contact but never achieved our goal.

It was only when we went to get up to find someone to get the bill were we acknowledged again.  I am not sure if they were low on staff but it is not a large restaurant and they could have least pop buy one more time to see if everything was alright.


Perfect location, Nicely prepared food with sufficient portion size. I can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs a Vegetarian restaurant but that makes them unique restaurant, which serves healthy and hygienic food.

The server was knowledgeable about recipes and quite helpful. Menu is well designed. Although less food options in menu, the quality of food is superb with balanced flavors and taste. We had ordered 1 enchilada and 1 pad Thai noodles with 1 miso soup and 1 dal soup, and it was more than sufficient for a family of 5. Everything was tasty and filling. My wife had severe headache, so, requested tea with ginger and mint and the server and chef tried their best to get it done. Nice gesture. One must pay a visit, it‚Äôs really worth it. Lunchtime visit is preferable to avoid rush and wait. Interior and tables are simple but clean, little upgrade in tables and toilet will take the restaurant to top in the area.


Great casual place with delicious, healthy food.  The Super Bowl was delicious and a good portion size. Peanut noodles were creamy and again a good size portion. Atmosphere is upbeat but also relaxing. Highly recommend!


The produce was really good but the eggs were over cooked and the had browns were burned. The vegan bowl was too oily and the sauce bland. The atmosphere was really nice.

name: Chicken 649
editorial_summary: Family-owned outpost featuring classic Korean fried chicken with varied sauces in a simple space.
reviews:
Heard a lot about this place and I've driven by many times and wanted to go there, so I finally did and honestly it was a disappointment. I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was pretty much a bunch of gristle and bits of chicken. I was fully expecting to bite into a nice juicy piece of fried chicken but that didn't happen at all. After all the hype from my friends I expected a lot more out of it. I've been to a number of other chicken places around town and those are much better in comparison. I'll be returning to those places instead as I know I'll get a good meal.


If you want deep fried batter then that's what you get.  Oily tasty goo with a bit of chicken.  Since I couldn't find much chicken in my first bite as the batter was overwhelming I thought I would take apart two pieces of their chicken to see how much was batter and bone versus chicken meat. Say 60 to 70% is batter with bone and 30 to 40% is chicken.


Had the chicken sandwich meal, which was fine. The chicken itself seemed to be a thigh, and a pretty anemic one at that. This sandwich is absolutely not worth twelve dollars -- even in this hyperinflation new world.

I waited 26 minutes for my order even though when I ordered, the restaurant was totally empty. It seems like this business heavily prioritizes Skip the Dishes over it's in-store diners.

A couple came in nearly 8 minutes after me, ordered a chicken meal, and ate it before my meal even arrived. A cashier told me my order was still coming, but it takes longer because it's a sandwich -- I'm still trying to figure out the logic of how a single chicken thighs could take 26 minutes to deep fry unless someone plain ol' forgot to make it for 15 minutes; but fine.

What kills me is that the FLAVOR was great. The sauce was fantastic, and the wedges were flavorful if not a bit undercooked.
