Probably won't be back after that experience, but you should give it a shot if you haven't had Korean chicken before.


Make this your Korean Fried chicken stop!

Honestly very surprised with the 1 star reviews as I had the complete opposite experience (more than once) ordering from this location.

I called to make a take out order of 2x full set of wings. 1 order was half and half (sweet honey & soy almond) 1 order of sweet & spicy. Both box‚Äôs were heavy when I picked them up meaning we were getting what we paid for.
What I personally like if some wings are boneless, this time around I had more than usual and I love that! They are tasty, savoury & filling!

When I called, they mentioned a 15 min wait and they held up to their word. Again, not sure about the lower star review but my experiences have been nothing shy of great which also reflects in the food.

Thanks for the good dining experience!


Best Fried Chicken in Victoria!

We were driving around the area today (7/13) and for the first time, we decided to try this restaurant called Chicken 649 that people have been raving about.

We ordered the 1/2 & 1/2 meal. This came with The Original Crispy chicken and The Yang Nyeom (Korean Chicken:Just enough Spiciness) üòãüòãSo Yummy!

The Filipina behind the counter (I forgot her name üòû) was very Professional, Helpful and Friendly. She even helped out an older gentleman to pick up some of his change, that he had dropped while He was eating his dinner.

This place is a bit small and can be crowded at times, but it is a hidden gem.

name: Nowhere *A Restaurant
reviews:
We had a fantastic experience here with an amazing 6-courses meal and wine pairing.

Each course uses fresh local ingredients to the maximum extent and is presented in an extremely creative way. The wine pairing also matches the meal very well, maximizing the deliciousness of the ingredients.

The owners explained the ingredients, origin and taste of each dish in detail for us. The owners also detail the origin and distillery for each drink, as well as describe its taste and why each wine matches the meal.

Every course is very delicious, the dining experience is extremely great, highly recommended!


This was an amazing 8 course meal. We arrived and ordered drinks. Each course was a surprise and delivered to us with an explanation of what we were having and where it came from. Everything was delicious and unique. There is a new tasting menu every month and we can not wait to go again. Highly recommend.


Read the reviews and had reservations of what my food will be like. However, was surprised that it was actually very decent! Food was really good. Flavours were adventuress and wild! Not your everyday steak and seafood restaurant.

Only negative is that it's definitely not the cheapest thing, however, I can see that there was a lot of thought put into every dish.


After many months of waiting, it is finally our turn! This place is worth the wait! Nowhere A Restaurant offers impeccable service! This YAM 2022 award restaurant gives a simple, rustic, and imaginative atmosphere and chef Clark Deutscher is such a talented and optimistic person! The experience is an unpredictable multi-course mystery menu is quite exciting and full of anticipation!
After this unusual dining experience, we are now comfortable enough to recommend Nowhere A Restaurant to anyone who is seeking savory culinary art that is not too upscale but rather a local food experience from a team that is highly devoted its work for diners that appreciate their dedication. Besides the distinctive tasting menu, you can make your evening even more refined by adding a $79 wine pairing. The wine list is very hyper-local and enhances your vinous world with an extraordinary expedition to unfamiliar BC territory vineyards.
Chefs Laura Cousins and Clark Deutscher bring delightful agriculture into their kitchen but also are farm-to-table ingredient-driven to you and this is what makes Nowhere A restaurant so unique!


Delicious food and wonderful service.  We had 2 tasting menus and shared the wine pairing. Every dish was great and we had a wonderful introduction to each dish  and the restaurant from the owners wife who was serving tables that day. Everyone was so warm, we‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

name: Zambri's
editorial_summary: Set in a stylish, eco-conscious building, this trattoria serves classics like pasta, pizza & wine.
reviews:
Nice location serving well executed family friendly Italian eats. Dishes are very well portioned and the menu was simple. The fried brocolli was wonderful. Service was good and very unobtrusive. We enjoyed our dinner here.


Zambris has always been a favourite restaurant. So, when my husband and I were planning our wedding, it was a total fluke that we were ordering takeout and then mentioned events. About a year later, we were hosting our small wedding reception in the atrium of their building. And as always, Zambri‚Äôs delivered on the food. From the antipasto, pizza and amazing cocktails to the drool worthy multi-course tasting menu. They nailed every dishes, each more delicious than the last. The crispy broccoli and panna cotta were especially a hit. Not a single guest went home feeling hungry. In fact, in the months since our wedding, our guests have raved about how amazing the food was. It truly stood out. In addition to the food, I have to mention the staff. They really went above and beyond. I never saw an empty wine glass. We had little ones at the reception, and the staff were so kind and patient. We can‚Äôt wait to celebrate our wedding anniversary for years to come at Zambri‚Äôs. This place truly holds a special place in our hearts.


Ordered their seafood dish of the day which was halibut and it was good. The server at our table was a bit odd with me and my colleague. She was nice but didn't collect the empty plates from my colleague when she was long finished with her meal while trying to take my plate while I was still eating and working on my plate.

That was slightly off-putting to say the least especially while the two of us were having a good conversation being regularly interrupted then not clearing the actual empty plates sitting on the table each time.

I'm hoping next experience will be better but it's not enough for me to feel convinced in returning on my own accord.


Focaccia was good  would have been great it was warm. Had the house red, can't remember what It was called but it was really nice. Food, filled me up nicely and had a decent balance. Not too strong or overbearing while having an overall great taste


Wonderful experience! The space is beautiful. Cocktail and wine selection is nicely curated. Food is cheaper than I expected and had nice hues of authentic Italian cuisine. 10/10

name: IL Covo Trattoria
editorial_summary: Rustic Italian dishes are the draw at this charming eatery with vaulted ceilings & a garden patio.
reviews:
Great experience here last night.  While Spaghetti and meatballs isn't on the menu, they obliged and I am so thankful.  Absolutely delicious!  Loved that the sauce was meaty as well.  My wife had the basil pesto gnocchi, and this was also fantastic, although I would struggle to eat it all because it packed such a punch of flavour.  The house wine is great, much better than the usual house wine you get elsewhere.  The antipasto platter is an amazing presentation, as well.  Excellent service.


Really feels like a little Italy; lots of people, reservation available, music, Italian speaking servers and wonderful general atmosphere. Opens right at 5pm, so if you reserve for this time, expect to stand outside till 5. Food is delicious, great serving sizes and filling food. Can cook items to preference, but anything on their menu is delicious. There are space dividers between tables making it comfortable, but the dividers also allow for the general atmosphere to continue as they are clear at the top and have a custom design on the bottom. Beautiful garden with string lights, again, very romantic in atmosphere. Great for dining as a couple and as a small group (max is 6). Many thanks for the great food!


This Italian restaurant has a beautiful ambience, with romantic decor, candles and tasteful yet interesting music in the background.  All the food was terrific, even the soup, salad, and bread (which came with a tasty spread), and all is made in-house, including the pasta and desserts, which were delicious‚ù£Ô∏è. The service was professional and friendly by all, and our server Raimondo was well paced, with a warm and humorous demeanour, but still efficient and attentive.  This restaurant is a must experience for all in Victoria‚ù£Ô∏è $$$


We came here for our birthday dinner after hearing several recommendations from locals. We made reservations the night before, but I would do it several days out of possible. Everything was so yummy! We shared a salad and main dish. The wait staff were very friendly and helpful.


Service was fantastic. Food was really good. Presentenatin felt really upscale. The best part was the patio. It was absolutely beautiful and hate heat lamps. You will need a reservation, if it's summer reserve the patio

name: Little Jumbo Restaurant and Bar
editorial_summary: Cozy, urban speakeasy providing a chill atmosphere, an imaginative, elevated menu & craft cocktails.
reviews:
Excellent bar with sophisticated cocktails. Perfect fancy date night bar. As a tourist, I went out of my way to find a non-tourist cocktail bar and they delivered. They have an eclectic and extensive assortment of spirits. Knowing it was dedicated to historic bar masters I had high hopes, but it truly exceeded my expectations. Anytime I'm back in Victoria I'll be visiting again.


My first time eating here was for my birthday. I had read the reviews and had some friends talk about their experience.

Over all not a bad experience. we were seated at the bar, was able to watch the bartenders make cocktails. Service was good, it did take a while to have our order taken.

Although the food was good, I did find the price a bit high based on what was received. I understand a lot of factors go into building the price list, I just thought for a spot that is claimed to be one of the best in YYJ, my expectation was higher than what was received.


Came to this restaurant after our wedding to celebrate as I‚Äôve heard good things, even our wedding commissioner was recommending this place, however I think the hype it‚Äôs overrated, for our visit to say at least, the cocktail menu is nothing impressive or innovative, the salad and the mussel are both meh, the pasta was under seasoned, the wine could get reduced a bit more as you can still taste the alcohol, only thing better was the duck wings. Service was good but the food is not worth going back for.


Hubby and I were celebrating our honeymoon in Victoria and decided to check out Little Jumbo. It was a really nice atmosphere.

The food was quite tasty.. the drinks were strong! Service was pretty good, although the bartender was quite busy so wasn‚Äôt able to give us much attention. When we were finished and wanted to pay for our bill, he was nowhere in sight so we flagged down another waitress to cash us out.

Overall I would recommend checking it out. Apparently the menu changes weekly so you likely won‚Äôt be able to try the same things we did. The scallop pasta was delicious, slightly small portion and a little bit pricy.


Nice little hidden resto bar that was perfect for a way to end the evening. We came in here for dinner but were pleasantly surprised by the late night menu. We ordered fries, crab cakes, shishito peppers, and Tuna tartar and everything was generous portions and very good! Cocktails were excellent, though on the pricier end. Lovely atmosphere üíï

name: Victoria Harbour House Restaurant
editorial_summary: Quaint spot overlooking a small park & serving traditional fare, including steaks, seafood & pasta.
reviews:
Exploring Victoria, taken aback by the rich diversity in culture and history we were lucky to stumble across this hidden gem. Located only steps away from the Best Western Plus Inner Harbour hotel, the Victoria Harbour House Restaurant boasts a well rounded menu for varying palates.

The staff were friendly and helpful and the service was one of a kind... the personal touch and humor provided a welcoming atmosphere...Bob was fantastic!

The food was well prepared and the presentation was simple but perfect for this particular place.

We had the Escargot Bourguignon and French Onion soup to start... both very delicious !

We enjoyed the 6oz New York Steak with Lobster... the steak was seasoned and cooked to perfection!

We also had the Shrimp scampi which was served with a very delicate but flavorful white wine sauce... yummy!

Can't forget to mention the fantastic wine and dessert selection! The Cr√®me Brul√©e was one of the best I've had, the Lemon Cheesecake with blueberry sauce was light and flavorful, and the Chocolate Mousse was dreamy!

Overall 4.5 üåü for quality, taste, service, location, experience, and atmosphere!

The hours are 4pm to 8pm... we went as a walk in and were lucky to get a seat; I would recommend a reservation.


Good friendly service and attentive. They had a special for steak and lobster with a salad. The lobster was good but the steak was lower quality for sure. The bread was good though. You will need a vaccine card to dine in. They are only opened during dinner hours.


Celebrated my husband's birthday in this quaint and home style atmosphere. Waitress was attentive. Food was very good. Been in business for 40+ years. Would eat here again


Service was good. But non-alcoholic cocktails contain alcohol. 5 months ago, I had gastric cancer surgery. so absolutely alcohol is dangerous to me. also, my friend's food has a kitchen iron brush. My birthday dinner has become a risky meal.


4/5 and 4/6/23:  It‚Äôs not often good cuisine meets stellar service and wonderful atmosphere!  As a solo diner, I didn‚Äôt feel slighted and was seated at a window table.  I had the spaghetti bolognese on day 1 and returned to have steak & prawns with the house salad on day 2.  I was a happy grandma.  Thanks, Julie!

name: Fiamo Pizza & Wine Bar
editorial_summary: Late-night hot spot with a terrace serving wood-fired pizza & Italian mains, plus prosecco on tap.
reviews:
Fiamo is a cozy yet chic Italian restaurant.  Inside the restaurant is romantic, dark, and moody: perfect for a date night, evening cocktails, or having an intimate night to yourself.  They have a closed patio as well as an open-aired one though unfortunately it wasn't open when I visited.

Leah was our server who was methodical in how she went about the steps of service.  Amy also stands out to me in her role as a support staff/host.  Overall, the staff were quality: laid back but also seemed to care for their work.

I came for a Sunday night dinner so regrettably, the pasta dishes weren't available reducing the choices in entree.  However, their rotating specials of the day were a nice addition ensuring greater variety.  This also implies they utilize seasonal ingredients and come up with new dishes in addition to the set menu-- probably more fun for the kitchen staff too!

I ordered their special of the day: Eggplant Parmesan ($26) which was delectable.  I loved the addition of roasted vegetables (including potatoes, broccolini, sweet peppers, and carrots) to brighten up the otherwise heavy dish.

I would recommend this place for those in Victoria and craving a good Italian meal with a charming atmosphere :).


We came here on a Friday night.
With a reservation, we didn't wait to get our table. The table was located on a loft, feel sorry for the servers who need to run up and down every time.
We ordered Arancini for starter. They were rispy but bland that I had to dip them into the vinaigrette that was provided for the buns.
I ordered full size carbonara. The portion was very generous, but it was very salty. Because it's big portion, I had to finish slowly. It got a bit dry when it got to the end.
My friend ordered a medium rare steak. It came in medium well. The gentleman was nice enough to take it back, replaced the dish, and took it off the bill. The second steak came as medium rare.


We were lucky enough to have get a table on the terrace.  It's very cute with string lights.  Some tables have a propane open flame on their table.  Food was very good.  The pizza tasty an so is the pasta.  Not exceptional but very good.  The waitress was super nice.  Definitely reserve because it gets very crowded.  A casual good eat.


One of the few places still open after 10pm in downtown Victoria which is the best part. Sad part is restricted menu of Pizza and a few other things if you are hungry.
Their gourmet Pizza is nothing to brag about, but it is quite decent. The desserts are OK.

Service is great.

But you definitely have to try it out if you are in for a midnight snack kind of thing when roaming downtown Victoria


We ate dinner outside on a beautiful day. The evening can be chilly but we sat right under the heater. It was perfect! My husband had their beet salad and loved it. We shared some brussel sprouts and they were soooooo good...very crispy on the outside and very flavorful. We shared a pepperoni pizza and the meaty one (can't remember the name) Both were delicious but the meaty one had a nice spice to it. A great dinner to end the day.

name: The Hive Eatery
reviews:
Amazing food! The sesame chicken strips and the butter chicken poutine were great, and the salad was outstanding.

Cute area for the restaurant with a nice outdoor seating/waiting area on the side of the building. Highly recommended!


Last day in Victoria and found this little local and fresh spot! Read some of the reviews about how "it's not the same as it once was with new ownership", yatta yatta ...didn't let it phase me as I have never been here before so there's no way for comparison. The spot, in my opinion, does not equate for a bad review whatsoever!

The food is fresh and local, as the people of BC adore and prefer...and as a fellow Canadian I prefer that as well.

The service wasn't extremely fast or slow, which is perfect balance for little dives like this.

I had the Conrflake Chicken Burger, and added that bacon as well. A nice portion of well cooked fries came with it for about $19.00 CAD, as to be expected these days. Tasty, juicy and nothing was dry, just very fresh from top to bottom!

The only suggestion would be for the burger to have a little bit, just a little bit more sauce, yet it was still delicious.

If one has not been here before, previous or new ownership, I highly recommend to come and give it a go. Not disappointing at all! ü§ôüíØ


The new owners here are very nice! They just added a butter chicken poutine to their menu and it was INSANELY TASTY. And a very generous portion of chicken, cheese and sauce! We will definitely have it again!


This is the best burger. Period. I live close by and go with others fairly often. Had the beef - excellent; lamb - outstanding; chicken - also great. And the veggie burger is the best ever. Better than Big Wheel and Bin 4. Ordering on line is seamless and it‚Äôs always ready in 10 mins or less. Go. Now.


The food was not good. The chicken strips were dry and stringy. Some of the fries were raw, as in uncooked potato. The fried fish was moist, but the batter tasted strongly of curry. The menu does not say curry flavored fish n chips, so they are not separating the items.

The staff is friendly and maybe they will improve their cooking. The meal was not worth the money, so I do not plan to buy from them again. Yes, I did like the old Hive and this is very different. It is not just a matter of taste, they are not preparing the food properly. Raw fries.

name: Lot 1 Pasta Bar
editorial_summary: Airy, industrial-chic restaurant specializing in creative Italian pasta dishes with global twists.
reviews:
Our server was very knowledgeable and friendly and we got there at the beginning of happy hour so it was slow but when we left it got very busy. The food took a little longer as with the bill but the quality of service and food made up for it. The pasta was the best pasta I've ever had hands down. They make it daily, I had to eat it slow to savor every bite. We are visiting from Ontario and if you are in the area and want amazing quality food at good price, visit here during happy hour ( based on the time change it was dinner time for us anyway üòÇ).


A very nice meal at Lot 1. We started with a bottle of red wine and their Lot 1 Roasted Garlic Herb Bread ( March feature ) It wasn't what we were expecting as it's very similar to a deflated focaccia but it was tasty. For main, I ordered the Moroccan Chicken Rigatoni minus the red peppers, added extra cashews. Very flavorful, great portion size and a little bit of an unexpected heat. Finished the night off with the white chocolate cheesecake minus the raspberry sauce, maybe a little to much caramel. An excellent desert paired with a glass of red wine. Overall a great meal. Server was great, very tentative. Will be back.


We went here very famished and it didn‚Äôt disappoint! Our server was very friendly and accommodating. We had some complimentary snack and had my toddler‚Äôs spaghetti custom made! We left feeling full, satisfied and happy. Servings were huge and good for sharing. Good food and great service, highly recommended!


Great find for amazing pasta in Victoria!
I am so so glad that I decided to pop in here one evening. The range and quality of the pasta dishes is excellent - the bacon and mushroom ravioli was just outstanding.
Add to that a great selection of cocktails and the BEST brownies I think I've ever had, and Lot 1 Pasta Bar is an easy recommendation to make.
The venue is clean, tidy and appealing, and the staff are friendly and knowledgeable about their menu.
Thank you to all of the staff for a lovely evening and excellent food!


Very tasty pasta served in nice large portions so you will definitely be full and happy. Good happy hour deals including mussels, baked brie, and giant meatballs. The polenta bites are particularly tasty. All the pasta dishes tasted very fresh and the ravioli was particularly delicious. The downsides are that the pork belly was quite dry and they advertise fresh squeezed orange juice from real oranges but when I got served mine it was most definitely not fresh squeezed orange juice but boxed orange juice. As someone that regularly drinks fresh squeezed orange juice the difference is night and day. You can even see in the picture included that the color of the actual orange slice they added is completely different than the color of the juice they served which was opaque and tasted like a Tropicana variant. If it's not fresh squeezed, they can just be honest and put it in the menu as orange juice instead of "fresh squeezed orange juice" as it's false advertising.

name: Sedona Restaurant & Lounge
reviews:
This is an beautiful restaurant with great food, service, and a deer sanctuary across the street!  Maybe not a sanctuary, but there was a mother deer and her fawn grazing in the grass. Truly amazing experience at dinner.
I had the beef short rib, it was slow roasted over 48 hours! Resulting in tender and delicious beef.  Tasted amazing with the sauces included.
This is a perfect date spot, and I would highly recommend it if you're looking for something special!


What an incredible restaurant!
The beet appetizer has such a great texture. The dumplings had the most delicious peanut sauce. The lamb and pork were both cooked beautifully. The potatoes and vegetables on the side had perfect seasoning. The Demi glaze was perfect with a beautiful rosemary flavour. The mascarpone cheesecake with blueberry and lemon was truly delightful.

Thank you for such an incredible meal!


A neighborhood high-end restaurant that starts serving dinner at 4pm.  Chef also runs front of house and greets customers herself.  Recommend calling in for a reservation as the restaurant is short staffed.  You can discuss your dietary restrictions with the chef and request to add extra protein or carbs to you main dishes.  Pasta and fish dish changes daily.  Lots of cocktail and wine selection.


Lovely neighbourhood restaurant with extremely fresh, tasty, and comforting meals. You could tell they were made with love. We had the gnocchi to share as a starter, ribs, and then sampled all the desserts‚Äîthe sticky toffee pudding was to die for!

The owners are also incredibly nice, which made it a really fun dining experience.

Oh, and well-priced cocktails, to boot!


Tried Sedona Cafe for the first time last night. The food was absolutely spectacular! The four of us ordered four different entrees and each was amazing. They have a beautiful wine list as well. Ohhh and the cocktails were innovative and delicious! This restaurant is a MUST TRY!!!

name: Nubo Kitchen + Bar
editorial_summary: Stylish venue offering Japanese favourites & Western fusion dishes, plus cocktails.
reviews:
Came to Nubo for dinner with 2 friends while out from Manitoba on vacation. This was the best all-around meal I've had in a while. The portions were more than expected...looking at you Puff Daddy...and the flavors were on-point. I will have continued dreams about the Japa Roll and the British Fish and Chips roll had a whimsically delicious spin. Our server was absolutely delightful and helpful with any questions we had. Nubo will absolutely be put on the must-go list for next time I'm out.


We were looking forward to our anniversary dinner here. The service was good. The seating was good. And if you like rice with a bit of fish flavoring on top, you'll love this place. We prefer a bit more fish in our sushi dinners. We ordered quite a bit with our tab over $100, and if there was more than 2 oz of fish between our two meals I'd be shocked. Lots and lots of rice, though. Did NOT look like the pictures. (Maybe it was because it was Monday and they ran out of fish from the weekend? Who knows. We won't be back to find out)

Overall experience: Meh.


We ended up ordering several dishes, not all I photographed. The cocktails were definitely the highlight of the night, most of the food we ordered was underwhelming and came in tiny potions. The Unagyu roll was mostly rice... Sadly. I've never seen a sushi restaurant be so light handed with the fish. The Earl Grey mar tea ni was the best drink I had on the menu! 10/10.


The restaurant is beautiful, great location, lots of windows and natural light. Our server was awesome! The food was absolutely delicious and was made so quickly. When I visit Victoria again, I will definitely be stopping in here. Oh and the prices were really great too. 5 stars all around.


Had a great Birthday dinner with my friends tonight, friendly staff, perfect service and great food. The cocktails were absolutely amazing, everything was just so fresh and delicious.

name: The Mint Restaurant
editorial_summary: Intimate subterranean eatery offering creative Himalayan dishes, DJ shows & mint-based cocktails.
reviews:
We had such a nice night.  We came for a comedy night and while we had to buy tickets they were very reasonably priced.  The food was pretty good, drinks were good too.  I ordered a cocktail I didn't like and they happily exchanged it for another.  The atmosphere and service were awesome.  Great job The Mint team with Ok, Dope.


We came just for the food, however the ambiance did seem right for a few drinks if your looking for it.

We tried the curries and cilantro sticky rice. The curries was more of and Indian style, and the sticky rice was not a traditional sticky rice, but more like a sushi sticky one.

Overall taste was fairly good on both our orders.. food was fresh. Staff was friendly.


Really nice ambience and lovely vibe. Especially love the convenience of the location and characterful entrance! Nonetheless, nothing stood out to me when it came to food or drinks. Quite overpriced for what it turned out to be, in my opinion. But kuddos to the lovely staff who work here who were nothing but kind to us!


I recently dined at The Mint in downtown Victoria and I must say, I was thoroughly impressed! The guest skills of the staff were exceptional and made me feel welcome and appreciated from the moment I walked in. üëçüëè

As for the food, I highly recommend the tofu dish - it was simply delicious! üå±üç≤ The dish was perfectly cooked and had a nice blend of flavors that left me wanting more. The chef truly knows how to work their magic in the kitchen. ü§§

The ambiance of the restaurant is also worth mentioning - it was cozy, warm, and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a night out with friends or a romantic dinner. üïØÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Overall, I highly recommend The Mint to anyone looking for an exceptional dining experience in downtown Victoria. With friendly and attentive guest skills and mouth-watering dishes like the tofu, it's a must-visit destination for foodies and those seeking a memorable night out. üçΩÔ∏èüëå


Getting a fantastic gluten-free meal at midnight - yes please! Ginger rice with tofu was so good, and heard great things about the salad with goat cheese too. Service was excellent: quick, friendly, and vibe was great. We shall be back!

name: Nubo Japanese Tapas
editorial_summary: Casual, narrow venue for modern Japanese izakaya-style dishes, bowls & tapas, plus sake.
reviews:
I rarely provide 5 star reviews due to something always being off. Whether that be the food, service, or the environment. But this was impeccable. Very rarely did you find such fluidity and cooperation between serving staff and the kitchen.

The food was very delicious and surprisingly quick. Having fast service is usually a red flag for me, wondering if the food was fresh or made with quality, but without a doubt, it was made well.

Our waitress was very polite and nice to talk with. She always responded to our "thank you" with a "you're welcome" she had the perfect balance of attention and checkups to not annoy people with constant checks but didn't leave you wondering if you were going to be served. It was the perfect balance.

The restaurant is small, which does make the noise travel quite far, on the louder side, but being at the bar was a saving grace as volume seemed to be lower there.

All in all it was a very nice experience and the next time we are in Victoria we will definitely be returning for another meal.


Incredible atmosphere that somehow manages to be both exciting and intimate, and like the food, in perfectly balanced servings.

Amazed at the number of flavours and ingredients they are able to fit into a sushi roll without falling into the "westernized sizing" that so many similar establishments seemed to have adopted. Delicate, balanced, and satisfying without being a meal ender.

For those who enjoy all the various food media these days, and have wanted to experiment without signing up for a large, unknown dish... the Tapas style and extremely affordable menu makes multiple visits not only a must, but a new, yet familiar experience with each visit.

Attentive yet subdued service finishes the dish perfectly.

Balance and thoughtfulness are the threads throughout which the entire experience is woven.


Really good place to get sushi and other Japanese dishes. It was a very busy night but they were able to accommodate us swiftly. Love the aburi! Service was outstanding and the food came quickly for us. Quite a variety of items on the menu that are moderately on a high price point but the quality is there. Definitely would come back.


Absolutely DYNAMITE! Fabulous taste, and great drinks. I never knew how good pesto could be on a sushi roll, but here we are. The Fish and Chip roll, the Victoria Secret roll, and the Pickle Me roll were my top three favourites. A bit pricey, but so very tasty. Take yourself there as a treat and enjoy every bite!


Great staff who were very attentive! But compared to the many other Japanese spots on the island, this was lackluster‚Ä¶ drinks were alright but nothing special. The wild salmon roll spoke to me but in general the offerings were overpriced for what they turned out to be.

name: Ugly Duckling Dining & Provisions
reviews:
Ugh, I really wish I could give Ugly Duckling a 5 star for the food as it was phenomenal - beautifully curated, pure and intense flavours, and gorgeous plating. Portions are to be expected for fine dining.

Service was friendly and professional, and it felt like the entire team worked together on service. It was a unique joy to get to meet the kitchen staff.

Unfortunately, despite all this, the wait times between tasting menu courses verged on unbearable, and brought my overall experience down to a max 4 star. We had a reservation for 8pm and left the restaurant at 1130pm, not by choice. It was fairly obvious that other tables had also felt weary, as we all waited on last courses there was more and more silence across the restaurant. A shame because the execution of food was spectacular, the menu well thought out, but time management matters and I truly have never waited so long between courses ü•∫ Sadly this was the main impression I left with rather than the food.

I‚Äôm hopeful that this issue will be mitigated once they change to tasting menu only. The food deserves to be experienced, but I can‚Äôt see myself returning or recommending anyone wait that long for fine dining.


This may have been the best dinner in my entire life. The tasting menu was inspired. The entire offering was spectacular.


Wow, what an incredible meal! It is hard to find full tasting menus like this in Victoria. I was very impressed by everything I ate.

@Victoria_Foodies


Great little restaurant in Victoria‚Äôs Chinatown with outstanding food and really nice atmosphere.  We had the tasting menu of 7 courses if you count bread and petit fours. The food was absolutely amazing, Chinese milk bread with charred scallion butter, a trio of Chinese street food which include lamb, halibut and a scallop pure beautifully presented to be eaten with chopsticks, then we had cucumber where the water was replaced with champagne, served with thinly sliced albacore tuna, a halibut dish where the halibut was melt in your mouth with a miso buerre blanc, lamb with soybean cassoulet and a delicious dessert with white chocolate toffee sprinkle. Every dish was perfect. The wine list and pairing are also very well done. My only complaint is the timing of the service. A little too long between courses. Service was attentive and the servers were very friendly, but the kitchen needs to tighten up their timing. I love a relaxed pace, but it was just a little too relaxed. Despite that, I highly recommend this restaurant!!! Chef has nailed the food!!


This is a fantastic culinary experience. The dishes were unique and delicious. The staff were very friendly and explained everything.

name: MeeT on Blanshard
reviews:
I love Meet on Main, so naturally, i should love Meet on Blanchard, which i do. But my first visit was less than stellar. It was during the opening phase, so well, i let that one slide. You know all new staff for a new restaurant, you've gotta wait a bit for them to work out the kinks. I've been back for dinner and brunch a bunch more times, and I've had amazing experiences. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed. Food is really great as well, lots on the menu, obviously all vegan, diverse comfort food menu. Service has always been great as well. Love the pink painted duct work.


Dined in with my Wife and 1 year old. We all loved our meals which are large portions! Hearty comfort vegan food that's not greasy ‚ù§Ô∏èDefinitely will be back can't wait to try everything on the menu.
We just had water but the cocktails looked beautiful üòç
Loved the decor and atmosphere, very friendly and accommodating!

* We ordered
Oyster mushroom kalamari
CRISPY BBQ BURGER
MEET-LOVERS SAMMY


Meet is a very interesting place. First off they do not serve any meat products, The food is loaded in flavor and vibrant in color, and alive. My employer said it is the best vegan Burger he has ever had, every place he's been. My meal was spectacular. No words could explain. I ordered the big yum. That's exactly what it was, very delicious. Yum yum yum. I'm definitely gonna go back and I want to bring a date this time There are a lot of people in the city who are missing out Well worth the wait Just stay in line do not leave. You won't regret it.


This place was OK. I will do a sandwich review with two positives and the negative.

The service was really great and we had multiple people help us.

The food was OK and I found my barbeque burger to be inedible. Way too much spicy and sweet BBQ sauce for one burger. My companions said their oyster mushroom burgers were spicy and not the best either. The fries tasted funny, maybe it was oil they use, and the pieces were small and sharp. It‚Äôs not a compliment when the best part of our meals were the side salads. The fried cabbage appetizer we ordered was good; albeit expensive like all food nowadays.

The decor was fun and funky, and I like the location and how there‚Äôs another vegan option for restaurants in Victoria.

I think the meat and potatoes (pun intended) of a restaurant is the food so I won‚Äôt be going back just because of the service and ambience.


Had an incredible meal at their soft opening, the quality of our food was fantastic! Highly recommend the spinach dip starter, it was so cheesy and decadent. Also loved the mushroom kalamari; Our MeeT burger was delicious, love that we had the option of upgrading to a beyond meat patty. The gnocchi with whipped feta was divine, loved my jalape√±o caesar and spicy margarita. The portions are generous, but we still found room for dessert - my husband loved the lemon tart, I had the cookies and cream and it was yummy!

As a bonus the space is very cool and contemporary and absolutely huge with a big city vibe. I can‚Äôt believe we have such a great restaurant in Victoria! Sm looking forward to trying brunch soon!

name: Wind Cries Mary
editorial_summary: Homey restaurant offering refined steak & seafood dishes, plus vegetarian options.
reviews:
Well... this place lived up to the hype... and then some!

Super cool concept here.  Nice room, great staff, food is fantastic.

The family style meal is what brings it home for me (no pun intended).  Let's you enjoy so much more than just your meal... really love this!

I can't wait to go back and enjoy the omakase-like experience where the chef prepares a sampling of their menu items - I can't wait to get back!

Add this to your must-visit list... you won't regret it.


Ummm - where do I even start?

Decor - the whole restaurant is a vibe. The small patio is great for people watching, the front bar area is great for a busier feel, the back part of the restaurant is more intimate, then there is the back patio as well.  It's astounding!

Service - the staff is AMAZING. Very knowledgeable, very personable, and excited about the food and drinks. If you go multiple times (I've now gone five times in five months....) they actually remember you AND the chef makes you a new dish that is NOT on their menu!

Drinks - their extensive wine, cocktail, and mocktail list is divine.  I haven't had a bad glass of anything yet!

Menu - Folks - their menu changes with the season AND what is available from their suppliers.  Which means - it's all fresh. If you are going with two or more people (and you don't mind putting $79 pp) do the Chef's Tasting Menu. Not only is the food high quality, but you get 9 dishes (including a palette cleanser) for that price.  It's all family style (all sharing) AND you get individual tongs for serving.

Make a reservation and head down.

You will enjoy it!!!


Went for dinner with our great friends and we had a great time.  We had the chef's selections and what a fantastic choice. I'm sure it changes frequently but from the salad to main course and the dessert were all fantastic. I would highly recommend the place. Just make sure you go on an empty stomach. It's filling. And make sure if you're going on weekend evenings to make a reservation.


The service here is amazing.... The presentation needs work however the food is excellent! I recommend getting the side dishes. Food can be a bit salty by itself. Our mistake. The dishes were all so flavorful and unique. Highly recommend. Make sure to book ahead


Booked a large group event and everything was absolutely perfect. Shayla was so helpful and accommodating with planning the group booking and set menu. Food allergies were handled with care and attention, the service at the restaurant was impeccable and the food & cocktails were amazing! We‚Äôll definitely be back again!

name: The Palms Restaurant & Lounge
editorial_summary: Stylish venue at the Hotel Rialto offering sophisticated global cuisine & craft cocktails.
reviews:
One of the best places hands down I had visited in Victoria during my vacation!
The service was impeccable, the food was beyond what my taste buds could handle, and the decor was astonishing!
I felt welcomed and the service was fast, sweet, and they were able to handle our dietary concerns (no seafood).

The drinks are very well made and the flavours were absolutely scrumptious.

I highly recommend this place for your next birthday dinner, or fancy date night!


Went for an early dinner and were very well served. Tried several of the vegan items on the menu, and everything was delicious! Roasted dumplings, spaghetti-squash with seasonal vegetables and veg-stuffed ravioli. The chef was very accommodating, which we really appreciated. The blueberry lemonade and mango-mint soda were very good too. Flavourful blood-orange sorbet to finish off. Vegans will be very happy here.


A great place for cocktails! I had the Empress 75 and it was delicious without being too sweet! I ate the Best Ravioli (not pictured) and it was so good. For dessert I had the pecan pie, and it was really tasty but hard to eat with a spoon; ask your server for a fork :)


A simply marvelous experience. Some Seattle friends are here to see Nancy Wilson and after the concert, we stopped in for food and drinks. Server Carla is an absolute delight. She provided perfect suggestions and connected well with everyone.amager Rob visited several times and is extremely personable. The food? Phenomenal. The drinks? Fantastic. The perfect after concert experience.


ü§§ I love this place! The spaghetti squash is in another level!
We were short of time and wanted to eat something before taking the bus to the ferries‚Ä¶ they brought all our food on a timely manner as well as the drinks!
Service was wonderful
The next time I come to Victoria, will definitely eat at this place!!

name: The Old Spaghetti Factory (Victoria)
editorial_summary: Family-friendly chain eatery featuring traditional Italian entrees amid turn-of-the-century decor.
reviews:
I was very impressed that they could accommodate a table of 8 at 5:30 on a Friday so quickly. The restaurant is huge so I understood more as we were seated. The design of the restaurant was good but fairly basic and comfortable. It was very busy but I felt like they did a great job getting food and drinks to us. The value of the food was pretty good and they have a great food and beverage selection. The kids meals were generous and tasty. I had the seafood fettuccine Alfredo and I found it quite watery and bland. My sister has the manicotti and she thought it was good. A good family restaurant with mid to high prices.


Gosh! I tell you their spaghetti is awesome. I don‚Äôt take a picture of my food but, because I was so starving that evening so, I forgot to take some pictures. Everything was absolutely delicious and amazing supper. Their warm bread with whipped garlic butter were top notch! Keep asking them to refill and they bring it up on the table. Always make reservation before otherwise you will be waiting for a long time to get your table. And because they are busy, just be patience and be kind to the waitress. They serve you really well.


It‚Äôs Royal Victoria Marathon tomorrow and it was massive line up in front of the restaurant. They told us 2 hours wait at 6.30pm. We end up leaving but we called back around 7 since we didn‚Äôt find any thing else that would be good the night before our marathon. They actually told us we can come back. By the time we came back we were seated and served.  Great service ! I was impressed


Still a fun experience especially with the everything is included aspect of the meal. Judging by thr crowd and people waiting, it's definitely got its fans. The food is as expected, not that bad, but not stellar, everyone should be able to find something they like there.


Food was really good. Service was attentive, knowledgeable, welcoming.

Prices are great and everything-included makes it easy to budget for 4-or-more.

Personnel were great from host to server; seem like they worked well as a team during a busy, busy visit.

On a sunny mid-afternoon I walked in as a single guest. I got taken ahead of walk-in groups of 3+ and large group reservations.

I got visit. Not 'fine dining' but fine enough for me!

Service and customer attention: top-notch 5/5!

name: Thai Green Elephant Restaurant
editorial_summary: Familiar Thai fare, including vegetarian offerings, in a quaint setting with a relaxed ambiance.
reviews:
So delicious, best Thai food in Victoria, I ordered vegetable spring roll, crispy duck, bamboo red curry, they are super delicious, especially the Thai iced tea, it is the best Thai tea I‚Äôve ever tried in Victoria.


Nice cozy restaurant.  Satay Chicken is very good as well as Noodles.. We ordered extra spicy and it was perfect. Nice welcoming staff and lots like a family run business too. Recommended..


Very expensive and underwhelming for what we got which pretty much sums up the Victoria dining experience. Verrrrryy small portions which I don't believe would cut it if it was dining in??? Each dish was basically $20 and this is without rice either


Finally tried this place, it didn‚Äôt quite live up to the reviews. Spring rolls were great. The red curry & the cashew chicken weren‚Äôt bad. The chicken pad Thai was easily the worst I‚Äôve ever had - No flavour and the saddest amount of chicken. I would have returned it if I lived closer.


A great place to eat, with good service, and tasty food.
My only complaint is that they leave the tails on the shrimp when they serve them, but I‚Äôm sure you could ask for the tails off.

name: Fire & Water Restaurant
editorial_summary: Stately bar/eatery at the Victoria Marriott Inner Harbour Hotel with refined steak & seafood plates.
reviews:
M Club lounge was closed at Victoria Marriott Inner Harbour during our 2 nights stay. We were provided breakfast at Fire & Water Restaurant located within the hotel.

The staff recommended ‚ÄúCrab Cake Eggs Benedict.‚Äù We both went with her recommendation. Wow, she was on point! Rich, tasty and melt in your mouth. Hubby loved it so much he ordered it again the next morning. The next morning I ordered ‚ÄúAll Canadian breakfast‚Äù as I love scrambled eggs and chose rye bread, bacon and substituted potatoes with fruit.

I have to say the staff is amazing - attentive, genuine and down-to-earth.

Great breakfast to fuel us for the day full with walking. We ended up needing to walk off the wonderful meal along the harbour. Not a bad start to a day, eh!


Dropped in for a nightcap and between my husband and I we had 6 delicious drinks.  I asked for a espresso martini which was not on the menu and they delivered it with a smile. Sandeep was very knowledgeable about the drinks that was served and made us feel at home. The bartender really is outstanding at his profession as well as quick.  And the restaurant itself is very clean, cozy, and esthetically pleasing to the eye.


We dined here for breakfast twice during our recent stay at the Marriott. The food was quite tasty and the service was even better! I can‚Äôt remember our waitress‚Äô name but she was super friendly, funny and efficient. I would say it‚Äôs a little on the expensive side, especially for breakfast.

Hubby had the omelette both days and enjoyed it. I had the cinnamon French toast one day and the sandwich the other day. Both were good!


I've been very fortunate to be able to try a wide variety of menu options and everything seems to be excellent quality.

The crab cakes eggs benny is a must try!
Very flavorful crab cakes topped with sliced avocado and a perfectly poached egg, tasty potatoes on the side and a creamy and zesty hollandaise sauce to pour over top.

Buffalo chicken wings were thickly breaded and really delicious.

The seafood chowder was filled with yummy bites.

The french toast was amazing! It had so much flavour on it's own but then it was paired with fruits and a cinnamon whip on the side, you hardly have a need for any syrup.

The Reuben was juicy and not overly salty as others can be.

The calamari was a bit odd and the least flavorful thing I tried.

The steak was my absolute favourite dish, perfectly cooked with a delicious flavoured butter and nice crust on the outside and rich sauteed mushrooms.

The fish and chips were exactly what you'd expect and they do have good fries.

The cappuccino chocolate terrine dessert was nice and rich without being overly sweet, despite it missing the raspberry sauce as advertised. The chocolate was smooth and the almond bark on top was crunchy. I'm not actually sure where the cappuccino flavour is meant to be but I'm an espresso addict so I tend to not be able to taste coffee flavours unless they are overly pronounced.


Service, staff and location is great, low volume radio quality music, Driftwood on tap is Top Notch, food is passable: Mango Bourbon BBQ chicken wings - low if any on flavor and also mushie, blue cheese dipping sauce is NOT Blue Cheese dipping sauce. I am sorry, but Marriott is not what it used to be. Happy Hour Menu is misleading, only drinks are included in the Happy Hour, food is not, even though menu is separated into two sections, see image below. I like to eat, I like to drink, I leave good tips, it's not about money, but quite disappointed. Sorry, not sure about my next time in your place.

name: Good Ovening
reviews:
Good tasting and freshly prepared chicken served in a different/unique style. Generous portions for a good price. I enjoyed the churro to finish off the meal as well. The restaurant is relatively new , nicely decorated, and very clean. Service was also good. The 18-28% tip range option on the POS machine is a joke though; please adjust to a more reasonable range or just increase your prices by $1-2.


Chicken tastes great. Overall top quality and reasonably priced. If chicken is your thing this is a great place. They also have pork and other items. Certain will visit again.


I tried many restaurants in Victoria, but the food here was different. They serve delicious food(especially sauce)at reasonable cost. All staff members are very kind and helpful. Also, the restaurant atmosphere was comfortable and romantic. I highly recommend this restaurant and I will certainly visit again shortly.


Been here several times already! The tastiest and moistest chicken I ever had! I also tried the churros and the k-toast, and they were quite good desserts. I‚Äòll definitely visit again üòÑ


I finally had a completely different level of Korean Chicken here. If you want a popular style of Korean Chicken, you must try here. Very reasonable price and the vibe was very nice.

name: Baan Thai Wok & Bar
reviews:
Delicious food and speedy service. The place has a fairly cozy atmosphere and fair portion sizes, hands down the papaya salad was the best thing we had. It's been ages since we've had a good papaya salad with a proper spice to it. Martini was a touch bit on the strong side and don't bother with the coffee if you're looking for a caffeine slap. Overall will definitely be returning next time I'm in town!


Initial seating and getting cocktails was excellent.  Food was disgusting.  Ordered W8 or larb chicken with seasoning and herbs.  No flavour to food.  Looked like dog food/ alpo.  Service was then deplorable.   No one came by to check on meal quality.  Waitresses we noted to be chatting at bar.  Very dissatisfied.  Do NOT recommend.


Nice small and cosy thai restaurant. Service is great all the servers go above and beyond. The food is always cooked so well! Recommend all the soups! Satay chicken, spring rolls, larb, drunken fried rice and also the Tom yum kow pad & som tum (papaya salad) shown in photo üòçüòç


The food and atmosphere is good but if you're ordering for dinner take out or delivery, don't bother. The policy here is that dine-in customers get priority on their orders. Not a strictly bad policy but it leaves take away customers and delivery drivers waiting excessive amounts of time, as in 45 minutes to an hour. I've seen a crowd of delivery drivers and regular take-away customers waiting that long for their orders before dine-in customers would come in, get seated, and served their food in the time span that we were still waiting.
Tonight a take-away customer who was there with me for an hour brought this up to one of the people working there and was told this was the policy and that he just had to be patient as he wasn't there for dine-in. This was also the first I heard of this anywhere and so I wanted to share it.
Great for dine-in though if that's what you're wanting.


Dined in last night and ordered the crispy squid, red curry, and spicy lemongrass fried rice. The food was excellent and some of the best Thai food I‚Äôve ever had in Victoria . The cocktails were also amazing. Annabell was our server and provided us with excellent customer service. I will definitely be coming back!

name: Fishhook
editorial_summary: Small, comfy standby with a patio showcasing local seafood with Indonesian & French flair.
reviews:
Great Indian-inspired seafood restaurant. Everything we ordered was delicious, tons of flavour and perfectly spiced. Seafood was fresh as well. They also sent my daughter a free bowl of ice cream. Pretty small space so make sure you make reservations or get there early like we did. Would definitely go back.


Wasn't terribly impressed with this place. We tried the homemade sodas which were very strange and we couldn't finish either one.

My wife got the fish and chips. It was overly fried and probably below average for your typical bar.

I got the daily khatch. The seasoning was like average Indian food. Like the kind of stuff you'd get at a $14 all you can eat buffet. The one thing I did like was the Humboldt Squid. It tasted different than normal calamari, was super tasty, and made the whole experience worthwhile. If you're into calamari and seafood and never had Humboldt Squid, this is worth going to. Otherwise I'd recommend passing.


Amazing little restaurant we visited three times.
West coast seafood mixed with East Indian. Great combinations of flavors  and textures.
We had the house chowder and a salmon biriani. Both dishes tasted really good.
Great service and atmosphere.
We will be back!!


So happy we got to eat here before we left Victoria. Fresh seafood and Indian flavors are the perfect pair. The vindaloo mussels and chowder were delicious, wish we ordered some more of the baguettes to sop up that yum. I think the soups could've used more body but they were really good regardless. The fish and chips was a hit with the kiddos, loved the light and crispy batter and the curry aioli.

The staff were really friendly too and service was quick despite being busy (in the middle of the afternoon!). Def worth a stop if you're in the area


Fantastic Indian Seafood fusion spot. So much flavor. Chowder is not the creamy kind, which I liked. Seafood pot was super flavorful. Very unique, very tasty

name: Le Petit Chef - Victoria
reviews:
Not usually one to leave reviews but I was absolutely BLOWN away by the incredible service provided by Travis. He is an absolute rock star. The atmosphere was phenomenal and the food was delicious (thank you chefs and kitchen staff). What an incredible experience.


We absolutely LOVED Le Petite Chef!! The food was to DIE FOR; Travis provided unparalleled service; and the whole experience was so unique and cool! Our entire family loved every minute of it ‚ô•Ô∏è


Gabbi and Travis gave the best service we have ever had! Very informative and engaging. The food is to die for. Everything was perfection! The show was so fun to watch! Highly highly recommend.


Had an amazing night!! Food was incredible! Waiters - Gabby and Travis - were so attentive and personable - the most fun at a dinner you could ask for! Enjoy the show! Totally immersive and fabulous experience!


The experience overall was amazing! Really great venue and courses, not to mention the show! The entire experience lasted approximately 2 hrs and I considered it to be worth its value. The service from Gabbi and Travis was outstanding as well as from the rest of the staff. I highly recommend taking a chance on this experience as my Girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed it and I believe it is something that is needed more in Victoria.

name: Romeo's
reviews:
This restaurant had a nice atmosphere and there was not a wait to get seated. Was decently quick on getting our meals to us and they tasted pretty good. I quite enjoyed that the fries were not too salty. Will come back with family to this place.


My co-worker told me this place isn‚Äôt as good as it used to be so I came here with low expectations. I was surprised that the restaurant is very nice and wide inside. Good location, not busy and quick service. Foods were much better than I expected, especially the bread came with the pasta. I also love that instead of pepper and salt, they have chili flake and cheese on the table instead. I would definitely be back to try other things on the menu


Take out for 2 pizzas was an awesome experience. Quick and easy placing the order over the phone, pizza was hot and ready right when they said it would be, and the pizza itself was delicious! It was a great deal and we will definitely be back. Finally- a good place to get pizza downtown!


The rice bowl was a disappointment to say the least. I can accept the sweet sticky flavour and the degree of spice what I can‚Äôt accept is the over cooked chicken it was really dry and hard to chew. Once again Romeo‚Äôs disappoints.


Just ordered baked fettuccini Alfredo and ribs and fettuccini side, all I‚Äôve got to say is awful. Noodles stuck together in clumps of 3-4, hard to the bite. Like so far hard and stuck together I‚Äôve never had a noodle of any kind from a restaurant worse. The ribs seemed steamed and tough. Like they weren‚Äôt cooked with any sort of compassion or care to how it went out. Waste of $60

name: Upstairs Seafood & Oyster Bar (Ferris')
editorial_summary: Set above a street-level grill, this quaint seafood spot offers a changing menu.
reviews:
Recommended by a friend fr Vancouver.  We were greeted at the door pleasantly, very accommodating host, we were seated at the oyster bar section, another section is the tapas bar.  Good ambience, with some really nice art work on the brick wall, with an open kitchen where there‚Äôs also chairs where you can sit.  We were seated by the window, and we have a very nice and accommodating server, her name is Lilly. She‚Äôs very nice and can joke around. It was a nice experience dining in this restaurant,  Highly recommended.  Thank you for the great hospitality and for the great food! We will be back!


Ferris‚Äô is a fantastic little spot that‚Äôs become my go-to when in Victoria. A fantastic selection of oysters and other dishes in a quaint little spot upstairs. On my most recent visit we enjoyed the set menu with wine pairings as part of Dine Around Victoria and were very pleased with all the dishes offered and the service was fantastic as always. Definitely recommend a reservation as it‚Äôs a small place!


Like this place! It‚Äôs located in the heart of Downtown in one of the beautiful old houses right upstairs. They have cool interior design with authentic pictures and you even can buy some of them. We tried their top-ratting linguine pasta with clams and duck.. both were super tasty! Highly recommended for romantic date or just a nice dinner with friends/family


Food here was very good. Oysters were super fresh and were a very good price during happy hour. I had the Black Cod and it was very good. Cod was cooked very well and as well as the scallops. Great place for good seafood.


Loved the food, especially scallops and bouillabaisse. Oysters are fresh, but smaller than what served up the island. Overall, very happy with the experience.

The staff was very nice to us.

name: La Taquisa
editorial_summary: Build-your-own tacos & burritos with vegan options & locally sourced meats in a vibrant space.
reviews:
This is the place to go if you want delicious Mexican food! Excellent every time we go, I recommend the chicken mole burrito. Lots of spice levels and flavour profiles to choose from if you like a lot or a little.

The staff is absolutely great - friendly, helpful and patient.

Nice indoor eating space, but options to sit outdoors in the front on the street or in the courtyard at the back (we didn‚Äôt know it was there the first time we came!).


We tried this place for the first time today and were excited, given reviews and the lovely service when we arrived. They were out of limes, which is fine as we thought the ones at home should work fine.

We ordered two 5 taco deals with a mix of beef, fish and shrimp to try them out. We came home and opened the box and were shocked by what we found. Tacos with barely any toppings, fish ripped to shreds, little to no seasoning or toppings on the beef and some of the tacos were under-cooked. They were basically tacos with a bit of some sauce and pieces of shredded lettuce. That too with unseasoned meat and ripped oily breaded fish. We were very disappointed, as I was personally looking forward to having tacos tonight. Bummer. Did like their salsas and Valentino sauce was nice and spicy, but the tacos themselves are underwhelming compared even to other places we‚Äôve tried in the city. Again, bummer as the staff was nice.


Authentic Mexican food, like for real. I had a giant burrito with Beef Al Pastor. The meat was so soft and tasty, combined with marvelous beans and cheese that are nothing like you would ever experience at a Tex-Mex Americanized place.

Now the salsa, oh boy the green salsa, savory salsa made just right to be flavourful while still mild. I combined that with some sour cream, perfect match for me. I could eat a whole meal of just chips with this.

A friend of mine ordered their small quesadillas and they looked just as good, I can't wait to try some next time.


Thank you so much for catering our office luncheon today! The setup was very nicely done and the food was wonderful.  Everyone asked me where I ordered the food from.  For the first time out of all the monthly lunches, I didn't have any leftovers. Unfortunately, I couldn't take pictures of all the food but I managed to get a few. Look at that guacamole!!! 


I visited day before yesterday. I love such a welcoming staff and friendly customer service. And on top of that food was so delicious. I am vegetarian and it is difficult to find tasty option in Victoria, but La Taquisa is one of the best place for veg people like me. I would highly recommend to try Tortila soup. ü´∂üèº

name: Sookjai Thai Restaurant
editorial_summary: Colorful, low-key eatery offering typical Thai mains such as pad Thai & curry, plus lunch specials.
reviews:
Wow!! Amazing quality of food and a really exotic palette of flavors‚Ä¶ Thai food this good is hard to come by. Truly artesanal in craftsmanship both visually and in taste. Also, plentiful serving sizes!

The servers were nothing but friendly and had wonderful suggestions. The only complaint I had was that with menu offerings at these prices, it seems a bit gimmicky to charge extra for things like plain rice‚Ä¶ while I understand charging for it, I think it should come with the larger curry dishes, especially considering the already steep pricing.

Nonetheless, a really memorable restaurant experience and this place is often packed to the tee - expect a long wait and come hungry!


We showed up about 20 minutes before close and asked if we were too late to be sat. They let us right in. Staff was so welcoming, fun, and helpful the entire night. And the food was amazing!! We especially loved the mango smoothie. Servings large enough for at least 2 meals - you get your money‚Äôs worth here


I cannot put into words how good the food was. Food has no right to be this good. It was otherworldly. The peanut sauce with our satay was rich and flavourful, but the star was the green curry. It was without a doubt, the best I've ever had. I have been lucky to have had many quality green Thai curries in my rather short life....but this easily stole the number one spot. It was out of this world good. The service was good despite how busy it was, and how late we came in, and everyone was happy, and brought their A game. Phenomenal. You're doing yourself a disservice if you DON'T come here while in Victoria. An absolute must for a superb dining experience. My husband, currently rather tipsy after one of their cocktails (the fizzy peach), agrees. NOW SELL YOUR SAUCES IN OTTAWA PLEASE!!! I can't go without for another five plus years... Plane tickets and lodging is expensive, ya know!

Update: We stayed for dessert. Top notch.


We ordered 5 dishes, they looked great but all were too salty for us. But I love the atmosphere here.


WOW! Would return and would highly recommend!! Flavours, freshness, portion sizes are just perfect. Probably the best Thai I have had since living in North America for 18months! Cannot wait to return when back in the area ü§§
We also ordered the Chicken Satay, Fresh Juice, cocktails (not pictured)
Everything was sensational. Come here and have a great experience. Maggie was also an awesome server üòé

name: Fisherman's Wharf Park
editorial_summary: Visitors can see seals & other marine life along this quaint floating pier with food kiosks & shops.
reviews:
A popular tourist attraction on the Victoria waterfront, near the floating homes (not houseboats). There are multiple food vendors, some of which also sell alcohol. Not all businesses were open on a Sunday evening.

Expect crowds, but a fun spot to find and enjoy the waterfront, especially at sunset.

Water taxis available to take you anywhere around the harbor for $12/person one way. There is a parking lot near the children's playground.

The area is walking distance to Old Town.

There is one restroom on the dock.


Man,we loved this place!!! Great tiny little restaurants and bars on the water across from a marina. Heads up, some of these quaint little houses are available through Air BnB so check before you book a hotel. You can walk right into the heart of the city from there. Beautiful views at night when all the lights come on. Worth the visit. You will need at least three or more days to take in all that is offered in this city. Enjoy!


Lovely place with colourful buildings on the water. In the place you can see restaurants, ice cream shop, galleries and houses. There are public washrooms in the place. Really nice atmosphere. Next to the place there is a big lawn and small playground. There is a pay parking lot and free parking spots on the street. Highly recommended to visit here.


A popular tourist attraction. There are many shops, and homes on the pier, and also there is a beautiful park as well. There are also many places to eat, as well as many ferry/tours in the area. This is one of the best places to go, as there are so many people and it's a very fun place to meet up with your friends. Would recommend!


This is pretty. Unfortunately we were there on a rainy day. I like colors of shops and houses. I wonder what benefit private home owners get bit allowing visitors walk besides their homes? I do not think it is fun to live there were you would be on the public eyes all the time. I liked seeing houses, shops and water taxes, a pretty picture. We had fish and fries and I did not enjoy fish at all. It was fish with very bland batter and was not tasty at all atheist for me.  Overall it is a mist visit place for sure.

name: Mile Zero Monument
reviews:
Beautiful and reserved little rocky beach hiding across from Mile Zero Monument and down a long staircase. No ramps, so not wheels here...! Phone might connect with the US but mostly you get no signal there.


A highly significant monument worth a visit. The start of Trans Canada Highway, running all the way to Newfoundland. Moreover, the start of Terry Fox cross-country run.

Parking is tough when theres a lot of people.


Nice place for friends, family or special someone,
Pet friendly, beautiful nature. Good pictures lover


Had an awesome time walking around the area with my family. Before moving to the island, we traveled from Ontario and stopped at most of the monuments across Canada honoring Terry Fox and his courage to take on this journey. Just steps from the zero mile monument. Beautiful views of the ocean, especially at sunset walking along the beachfront or the trails above. Beacon hill park has some great views up on the hill with the Canada flag üá®üá¶. Got our exercise for sure, along with plenty of fresh air, sunshine üåûand friendly faces..


Amazing views. You feel like you are on the edge of the world.

name: Breakwater Lighthouse
editorial_summary: Massive white lighthouse, built in 1916, with scenic views at the end of a long breakwater walkway.
reviews:
It was a beautiful walk even though it was dark when we got to the lighthouse. We saw some sea lions.

We started our walk from the Parliament to Beacon Hill, then straight to the Breakwater Lighthouse. It was a long walk with my kids, but the views and the route were scenic.

We did not find it very tiring at all. So we will be back here again, but we will try to be early when there is light.

However, the views during the night made us see beautiful lights decorations during this winter holiday.


A perfect spot in downtown Victoria for early morning walks, morning runs or just for some sight seeing with breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean, sea gulls and if you are lucky orcas passing by. Absolutely must visit in Victoria for all. One can see the marine vessels passing by from the lighthouse. Although can get momentarily noisy from the sound of helicopters taking off near by.


I was walking along and noticed this walk way, turned out to be a nice walk to a lighthouse. Goes out into the ocean then at the end of the walk you can enjoy with a seat and beautiful views 360¬∞ of the harbour and skyline of the area.‚ù£Ô∏è Totally worth it for the views and to chill out at.


It's a beautiful little 800km hike one way. You can walk along the bottom edge on the rocks.. beautiful little spot to see marine life


Awesome lighthouse at the end of the breakwater; the walk isn't all too far, definitely worth it to stroll and enjoy the views, water, wind. Perfect spot for a clear sunset view.

name: The Moss Lady
reviews:
A beautiful sculpture hidden in the park. Be sure to find your way to The Moss Lady when you visit the Beacon Hill Park. A sculpture worth admiring.


U can walk and visit this beautiful art any time a day of week freely. Enjoy the resting place while watching the lady


What a beautiful park! Can‚Äôt believe how tame the animals are here.. ducks and geese walking with you down the paths..and seen a family of peacocks as well.. definitely worth a visit.


Nice quiet spot in the park.


Beautiful moss lady definitely recommend taking the time to find her best experience in Vic so far üëç

name: Thunderbird Park
editorial_summary: Outdoor collection of replica totem poles & historic buildings including a convent & carving studio.
reviews:
It's a minimalist location. More of a park with heritage to experience. It's changed over the years. There used to be more totems but things get old and totems are supposed to degrade over time. It's great that our indigenous people have a place to display their heritage. I always enjoy seeing the display here. I hope it continues.


Like the totems and of course worth visiting the place once.. free and just in. The corner of street. U can visit that while walking to beach hill park


What a great collection of amazing Indigenous artwork! There are several totem poles of various designs all within close proximity to one another. If you're in Victoria, you should take the time to walk through the park and check out these totem poles!


Easy walk to, right beside museum and empress.


Interesting poles, some slightly phallic in design üôà

name: Royal BC Museum
editorial_summary: This museum showcases natural wonders like dinosaurs & includes an IMAX movie theatre.
reviews:
Great museum has very nice and extensive exhibits. I went there when they had the wildlife photo-journalism exhibit which was a interesting one. It wasn‚Äôt busy whatsoever but I did go on a rainy Sunday around 3:00. Would definitely recommend going. It also seems like there was a third floor exhibit but for some reason it‚Äôs closed and I don‚Äôt know why. Maybe it will be open sometime in the future.


This is one of the best museums we have visited. It has natural history, art, First People cultural history, and an interactive town/ship/ mine from British colonial history. Really great. Two weeks ago,  that section was closed for remodel. I'm hoping it is still as awesome as ever when it reopens.


Great place to visit and learn about the ice age and stuff. They even had a showing of covid portraits which was cool.

Likes: it was cheap. $5 per person and it was absolutely worth it. Lots to see and learn.

Dislikes: Nothing I can think of


This is such an awesome experience! I enjoyed the Orcas exhibit ü•∫‚ù§Ô∏è I loved how they explained things such as climate change, global warming, plastics, saving our mother nature. This touched our hearts.
So far, this is the best museum I have ever been in. I will never forget my experience here and will definitely be back again ‚ù§Ô∏è
I thank everyone who made this possible, the effort you put into this is very much appreciated. The setup was amazing, everything is interactive and educational. There is also a great collection about indigenous people which are all so inspiring. But, of course the best of all, the natural history of BC. From historical to current records of all living things. Information after information after information, it‚Äôs crazyyy but we love it! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

You can buy tickets online to avoid the line up. But, staff here are so fast so you wouldn‚Äôt really feel like you‚Äôre waiting. üòä


A well curated museum.A must visit when in Victoria.
Right now though only the nature history wing is open and tickets as low as  $5 is being charged.

Will like to visit when the renovations are over to look at the rest of their fabulous collections.

name: Moss Rock Park
reviews:
This is a hidden gem in Victoria, one of the most beautiful places for sunrises or sunsets, and it's right in the city. Park down at Sir James Douglas school if it is outside of school hours. The then walk up Masters street.


This park is truly a hidden gem, hiding amongst the back streets of downtown Victoria, this dwarf mountain makes up for a spectacular view of the city, and our neighbouring country MURICA. There are no paths to the peak, making the journey difficult for the physically abled and only for the most extreme wheelchair enthusiasts.


One of my favourite places to take friends when I show them Victoria. Parking isn‚Äôt a problem when you roll like this üòâ


Best kept secret. Grand views out to see and bracing on a windy day.


It was a bit hard to find the street entrance when following Google maps so we accidentally went up the wrong way and found ourselves in someone's yard. That was awkward. But the view is amazing and sitting up there watching the sunset was definitely a trip highlight. Plus, so many lovely kinds of moss to admire!

name: Cadboro-Gyro Park
editorial_summary: Oceanfront park with a sandy beach, picnic areas, playground & tennis courts, plus a boat launch.
reviews:
Amazing beachfront park with soft sand and a great playground. Perfect for a picnic with several tables. An ideal place for families with kids. The playground has swings for little kids and big kids, a few climbable sea monsters and sea creatures, and a great pirate ship with a plank! Most importantly, there is a washroom right next to the play area with water bottle refill station and rinse-off station for sandy little toes. Our son loved this park and so did we!


One of the best playgrounds I‚Äôve been to! Octopus slides, whale and sea serpent climbing structures, and many more ocean-themed original creations. The beach itself is sandy and clean. What a beautiful park!


Beautiful park and beach. It has everything that a family can enjoy. I can spend a whole day in that park. Love that they also have zipline.


Our favourite beach and park to visit when in Victoria. While busy at times, the beach has a tranquil vibe. Great for kids and for chill get-togethers with friends and family.


Cadboro Gyro Park is a great place to visit in Victoria, British Columbia. It has a beautiful beach with soft sand and a section for dogs and another section for kids to play without dogs. The playground is really fun and boasts a kiddie zip line. There are also picnic tables and a large grassy area with washrooms.¬†It‚Äôs a great family park at the beach with free parking lot

name: Rainforest Tours
reviews:
We did a full day hike at the Southern Juan de Fuca trails (Mystic Beach). It was great! Toni was a well-organized, nice, and insightful guide.

We could have rented a car and planned our own exploration of trails near Victoria. But booking the Rainforest Tour was a great decision. We didn't need a car for the rest of our trip, so it would be an unnecessary expense and hassle. It was also much nicer to have someone drive us! Plus, Toni knew the best places to stop for a break and snack en route and the best trails to see. The experience was made simpler and stress-free by booking the tour. All we had to do was arrive at the pick up spot (Tourist Information booth at the Harbour) and enjoy the day. A key feature for us was that it was a small group (max 6 people).

Mystic Beach was an enjoyable destination. The trail is a good balance between nature walk and hike. There are areas where you have to mind your footing, so it is best to wear good shoes or even hiking boots. I wore good walking shoes and was fine. If you are not an experienced hiker, it should be no problem; just take your time and you'll be fine. This is a great day trip for all skill levels.

There was a heat wave the week we did the tour. It was ok in the trails: the tree canopy and ocean breeze created a very comfortable experience.

Next time we are in Victoria we will book again to see the old growth forests in the Northern Juan de Fuca trails.


Gorgeous day hike outside of Victoria in a section of the Juan de Fuca trail. A fun experience that included a suspension bridge, beach waterfall, tide pools, and unique rock formations.
